did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle: Archibald Woods Papers, 1777-1893, 1783-1846.
did.abstract: Papers, chiefly 1783-1846, of Archibald Woods of Ohio County, West Virginia. The papers concern his family, the Poage family, and the Houston family, as well as his business dealings.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Archibald Woods Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p:
Gift: 2,674 items, 11 May 1940.
Gift: 101 items, 2 January 1942.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: A Federalist, Woods served in the Virginia House of Delegates and was a member of the Virginia Convention of 1788. He briefly served in the Revolutionary War and later was an officer of the Virginia militia, attaining the rank of colonel before resigning in 1816. Woods was president and a director of the North Western Bank of Virginia. He owned a flour mill, traded whiskey and leased out land. One of the founders of Woodsfield, Ohio, Woods was a land speculator in the military warrant land in the Northwest Territory and bought public land in Ohio and Indiana in addition to having extensive holdings in West Virginia. He was also either a principal or involved in some way with lawsuits to either settle land disputes or to collect money. He promoted the building the Cumberland Road which passed through Wheeling.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers, chiefly 1783-1846, of Archibald Woods of Ohio County, West Virginia. The papers concern his family, the Poage family, and the Houston family, as well as his business dealings. Correspondents include Levi Barber, Daniel Call, Philip Doddridge, Chapman Johnson, Henry Lee, James Pindall, Benjamin Ruggles, Daniel Sheffey and John Tyler, Edgar Campbell Wilson, George Washington Wilson and Thomas Wilson.

Subjects dealt with in the collection include banking, cholera, the Cumberland Road, land speculation, pioneer life near Wheeling, West Virginia and in Kentucky and Indiana, formation of and early days in Belmont and Monroe counties, Ohio (including the founding of Woodsfield, Ohio), the Northwest Territory, Indians of North America, family life, marriage and courtship, Virginia militia during peacetime and in the War of 1812, Ohio politics, sale of slaves and the Whiskey Rebellion.
There are also letters of members of the Baker and Morgan families of Fauquier County, Virginia and Wheeling, West Virginia which concern life in St. Louis, Missouri during the 1840's.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged chronologically by date.

did.unittitle: Appointment of Andrew Woods as sheriff of Botetourt County, Virginia, signed by Patrick Henry, 18 October 1777.
Deed for sale of 440 acres of land in Kentucky County [Kentucky] by Julius Saunders to Andrew Woods, recorded by Levi Todd, 7 April 1779.

Certificate of land patent to Abraham Vanmetre for 1400 acres of land in Yohogania County [Pennsylvania], signed by Francis Peyton, Phil[ip] Pendletonand Joseph Holmes and witnessed by Sam[ue]l Irwin.Entered with H. Crawford S[urveyor]Y[ohogania] County,3 February 1780.
Bill of sale from James halters to Archi[bald] Woods,witnessed by And[re]w Woods,4 August 1783.
Bond of James halters to Archi[bald] Woods,15 September 1783.

scopecontent.p: Offering his military warrant and pay for service in the [US] Continental Army in lieu of money owed Woods. Witnessed by And[re]w Woodsand Alley [?] McKee. Affidavit by Ebenezar Lane.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of an agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsand George Stricker, 29 December 1783.

scopecontent.p: Concerning land to be located and patented by military warrants and divided between the two men.

did.unittitle: Land grant to Andrew and Archibald Woods for 300 acres in Lincoln County [Kentucky], 20 April 1784.

Hugh and David Barclay, Rockbridge County, 22 February 1785.

scopecontent.p: Bill of sale to Martha Woods, Botetourt County, 1 negro girl.

did.unittitle: Bond of Samuel Todd and Nicholas Carper of Botetourt County, Virginia with Martha Woods, 6 May 1785.

Power of attorney of John Poage of Augusta County, [Virginia], to Archibald Wood[s],9 November 1785.

scopecontent.p: Concerning land purchased from the military claims of James Ludlow, James Letort and And[re]w Fowlerwho served in "the old Virginia Regiment under Governour Dinwiddie's Proclamation."

did.unittitle: B[?] Bradford, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 6 April 1786.

scopecontent.p: Concerning land on the Kanawha River.

did.unittitle: Entry by Abraham Nelson for 1000 acres of land [in Kentucky], 6 June 1786.
Bond of Presley Nevill of Washington County, Pensilvania [Pennsylvania] with Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia] for land in Ohio County. 18 July 1786.

scopecontent.p: Nevill was att[or]neyfor W[illia]m Croghan.Witnessed by Jo[h]n Beaverand [?] Heth.

did.unittitle: Bond of Archibald Woods of Ohio County, Virginia with Presley Nevill ( att[orne]yfor W[illia]m Croghan) Washington County, Pennsylvania, 18 July 1786.
Land patent issued by P[atric]k Henryto Martha (Poage) Woods by treasury warrant for 461 acres in Lincoln County [Kentucky], 14 August 1786.
Bonds of Archibald Woods with Benjamin Atkins and Elizabeth Shearor (administrators of the estate of John Shearor), 16 September 1786.
Garland Kerr, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia.], to David Enix on Ten Mile, 5 April 1787.

scopecontent.p: Concerning agreement with [Archibald] Woods. Including, ADS, agreement between Kerr and Woods, 6 November 1786. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Moses Chaplaine, n.p. to Archibald] Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 December 1787.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a list of land and people which was prepared for the audition.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Poage,Mr. G[?], n.p., to Archib[al]d Woods,Ohio County, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1787.

scopecontent.p: Concerning horses. Including A.N. concerning equipment and uniforms for those who join a calvery company. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Elijah Poage, n.p., to Arch[iba]ld Woods,n.p., 29 January 1787.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a trip to Richmond.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Kelleyto Isaac Kelley, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 16 February 1787.

scopecontent.p: Mentions bonds and the postponement of a trip to Ohio County.
Including N by an unidentified person, n.d., concerning genealogical matters. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Bill of sale from Abraham Byrd, Rockingham County, Virginia to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], for a stud horse, "Leopard." Bond of Archibald Woods with Abraham Byrd, 23 February 1787.
Promissory note of Wil[lia]m Johnson,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,13 March 1887.

scopecontent.p: Including AN, March 1790, of Johnson with Woods. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Christian Keener, Baltimore [Maryland], to Archibald Woods, Wheelan [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 May 1787.

scopecontent.p: Concerning 1000 acres of land in West Virginia.

did.unittitle: Agreements between Benjamin Eakins [Akins] and Archi[bal]d Woods,1 June 1787.

scopecontent.p: Concerning the locating and surveying of land in Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia].

did.unittitle: Wm. McMachen [McMechen], n.p., and Arch[ibal]d Woods,Richmond, [Virginia], to James Wood, Lieut. Governour [(sic) Richmond, Virginia], 3 December 1787.

did.unittitle: Bills of sale from Geo[rge] Sampson,Northampton County, Virginia, to Archi[bal]d Woods,15 December 1787.

scopecontent.p: For 2 slaves, a boy named Littleton and a girl named Pink.

scopecontent.p: They were trustees to establish an academy in either Monongalia, Ohio, Harrison or Randolph counties.

did.unittitle: Documents, 10 July 1788- 1 September 1788.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a petition to have a ferry across the Ohio River at Short Creek signed by Nathaniel Coolman and John Vanmetre.

did.unittitle:
John Steinmetz,
Philad[elphi]a,[Pennsylvania], to James Caldwell, Harrison County [now West] Virginia, 14 July 1788.

scopecontent.p: Concerning patents for 10,000 acres of land. Including D of a petition concerning taxation. 1 page.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Botetourt County, [Virginia], 15 July 1788.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Indians, land taxes owed by [?] Todd, land dispute between [?] Carper and [?] Moor [Moore], treaty [made by Arthur St. Clair at Fort Harmar] with Indians.

did.unittitle: Charles Lewis, Land Office, Richm[on]d,[Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 30 July 1788.

scopecontent.p: Concerning land in Ohio County.

did.unittitle: Bill of sale (witnessed by Elijaza[?] M'Clandhan and John Poage) from Tho[ma]s Poageto Archi[bal]d Woods,7 March 1789.

scopecontent.p: For a female slave named Phetis.

did.unittitle: James Ross, Washington [Pennsylvania], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 April 1789.

scopecontent.p: Concerning money owed to A. Kirkpatrick by Woods.

did.unittitle: Power of attorney (witnessed by Archi[bal]d Woodsand Anna (Poage) Woods) from Stephen May to Robert Woods, 7 September 1789.

scopecontent.p: To transfer 331 1/2 acres of land in Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Will[ia]m McClandhan.

did.unittitle: W. Ward, Fayette [County Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, Richmond, [Virginia], 12 September 1789.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Woods' desire to purchase land. Says "our politics are loose, vague, various, and uncertain." Advises Woods to not reject his mother's "precepts because she is a female good sense is the result of a Sound mind which would as soon inhabit a female body as a male. There is no sex in souls."

did.unittitle: Bond (witnessed by Mathew Wilson and Mary Wilson) of Samuel Todd with the executors of the estate of And[re]w Woods,22 September 1789.
Bill of sale (witnessed by Willia]m Price, Jr.and Arch[ibal]d Woods) from Henry Guy, Northampton County, [Virginia] to Robert Woods, 29 October 1789.

scopecontent.p: For female slave named Lila.

did.unittitle: Agreement, (Witnessed by David Denny, Will[ia]m Dennyand Isaac Kelley) between John McFarland, And[re]w Woodsand Archi[bal]d Woods,25 December 1789.

scopecontent.p: To convey 400 acres of land [in Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to McFarland.

did.unittitle: T[homas] Wilson,Margantown [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 3 January 1790.

scopecontent.p: Mentions George Strickler concerning military warrant lands in West Virginia and Kentucky and the non-attendance of Andrew Woods and Archibald Woods as court jurors.

did.unittitle: Henry Bedinger, Shepherds Town [Virginia] [West Virginia] to William Shepherd, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 March 1790.

scopecontent.p: Asking Shepherd to give him preference if he decides to sell his mill and house.
Including, N, of Bible verses in a different hand. 1 page.

did.unittitle: David Mitchell, Hampshire [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to John Lee, Hagerstown, [Maryland], 8 April 1790.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Mitchell's land in Kentucky.
Including, ALS, John Lee, Hagerstown, [Maryland], to A[rchibald?] Woods.1 page.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Wilson,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 April [17]90.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Woods' misfortunes, religion, a dispute with [?] Crawford and his baptism of Jenny St. Clair McCulloch.

did.unittitle: J[ame]s Poage,n.p., to Archibald Wood[s],Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], [3 June 1790].

scopecontent.p: Discusses a move to Kentucky, the death of John Crawford and [William] Wilson.

did.unittitle: Elijah Poage, n.p., Archibald Wood[s],Ohio County near Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 June 1790.

scopecontent.p: Describing Kentucky and Woods' contemplated move there.

did.unittitle: Abram Chapline, Mercer County [Kentucky?], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 July 1790.

scopecontent.p: Concerning land prices in Kentucky near Lexington and Danville.

did.unittitle: Elijah Poage, n.p. to Arch[ibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 July 1790.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Woods' possible move to Kentucky and the price of renting land there.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Poage,[Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 31 July 1790.

scopecontent.p: Concerning family news and Poage's opinion of Kentucky.

scopecontent.p: Concerning religion and family news.

did.unittitle: Henry Walker, Botetourt [County, Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 13 September [17]90.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Kentucky.

scopecontent.p: Mostly concerns religion and family news.

scopecontent.p: Discusses family and neighborhood news including the marriage of Polly Stuart to Ned Hall.

scopecontent.p: Discusses his business affairs and family news.

scopecontent.p: Telling Woods to be ready with his party of horses if he receives orders.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Wilson,Augusta [County, Virginia] to Archibal]d Wood[s],Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 May 1791.

scopecontent.p: Expressing concern over Indian threats to frontier. Tho[ma]s Poagehas entered Presbytery as candidate for ministry. Discusses religion in Prince Edward and Charlotte. Cousin John Crawford is dead.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woodsand [Ann (Poage) Woods], Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 2 July 1791.

scopecontent.p: Concerning his judicial circuit and news of mutual friends in Augusta and Rockbridge [County, Virginia].

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Wilson,Augusta [County, Virginia], to Archibald Wood[s],Ohio County, Virginia, [West Virginia], 8 July 1791.

scopecontent.p: Containing religious advice, and concerning the role of feelings in religion.

did.unittitle: David Cloyd, n.p., to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 August 1791.

scopecontent.p: Concerning money.

did.unittitle: [?] to [?], 17 September 1791.

scopecontent.p: Probably concerning Archibald Woods.

scopecontent.p: Requesting that Woods take the deposition of David Harbinson as evidence in the lawsuit of Kelly vs. Wilson.

did.unittitle: [Thomas Wilson], Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio [County, now West Virginia], 21 September 1791.

scopecontent.p: Concerns family news.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Robert and Ja[me]s Poage) between Rob[er]t Poageand Archi[bal]d Woods,12 November 1791.

scopecontent.p: To convey from Woods to Poage 100 acres of land [in Botetourt County, Virginia?] and memorandum of money borrowed form Archi[bald] Woodsby [James Poage].

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d woods,Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 February 1792.

scopecontent.p: Saying he has declared himself a candidate for the Virginia Senate and asking Woods' help.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Jackson,Harrison County [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archabled [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 26 March 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning rations for a militia company and Jackson's campaign for Congress.

did.unittitle: D[avid] Cloyd,Kenhawa [Kanawha County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 May [1792?].

scopecontent.p: Concerns a move to Kentucky by Cloyd.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,Chambers Burgh [Chambersburg, Pennsylvania], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 June 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning supplies.

did.unittitle: Robert Wilson, n.p., to William Wilson, Augusta [County, Virginia], 1792 June 22.

scopecontent.p: Describing his school under Mr. Graham.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Wilson,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 11 July 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning his travels among the [Presbyterian] churches. Gives Woods advice.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Poage,n.p., to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 28 July 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a possible move by Woods to Kentucky. Seat of government may be Lexington.

did.unittitle: Thomas Pettit, n.p., to Archable [Archibald] Wood[s],10 August 1792.

scopecontent.p: Requesting that Woods pay bearer money.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by George Demento and John McKnight) between William Peck and Archi[bal]d Woods,7 September 1792.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Griffith,William Griffith, Charles Prather, Alex[ander] Wellsand Geo[rge] Whiteto Charlestown [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, 7 September 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a proposed division of Ohio County.

did.unittitle: Ebenezer [Zane], W[h]eeling[Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archabald [Archibald] Wood[s],Richmond, [Virginia], 18 September 1792.

did.unittitle: Ebenezer Zane, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Charles] Wells and [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 20 September 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerns division of Ohio County.

did.unittitle: Ann [(Poage)] Wood[s],Mr. Wilson's [Augusta County, Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Wood[s],Richmond, [Virginia], 27 October 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning family news.

did.unittitle: Bond (witnessed by George Baxter and W[illia]m Z Vereker?)of Archi[bal]d Woodsand John Davis, 15 November 1792.

scopecontent.p: Promising to furnish troops to the state from Ohio, Harrison, Monongalia, and Randolph counties, [Virginia] [West Virginia].

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Wm. J. Vereker and George Baxter) between Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia] and John Davis of Monongalia County, Virginia, 15 November 1792.

scopecontent.p: To furnish troops.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Tho[ma]s Wilson,Richmond [Virginia], [1792] December 11.

scopecontent.p:
Describing Indian activities, the difficulty of securing provisions because of Anthony Wayne's levies near
Pit[t]sburgh,[Pennsylvania], and possible Congressional candidates.

did.unittitle: Henry Lee, Richmond, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 December 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning two companies of Rangers.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Wood[s],Wheelling [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia] to James Wood, 29 December 1792.

scopecontent.p: Concerning activities of and provisions for Ohio County Rangers and mentions Anthony Wayne.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m McCleery,Monongalia County [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 January 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning McCleery's candidacy for U.S. Congress.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by John McKnight and David McWilliams) between Richard Yeates and Archib[al]d Woods,22 January 1793.

Including copy of the above DS. 1 page.

scopecontent.p: For a female slave named Lila.

did.unittitle: Power of attorney, 22 January 1793.

scopecontent.p: (Witnessed by John McKnight, David McWilliams, Jacob Lusk and Hugh McGuire) from Richard Yeates, appointing John McInyre to act in conveying 304 acres of land in Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods.

did.unittitle: Bond, 22 January 1793.

scopecontent.p: (Witnessed by John McKnight and David McWilliams) between Archibald Woods and Richard Yeates to ensure that Woods will convey 461 acres of land in Lincoln or Madison County, Kentucky to Yeates.

did.unittitle: Bond, 22 January 1793.

scopecontent.p: (Witnessed by John McKnight and David McWilliams) between Archibald Woods and Richard Yeates to ensure that Yeates will convey 304 acres in Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Woods.

did.unittitle: James Breckinridge, Botetourt [County, Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 February 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning the collection of money owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: A. Kirkpatrick, Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 March 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning [William] Croghan, a proposed treaty with Indians, and relations with the British.

did.unittitle: John Steele, Richmond, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, West Liberty [Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 March 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Indian threats to the frontier.

did.unittitle: A. Kirkpatrick, Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 April 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a lawsuit and including a copy of a letter, 27 March 1793, from Thomas Duncan, Carlisle, [Pennsylvania] to Messrs, Wallace and Kirkpatrick.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Samuel McColloch) between Arch[ibal]d Woodsand Richard Yeates, 25 April 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning money owed by Woods to Yeates.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheelling [Wheeling, West Virginia], to Mother [i.e., Martha (Poage) Woods]. James Poage near Lexington, [Kentucky], 29 April 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning the altering of a deed from Woods to Jane Yeates instead of to Richard Yeates.

did.unittitle: David Cloyd, Rockbridge [County, Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 3 [May] 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Cloyds' inability to sell his land in order to pay Woods for land bought from him.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Morris,Boat Yard, [Kanawha River, West Virginia], to [?] Cloyd, 13 May 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning money owed to Cloyd by Morris.
Including Df of ALS from Archi[bal]d Woodsto [?] Dunlap concerning Woods' dissatisfaction with a horse he purchased from Dunlap. 1 page.

did.unittitle: William Morris, Boat Yard, Kanawha [River, West Virginia] to Archi[bal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 May 1793.

scopecontent.p: Concerning payment of money owed to Woods for flour and whiskey.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,15 May [l7]93.

scopecontent.p: Concerning money owed to Woods by Reed Lower.

scopecontent.p: Has a description of life in Kentucky and discusses the split in the Transylvania Presbytery between the followers of Adam Rankin and the rest of the Presbyterians.

scopecontent.p: Concerning an execution against [?] Wood and McConnell and other lawsuits.

did.unittitle: Richard Yeates, Burbun, [Bourbon] County, [Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, 26 August 1793.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Poage,n.p., to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], [1793?]

scopecontent.p: Concerning the [Whiskey Rebellion.]

did.unittitle: Subpoena, from Rob[er]t McClureto Arch[ibal]d Woodsand John Morgan, 25 November 1794.

scopecontent.p: To appear as witnesses in the examination of William McKinley, [one of the participants in the Whiskey Rebellion].
Includes ALS from Archi[bal]d Woods to McClure in response. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Ro[ber]t McClure,Ebenezer Zane, Ro[ber]t Woods,Zac. Sprigg, to Ben[ja]m[in] Biggs,22 November 1794.

scopecontent.p: Saying the justices of the peace had decided not to examine [the participants in the Whiskey Rebellion] "on considering the situation of this County and the temper of the people ...as we are of the opinion it would have answered no valuable purpose, and our authority it would evidently appeared to us would have been treated with contempt."

did.unittitle: Nancy Woods [Montgomery County, Virginia] to son Andrew Woods, Jr., Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], [1795?].

scopecontent.p: Saying he has seen a petition against the taking of land west of the Ohio [Northwest Territory]. Brown has finished building the cabins for Woods.

scopecontent.p: It is the opinion of several people that Woods' flour is unfit for market. "Mr. Miller states that all the flour in Charlestown, that was made before September is sower [sour] and unfit for market."

scopecontent.p: Hough has checked Woods' land for taxes due.

did.unittitle:
Moses Chapline,
L[ieutenan]t Col[onel], Com[man]d[in]g 4th Virginia R[egimen]t Virginia M[iliti]a,Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 January 1809.

did.unittitle: Cha[rle]s Wells,n.p., to Archa[bal]d [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 16 January 1809.

scopecontent.p: In compliance with order, has militia company together.

scopecontent.p: Wants to meet with Woods to buy land.

scopecontent.p: Offers to settle money owed him in wheat.
Includes ACy. [Archibald Woods] to [George Hancock], concerning slaves Hancock wishes to sell. Woods discusses prices. 1 page.

did.unittitle: C. Johnson, Staunton, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 February 1809.

scopecontent.p: An application was made to change Venue in Woodsvs. Lewis. It failed. Has heard of no application since. Johnson had small pox. Cannot issue subpoena for witness.

did.unittitle: Lease between Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., and Robert Prettyman, n.p., for Prettyman to rent land from Woods, 12 February 1809.
John White, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Major Archibald Woods, at his mill in Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 February 1809.

scopecontent.p: Orders flour.

did.unittitle: S[amuel] Blackburn,Staunton, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 2 March 1809.

scopecontent.p: Gives information and advice on Woodsvs. Lewis.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by John Griffen) between Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and John Edmonds of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], for Edmonds to rent 30 acres of land from Woods, 18 March 1809.

scopecontent.p: Edmonds is to take particular care of the fruit trees and orchard.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 March 1809.

scopecontent.p: Asks what Woods wants him to do in a lawsuit involving land. "We are advised by W[illia]m McKinleythat he has been pressed into the electioneering campaign--the conduct of Gen'l J. G. I--in this respect must be as bad as an English press gang--poor MC is to be pitied."

did.unittitle: P[olly] Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to sister, Mrs. Ann Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 April 1809.

scopecontent.p: Sorry to hear her sister has been unwell, brother Billy's wife has consumption. "Nancy Wilson has two sons. I think she breeds well...I was surprised when Mr. hood informed me that Brother Bob was with you. I should be very glad to see him provided he could be sober and rational."
Includes AL, [Polly Wilson] to [Woods] girls. 1 page.

did.unittitle:
Moses Chapline,
Lieutenant Colonel Comm[an]d[in]g 4th Regt. Virg[inia] Militia,to Major Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 10 April 1809.

scopecontent.p: Ordering Woods to order his Battalion to Wheeling for training.

did.unittitle: M[atthe]w Houston,Natural Bridge, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 April 1809.

scopecontent.p: Undertook to get paper [needed in Woodsvs. Lewis] from Sweet Springs. Found he had to go on to Munroe [Monroe] C.H. Papers not ready. Clerk issued order that he would send papers. Case was docketed in Rockbridge. Subp[o]ena issued for Patrick.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Col. [?] Nicholas, n.p., 19 April 1809.

scopecontent.p: Offers to locate military land for Nicholas' warrant.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Chapline, Jr.,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 April 1609.

scopecontent.p: Wants the patents for the 17,000 acre survey belonging to the partnership, so he can inquire about taxes due on it.

did.unittitle: James Graham, Nellson [Nelson] C[i]ty, Kentucky,to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheelin[g, Virginia] [West Virginia], 18 May 1809.

scopecontent.p: Sickness prevented sending deeds. Asks for money Woods owes him.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,near Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Daniel Sheffey, Member of Congress, Washington, [D.C.], 21 May 1809.

scopecontent.p: Introduces Noah Zane. Zane is the bearer of remonstrances [counteracting] remonstrances from Pennsylvania on the subject of the National road. Describes route the commissioners laid out. Hopes that route will be kept.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of an agreement (witnessed by Archi[bal]d Woods) between John Edmonds and William Edmonds of the one part and Charles Hammond of the other part for William Edmonds to do farming work for Hammond, 4 July 1809.
James Cloyd, St. Clarisville [Ohio], to Uncle Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 July 1809.

scopecontent.p: Wants to borrow money.

did.unittitle: Samuel Hand, n.p., to Archable Woods, at Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 July 1809.

scopecontent.p: Sent receipts which Woods has failed to get. Asks Woods to take "best matters" [action]. Wishes Woods not to be uneasy about the money he owes Woods. Expects to make a payment this fall.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,n.p., to Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., 11 July 1809.

scopecontent.p: "Brother Archibald & myself having made an alteration in our agreement respecting this place on which I live, it is necessary our article in your hands should be destroyed..."

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,near Louisville, [Kentucky], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Whealing, [Wheeling], Ohio [County], Virginia [West Virginia], 9 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: According to list of military claims, there is none due Andrew Robinson. Thanks Woods for paying taxes on his land Ohio County. Asks Woods to continue until land can be sold and try to find purchaser.

did.unittitle: M[athe]w Houston,Natural Bridge [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: [ Woodsvs. Lewis] will probably be tried in September. Papers have not yet arrived.

did.unittitle: [Polly Wilson], n.p., to sister Mrs. Ann Wood[s],Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 16 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: She is pregnant. Had expected a visit this summer.
Includes, ALS, P[olly] Wilson, n.p., to Eliza and Polly Wood[s]. Wants them to write. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Glisson,Morgantown [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p. 17 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: Defends his treatment of Woods' son, Alpheus [in school]. "If Franklin [Woods' other son] to exculpate himself has represented to you that I did not pay the same attention to him, that I did to others, I assure you that he wronged me." Assures Woods he will do all in his power for his improvement. Lists subjects he will be offering.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: Sends Franklin and Aipheus [Woods]home. Defends [Thomas] Glissonas a teacher.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Hough,Chillicothe [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheel[ing, Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: Has omitted entering the land. Lists entries.

did.unittitle:
Moses Chapline,
Lieut[enant] Col[onel] Com[an]d[in]g 4th R[egiment] Virginia Militia,Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Major Archibald Woods, n.p., 29 August 1809.

scopecontent.p: Orders Woods to order his battalion to Wheeling for training.

did.unittitle: James Graham, Nelson County, Kentucky, to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 September 1809.

scopecontent.p: Has sent deed. Please remit money.

did.unittitle: S[amuel] Blackburn,Lexington, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 September 1809.

scopecontent.p: [ Woodsvs. Lewis] has been continued until April. Gen[era]l Breckenridge& [Allen] Taylordid not attend the exposition of Genl Preston. Fears the loss of Sheffey at next term.

did.unittitle: D[aniel] Sheffey,Lexington, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia, 13 September 1809.

scopecontent.p: There has been a continuance in Woodsvs. Lewis. Afraid he can not attend the trial in the spring due to serving in Congress.

did.unittitle: J. M. Walker, B. Buffeloe, to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia]. Lewis has obtained a postponement [in Woodsvs. Lewis], 13 September 1809.
W[illia]m Wilson,Augusta, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archi[bald] Woods,Ohio [County], Virginia, 17 September 1809.

scopecontent.p: Death of Betsy Poage. Summarizes national politics and rumors of Europe.

did.unittitle: C. Johnson, Staunton, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 September 1809.

scopecontent.p: [ Woodsvs. Lewis] is continued. Injunction has been granted. Encloses subpoena.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Slaughter,Bourbon [County], Kentucky, to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 September 1809.

scopecontent.p: Has never heard from Woods about his claims for land in Woods' County. W[illia]m Oldhamwill handle it.

did.unittitle: Jo[h]n Evans,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 11 November 1809.

scopecontent.p: Offers negro slaves for sale, Easther, Harry & Nancy as well as a "lad" and a "girl," 7 years old. Describes their abilities.

did.unittitle: Alex[ande]r Pettit,n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 11 November 1809.

scopecontent.p: Sends commission. "I never wished to hold an office that I was not thought worthy of, if you thought me incapable of discharging my duty or unworthy of promotion I will ask you why did you not communicate your objection to me before the Court Marshall [martial].

did.unittitle: Noah Linsly, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Earl Sproat or Benj[ami]n J. Gilman,12 November 1809.

scopecontent.p: Asks one of them to pay taxes on Arch[ibal]d Woods' land.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods], near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to D[aniel] Shetfey,n.p., concerning Woodsvs. Lewis,13 November 1809.

scopecontent.p: Gives directions in taking Gen[era]l Breckinridge'sdeposition. Recounts proposals from [George] Hancock.Proposes his grounds for a settlement.

did.unittitle: Bond for title (witnessed by Tho[ma]s Woods) from Archi[bal]d Woodsto Henry Young for conveying 160 acres to Young, 5 December 1809.
G[eorge] Jackson,Chillicothe [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 27 December 1809.

scopecontent.p: Gives his price for a slave, Jacob.

did.unittitle: Order of Adam Wolfort, District of St. Louis, Upper Louisiana, [Missouri], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,29 December 1809.

scopecontent.p: Includes receipt for Zac. Sprigg. 1 page. DS.

did.unittitle: P[olly] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Ann Woods, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 7 January 1810.

scopecontent.p: Birth of Louisa Ann. "Mrs. Kerns the ladys wedding you was at when you was here shews the fruits of her marriage verry plain."
Includes P[olly] Wilson, n.p., to [Woods] girls. Invites them for a visit. "Betsy you cannot get anybody to have you where you are known." Lists recent weddings. 1 page. ALS.

did.unittitle: Thomas [Warman?],to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p. He cannot come to Woods', 8 January 1810.

scopecontent.p: If Woods can come to his [Thomas Warman] mothers he will take five dollars less.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of settlement of partnership between Thomas Woods, Noah Linsly and Archi[bal]d Woods,13 January 1810.
Lease (witnessed by Th[oma]s Parker) from Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia, to Michael Enlow of Belmont County, Ohio, for Enlow to rent land, 15 January 1810.

scopecontent.p: Enlow is to clear land, repair a cabin, build a stable and repair fences.

did.unittitle: J. Brown, Frankfort, [Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, n.p., 19 January 1810.

scopecontent.p: He owns no land in US Military District, north of the Scioto. A Capt. John Brown did own a quarter township, but suspects it has been sold. He owns 8 or ten thousand acres in tracts of 1000 acres which he would sell. Describes one tract. Price is three dollars per acre but would accept "two or three young negro men at valuation in part payment." Two & half dollars per acre for other tracts.

did.unittitle: Adam Wolforte, Saint Louis, [Missouri], to Archeble [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 6 February 1810.

scopecontent.p: Has sent deed to Mr. Chambers of Kentucky. Requests Woods to rent a plantation for him. Pay taxes due on it.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Cha[rle]s Stillwell) between Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia and John Watson and Robert Brown of Ohio County, Virginia for Woods to lease lands to Watson and Brown, 26 February 1810.
John Wishart, Washington, [D.C.], to John McLure, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 February 1810.

scopecontent.p: Sends information on the murder and names of the children of D. Bradford.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Glisson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 February 1810.

scopecontent.p: Since he has resolved to leave Morgantown, he wants Woods to remit money. "There is not I believe any part of the civilized world where education is thought so little of as this place." Asks questions about the Wheeling area. Can produce testimonies.

did.unittitle: John McIntire, Zanesville, [Ohio], to Archbeld [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 2 March 1810.

scopecontent.p: Sold Noah Linsly interest in Capteen bottom.

did.unittitle: John Brown, Boone County, Kentucky, to Archebald Woods near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 March 1810.

scopecontent.p: Owns a quarter section of military land. Gives terms and location.

did.unittitle: Jo[h]n Gooding,West Alexander [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Col. Arch[ibal]d Woods, Commandant of 4th Reg[imen]t Virg[ini]a,15 March 1810.

scopecontent.p: Business with Woods' son, Thomas. Asks for more time.

did.unittitle: John Mayes, Westalexander [West Alexander], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 22 March 1810.

scopecontent.p: Sends wheat and cotton Woods requested. Don't send corn or meal. Do send bran.

did.unittitle: Levi Boone, Maysville [Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 March 1810.

scopecontent.p: Will sell lands at Fishing Creek to Woods' neighbor for cash if offer is high enough.

did.unittitle: James Graham, n.p., to Archebeld [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 15 June 1810.

scopecontent.p: Doesn't understand why he didn't receive all the money due him from Woods. Has been sick.

did.unittitle: J. M. Walker, n.p., to Majer [Major] Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], [21 May 1810?].

scopecontent.p: Reports on various schools in his County.

did.unittitle:
Samuel Coleman,
D[eputy] A[djutant] G[eneral], Richmond [Virginia],to [Archibald Woods] the Commandant of the 4th Regiment, [Virginia Militia] transmitted advice of the Council of State concerning Courts Martial, 20 July 1810.

Agreement (witnessed by John Perrman) between Gideon Kent of Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia] and Archibald Woods of Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia] for Kent to build a house, 24 July 1810.

scopecontent.p: Detailed description of how it is to be built.

did.unittitle: Isaac Hutchison, Monroe [County], Virginia [West Virginia] to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 July 1810.

scopecontent.p: Will send record of Woodsvs. Lewis(300 pages) when Woods remits fee of forty-five dollars.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Glisson,Morgantown [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 July 1810.

scopecontent.p: Has purchased a farm 3 miles from Morgantown. "The people in my neighborhood are perfectly indifferent about the education of their children so that I cannot expect to derive anything from tuition among them." Would come to Wheeling if three hundred dollars could be procured. If not, will open school at his farm. Pledges to be attentive to Franklin Wood][Woods' son.]

did.unittitle: D[aniel] Sheffey,Staunton, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 August 1810.

scopecontent.p: Gives Woods advice on how to recover costs from [John] McIntire. Will attend Woodsvs. Lewisat Rockbridge Superior Court.

did.unittitle: [?], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 19 August 1810.

scopecontent.p: The two young men who contracted with Shepherd for flour have been at all mills and cannot get flour. Will have to give you the price you ask.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Lexington, [Virginia], to William Walker. Craig's Creek, Botetourt [County, Virginia], 13 September 1810.

scopecontent.p: Salutation is "Dear And[re]w." Wishes him to write respecting the receipts for costs in the suit with the Wilson's and Harbison's bond. "As I of late feel my constitution decline, my wish is as far as possible to draw my concerns to a close. Ask [George] Hancock to have business in Botetourt with Wilson's settled." "have not got my business with Lewis finally settled as yet..."

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Walker,Botetourt [County, Virginia], to uncle Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia. 25 September 1810.

scopecontent.p: Presented receipts to [?] Wilson. He would not refund the money. Left receipts and letter with [George] Hancock."I start in a few days for Kentucky with my little family & small portion of this world's goods--my wife [Elenor] has been in a bad state of health since early spring. My mother & brother And[re]w also are in bad health as usual. Write if you receive this letter. Address letter to Lincoln County near Stanford Kentucky."

did.unittitle: Jonathan Purdy, 2 Batt[alion], O[hio] C[ounty] M[ilitia],Grave Creek [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Col, 1st Bat[talio]n, O[hio] C[ounty] M[ilitia],n.p., 1 October 1810.

scopecontent.p: Lists officers elected by company.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m McGuire,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p. Offers to sell stills, 2 October 1810.
Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to W[illia]m Lewis,Botetourt [County, Virginia], 5 October 1810.

scopecontent.p: Wants to meet him in Staunton.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Thomas Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 October 1810.

scopecontent.p: Lists terms on which he will settle with Lewis.

did.unittitle: James Laidley, Wood Court House, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 18 October 1810.

scopecontent.p: Introduces [?] McKnight who claims land in Ohio County.

did.unittitle: A. Caldwell, Wheeling Mills, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., [November 1810].

scopecontent.p: Terms upon which he will sell his farm, mill, dwelling house and distillery.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Skinner & Barber, n.p., 14 December 1810.

scopecontent.p: Terms on which Josiah Dillon will pay Bank of Marietta.

did.unittitle: David Putnam, Bank of Marietta, [Ranesville, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 December 1810.

scopecontent.p: Terms upon which the directors will accept payment of Dillon's debt.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of agreement between Josiah Dillon and Archibald Woods, 29 December 1810.

scopecontent.p: Woods will take up Dillon's note on Bank of Marietta. Dillon will convey house and lot to Woods. Dillon will convey residue of property to Geo[rge] Paull.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 December 1810.

scopecontent.p: Has offered for Congress. Chancellor made decree in [Woods vs. Lewis]. Decree is agreeable to last verdict.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to [?], [1811?].

scopecontent.p: Questioning whether a judgment against Josiah Dillon in federal court is a lien against property he has bought from Woods.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Will[ia]m Poage,Staunton, [Virginia], [1811].

scopecontent.p: Asks Poage to collect money due in execution of decree in [ Woodsvs. Lewis]. Gives Poage directions about collecting it.

did.unittitle: Thomas Boyles, n.p., to [Archibald] Woods,[1811].

scopecontent.p: Intends to get money to Woods.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to Elijah McClandhan, Sheriff of Botetourt [County, Virginia], [1811].

scopecontent.p: Wants McClandhan to collect money due on execution against W[illia]m Lewis.
Includes, ACy of AL, [Archibald Woods] to Ja[me]s Breckinridge.Woods blames Breckenridge for not paying over money owed him by William Lewis. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Thomas Nichols and Archi[bal]d Woodsfor Woods to deliver flour, 13 January 1811.
Robert Pogue, Mason County, Kentucky, to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 January 1811.

scopecontent.p: [?] Hughes received fee who will handle Woods' business with Bell. Pogue obtained judgment for 7,000 dollars against [?] Brown. Gives family news.

did.unittitle: Promissary note of [Archibald Woods] to Moses Shepherd for three hundred dollars, 18 January 1811.
Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Rob[er]t Poage,near Mays Lick, Kentucky, 18 January 1811.

scopecontent.p: Wants to know if [?] Hughes brought suit against [Benjamin] Bellfor him. It not, will employ Alex[ande]r Marshallnext.

did.unittitle: James Dunlap, Canonsburgh, [sic] [Pennsylvania], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 January 1811.

scopecontent.p: Describes college at Canonsburgh.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to Andrew Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 January 1811.

scopecontent.p: Wants all papers pertaining to lease of a piece of property sent to him.

did.unittitle: Zebulon Warner, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 February 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has purchased property of John Thompson. Woods is at liberty to make use of his house after expiration of the lease.

did.unittitle: John Lee, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 February 1811.

scopecontent.p: Requests pay for services as adjutant in 4th Regiment of Virginia militia.

did.unittitle: William Downey, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Virgniey [Virginia], 11 February 1811.

scopecontent.p: Recounts his difficulty in obtaining money.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 February 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has had no further account from Staunton. "I had expected to see Genll Paull present my compl[iments] to [?] and tell him to be so good as to procure a copy of your Constitution on Regulations of your Library and forward to me as soon as possible as I am to report on that subject for our town is establishing a library."

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 February 1811.

scopecontent.p: Encloses a decree against [William] Lewis.Clerk has failed to certify when the injunction was granted.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 March 1811.

scopecontent.p: Cannot be at election [in Ohio County, Virginia]. Hopes his opponent will not exceed him in that County more than 30 votes.

did.unittitle: Alexander Reed, Washington, [Pennsylvania], to John McLure, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 15 March 1811.

scopecontent.p: Wants [?] Woods [son of Archibald Woods] to come next week if he is coming to live with him. Will leave terms up to McLure.

did.unittitle: Geor[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,15 March 1811.

scopecontent.p: Brown wants to rent house. Wants a sign and four beds and complains of rent being too high.

did.unittitle: Deed (witnessed by Edw[ard] Brysonand Sam[ue]1 Dillon) between George Paull of the first part, Josiah Dillon and Dorothy Dillon of the second part and Archibald Woods of the third part, 29 March 1811.

scopecontent.p: George Paull had held deed of trust on two lots in St. Clairsville, Ohio for money owed Bank of Marietta by Dillon. Paull is deeding property to Woods to discharge the deed of trust. Edw[ard] Bryson.1 page. Includes affidavit of William Farris, Jun[io]r.1 page.

did.unittitle: Archi[bald] Woods,n.p., to John White, n.p., 3 April 1811.

scopecontent.p: Horse bought by White or his brother in St. Clairsville, [Ohio] stands on lot bought by Woods from Josiah Dillon.

did.unittitle: Polly Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Ann Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 9 April 1811.

scopecontent.p: Gives family news.

did.unittitle: Samuel Moore, Archa [Archibald] Wood[s],Wheelan [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: Shall be engaged at Judge Lockwood fitting out a boat. Mortgage must be recorded.

did.unittitle: Lease from Archi[bal]d Woodsto Josiah McGuire, 15 April 1811.
W[illia]m Chapline, Jr., Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling Creek, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 16 April 1811.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to survey land to divide farm between Chapline and Evans.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and Martin Gaunt of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] for Gaunt to lease land from Woods, 19 April 1811.
Geo[rge] Hancock,Fincastle, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling near Pittsburg[h],Virginia [West Virginia], 25 April 1811.

scopecontent.p: Lewis has deposited money with General [James] Breckinridgefor Woods' claim. [?] Walker previous to going to Kentucky left memo respecting Woods' suit with Wilson. No bill was filed.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 April 1811.

scopecontent.p: Results of election between W[illia]m McKinleyand Wilson.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to D[aniel] Sheffey,n.p., 2 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has not heard from lawyers concerning Woodsvs. Lewis. Th[oma]s Wilsonis elected to Congress.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Josiah McGuire and Michel Brown, carpenters and Archi[bal]d Woods,for work to be done Woods' house, 7 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Lists tasks and prices.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Virginia [West Virginia], 9 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Concerns the discharge of the deed of trust by Paull and the validity of Woods' title to Dillon's property.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Isaac Hutchinson, Clerk of Monroe County, at union, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Asks if copy of decree in [ Woodsvs. Lewis] has been forwarded.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Wood[s],n.p., to George Paull, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], 28 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: [Noah?] Linsly has decided against Woods and Paull concerning the discharge of the deed of trust by Paull selling Dillon's lots to Woods.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Wil[lia]m R. Dickinson,Cash[ie]r Bankat Steubenville, [Ohio], 21 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Transmits payment to discharge note.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Evans,agent of Oliver Evans, Pittsburgh Steam Mill to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Concerning the price of a hopperboy for a flour mill.

did.unittitle: D[aniel] Sheffey,Montgomery County, Virginia, to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia, 25 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Apologizes for delay. Called away by death of a friend in Baltimore. Has sent copy of decree to clerk of Monroe so he can issue execution.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to James Paull, Pennsylvania, 28 May 1811.

scopecontent.p: Wants James Paull to send him a pair of pigs.

did.unittitle: C. Johnson, Staunton, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Sends decree in Woodsvs. Lewis.

did.unittitle: Execution issued by Jno Ewing and Sam[ue]l McClure8 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Issued against property of Amos Shearman and Joseph Ferroi in the lawsuit of Matthew Kerrvs. Ferroi.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Biggs, B[rigadier] Gen[era]l, West Liberty,[Virginia] [West Virginia] to Lt. Col. Arch[ibal]d Wood[s],n.p., 8 June-20 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Appoints Woods president of a court-martial to try James G. Laidley for disorderly behaviour and disobedience of orders at the 113th Regiment. "Also for conspiring with his subaltern officers previous to s[ai]dmuster to be disorderly on the day of said muster."
Includes, DS, of Benj[ami]n Biggs, certifying he did employ John Finney to summons the officers to attend the trial of L[a]idley.2 items.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to David Erwin, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Requests Erwin pay forty-two dollars to [?] Evans for license to rise hopperboy at Woods' mill. "The mill stands on Wheat's run a branch of Wheeling Creeke, [sic] in Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia]..."

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Hancock,Fincastle, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling near Pittsburg[h, Virginia],12 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Sends bill [of complaint] for Woods to answer in Wilson's Ex[ecut]orsvs. Woods.

did.unittitle: Jno. W. Pleasants, Council Chamber, City of Richmond, [Virginia] to the Commandant of the 4th Regiment [Virginia Militia] Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Instructed by Lieutenant Governor "to inform you that commissions cannot issue...until it shall be specified...what vacancies they are to fill; or if for a new company that also should be specified."

did.unittitle: Appointment, of Andrew Howlett as a captain in the fourth Regiment tenth Brigade and third Division of the Virginia militia, 25 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Signed by Geo[rge] W[illia]m Smith,Lieutenant Governor and J[no] W. Pleasants.
Includes, DS, of Benj[amin] Biggs attesting that Andrew Howlett had taken oath as captain. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Zac. Sprigg, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 29 June 1811.

scopecontent.p: Needs oats from Woods.

did.unittitle: M[atthe]w Houston,Natural Bridge, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 July 1811.

scopecontent.p: Joseph Cloyd's wife and daughter died. Houston's "son Andrew got a cut on his knee last winter which had nearly taken his life." Gives other family news.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Geory[e] Hancock,n.p., 8 July 1811.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Woodsvs. Lewisand Wilson's heirsvs. Woods.

did.unittitle: Bonds (witnessed by Noah Linsly) of Archibald Woods with Moses Shepherd, William Irwin, Noah Zane and Noah Linsly, 18 July 1811.
S. McClure, n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 19 July 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has made an alteration in the [promissory] note Woods sent for him to sign.

Includes ALS, of John Anderson, n.d., to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia. Robert Anderson is not willing that John Anderson should quit his work before harvest so Woods can expect them July 15. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Biggs, Br[igadier] Gen[eral], 10th Brigade,to Col. Arch[ibald] Wood[s],n.p., 6 August 1811.

scopecontent.p: Orders Woods to order regiment to Wheeling for muster.

did.unittitle: D[aniel] Sheffey,Montgomery Court House, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 August 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has collected 792 dollars in execution granted in Woodsvs. Lewis. Marshall has taken all the personal property of William Lewis. Let him know how to transmit money.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Spencer Biddle and Damiel [?]) between Lloyd Biddle of Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia] and Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 August 1811.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease the stone house and stable to be built. Describes how stable is to be constructed.

did.unittitle: John McLure, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibald] Woods,n.p., 5 September 1811.

scopecontent.p: Sent articles written for.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,n.p., to Brother Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 5 September 1811.

scopecontent.p: Sends sympathy for death of Archibald Woods' son. Unable to attend funeral.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 6 September 1811.

scopecontent.p: Pleased with executive appointment of a judge for our circuit. Try to block appointment of [?] Jackson by legislature. Thinks [Congressional] session will be long and boisterous. His reception in Woods' County has made impressions on his mind.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Thomas Evans of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and Zebudiah Meix of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 September 1811.

scopecontent.p: Meix agrees to build a barn for Evans. Description of how it is to be built.

did.unittitle: Jesse Hunt, Newels town, [Newell, Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheelen, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia] 15 September 1811.

scopecontent.p: Offers land for sale adjoining land owned by Woods at the mouth of Capteen Creek.

did.unittitle: John Wilson, Washington, Pennsylvania, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: Notifies Woods that a note of Michael Cresap, endorsed by Woods is due and unpaid.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to [?] Griffith, St. Clairsville, [Ohio]. 5 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: Zebu Warner is indebted to Woods for rent. Gives Griffith options on how to handle the collection.
Includes ALS, of Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Zebu Warner, n.p. concerns rent owed to Woods. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: Laments loss of Woods' son. Not able to make any statement with respect to Woods' account with Geo[rge] Poagewithout assistance of Woods' papers.
Includes receipt from J. Russle [?] to David Banes[?] for wheat to the account of A[rchibald] Woods.1 page.
Includes, fragment of an account. 1 page.

did.unittitle: John Beach, Marietta, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Wood[s],Wheelling [Wheeling], [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: If Woods has made purchase of the Jughandle Mills, write him and he will send Woods a draft of his proportion of the halfe [sic].

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods near Wheeling, Virginia [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: Spoke to R. [?] Thompsonwho is considered one of the best house-carpenters here respecting the undertaking of your house. The Republican ticket succeeded in all three members with a majority of two to three hundred votes.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibald] Woods,n.p., to Elig[a]h McClandhan,Botetourt [County, Virginia], 26 October 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has learned by George Paull that Mr. Lewis has sold his land. Informed a proposition is made by Mr. Lewis to pay to W[illia]m Poageof Augusta [for Woods]. Thanks McClandhan for his friendly aid in having the business brought to a close. Speculates on other terms.

did.unittitle: Jo[seph] Cloyd,Natural Bridge, [Virginia] to Uncle Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 November 1811.

scopecontent.p: Concerns taxes on land in Ohio County owned by Cloyd family and by M[atthe]w Houston.

did.unittitle: John Gosney, n.p., to Archabal [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia, [sic] [West Virginia], 13 November 1811.

scopecontent.p: Wants Woods to make him some flour.

did.unittitle: Isaac Kelly, n.p., to the Register of the Land Office at Richmond, Virginia, 15 November 1811.

scopecontent.p: Asks that he look for patents for George and Isaac Kelly.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 November 1811.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to tell him how to go about military patents. Has visited the President and also attended the House of Madam. At next interview with President intends to mention the Road. Many petitioners praying to be relieved from injuries sustained under the nonimportation law. Affair of the Chesapeake settled. Determined representation for the states. The "Harriet" sails in a few days with messengers to England and France. Mr. Taylor son of Jno Taylor goes to England and Mr. Biddle son of Clement Biddle goes to France. "it is hard to say what course our great men will take. I believe...leaders know not what to do. Not do I know who is to be the leader. I believe in Caucus it was determined to elect H[enry] Clay,speaker and they did elect him." Describes Clay.

did.unittitle: S. R. Bakewell, Charlestown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woodsnear Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 26 November 1811.

scopecontent.p: Has about thirty-five feet of pipes now by him and expects to set another kiln next week when he expects to have Woods' in it. Wants to know what other kind, of ware Woods would wish to be sent along with them. "Here let me remark that Mr. Wales opinion of stone ware pipes is higher than ever & he regrets that the town of Steubensville does not use them instead of wood."

did.unittitle: Power of attorney (witnessed by Noah Zane and Noah Linsly) from Moses Shepherd to Noah Linsly, 29 November 1811.

scopecontent.p: To assign and transfer to Archibald Woods twenty shares in Bank of Steubenville.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Woods,Washington, [Pennsylvania], to father [Archibald Woods], 9 December 1811.

scopecontent.p: Gives his recollection of a transaction between himself and John McClure. Mr. Reed's young daughter died. Have searched for cloth.

did.unittitle: Andrew Howlett, n.p., to Archeble [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 18 December 1811.

scopecontent.p: Apologizes for being so long, in making his returns because he couldn't understand it.
Includes, ALS, from Andrew Howlett to Archebel [Archibald] Woods, 30 December 1811. Has sent returns by Moses Chaplin[e]. 1 page. ALS.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of business for Tho[mas] Woodsto attend to for Archibald Woods, [1812?].

scopecontent.p: Concerns settling Woods vs. Lewis. "Beware of being taken in as all those people are Great Sharpers. Beware of going in any barter or bargain with them. If possible they will try to pawn some old or good for nothing Negroes on you, or some other old stuff or bad bonds."

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Poage,Augusta [County, Virginia] to Archibald Wood[s],Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: Received four hundred dollars from [William] Lewis. Taken a bond on Burwell. Not knowing the amount of the Ex[ecution] nor Cred[i]ts, could not go into a final settlement. Can have it credited to execution by writing clerk of Monroe or attorney.

did.unittitle: P[olly] Wilson,Morgantown [Virginia] [West Virginia], to sister Anna [Ann] Wood[s], Whe[e]ling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Ann Woods for sending Patty up. Glad to hear of Betsy's safe delivery. "if I live as long as the first week in May and no accident happens I expect to have an addition to my family, already to[o] large, but when we have them we are sorry for to part with them." Misses her husband [who is in Congress]. Hope he returns in March, but if the[y] declare war he may be detained a month or two longer.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,City of Washington, [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: Presented draft to Sheffey. Mentioned "the establishment of the Road to his Majesty but have no answer to the point." Discusses increase in military establishment. Bills on Navy laid on table to make room for land force. Wilson voted no to raising 25,000 soldiers. Asks what the people think. Doubts leaders. Thinks war will ensue.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington City [D.C.], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 January [1812].

scopecontent.p: Has received draft [to settle Woodsvs. Lewis]. Has to be sent back to W[illia]m Poageto obtain proper endorsement. "We hear of nothing here but war..." Lists bills concerning raising troops. President will not act on the U.S. Road, saying there is no money to expend.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l McKee,Washington City [D.C.], to Archibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: Is making enquiries about a 3000 acre tract of military land in Ohio County. Asks if land has been sold for taxes.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of agreement (witnessed by Archi[bal]d Woods,Josiah Updegraff [?] and Moses Chapline) between Thomas Evans and John Eoff, 20 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: For Evans to sell his farm to Eoff. Evans is also to convey his interest in the ferries across the Ohio River and across Wheeling Creek.

did.unittitle: Proclamation by Governor James Barbour, 23 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: Prescribing the uniform of the Virginia militia.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington City [D.C.], to [Archibald Woods]. pages, 30 January 1812.

scopecontent.p: Encloses patent to Woods. Asks for recommendations for officers in "our (to be made Army)". Rage for war has subsided. Looks for proposition to repeal non-importation law. Houses passes bill to repair old frigates. Mentions [William Branch] Giles.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Jessey Hunt, Cincinnati, Ohio, 3 February 1812.

scopecontent.p: Would survey his land but had to attend Superior Court at Wheeling. Makes proposal for 200 to 250 acres. Offer is eight gallons good whiskey and one dollar per acre. He offers flour. Draws plat to explain offer.

did.unittitle: Richard Yeates, n.p., to Archibald Woods, on Wheeling Creek, near mouth, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 February 1812.

scopecontent.p: Person who delivers letter is authorized to sell land for General James Allen and Col. David Allen. Discusses past dispute with Woods over land in Kentucky he bought from Woods.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 February 1812.

scopecontent.p: Building a sawmill. Thinks Mallory should have house he is renting taken from him. Doesn't know anyone else to rent it to. [Benjamin] Ruggles wants Paull to go in with him and others on laying out a town, [Woodsfield?].

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to Ro[bert] Woods,n.p., 24 February 1812.

scopecontent.p: Has heard rumors that political enemies may try to have election for clerk set aside if they lose. Suggests that Robert Woods as eldest magistrate to require sheriff to summons all magistrates to elect a clerk for County court in place of Moses Chapline, deceased. Suggests form to use.

did.unittitle: Isaac Hutchison, union, Monroe County [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Woodsvs. Lewis.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Has received Woods recommendations for commissions as officers. Trouble raising money. Considered salt tax. "The 'Constitution' has returned ten days & no report of anything from England and France." Sheftey has paid no money.

did.unittitle: Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 20 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Doesn't have time to consider offer [for land]. Prefers bank stock to land. Prefers cash to bank stock. If others sell out, he does not wish to be backward. Does not think Archibald Woods' offer for his interest in Botetourt includes what he will receive from Elijah [Woods]. Wants Brother James [Woods] to appoint attorney to settle price of land Robert Woods is to have from Jo[seph] Woods and make a deed.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Discusses British spy, John Henry. "It is not yet determined who is to be next President. DeWitt Clinton is spoken of." April elections will express public mind.

did.unittitle: Jo Cloyd, Rockbridge [County, Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio [County] Virginia [West Virginia], 26 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Discusses land owned by David and James Cloyd and M[atthe]w Houstonin Ohio County. In Woodsvs. Lewis,Lewis has sold land to [?] Burwell. Lewis has paid $7,000 to W[illia]m Poag[e]. James Greenlee married Miss [?] Paxton.

did.unittitle: James Trenor, Sinking Creek, Botetourt County, [Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Defends his handling of Woods business in the suit of Woodsvs. Lewis.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 March 1812.

scopecontent.p: Tells Woods he can expect an embargo. Asks him to let [?] Shepherd and all friends know.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington [D.C.], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Lists officers to be commissioned. Has enclosed documents "for the information of the people." Forwarded report on subject of [U.S.] Road. Doesn't expect anything to be done concerning road west of Monongahela. Not at liberty to say more about [embargo]. Received no more money from Sheffey.

did.unittitle: George Paull, n.p., to A[rchaibald] Woods,n.p., 2 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Has not gotten a person to go see Windle for purpose of making a purchase. Has not gotten survey made of Capteena land.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia] to W[illia]m Poage,near Staunton, [Virginia], 8 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Sending John McLure to collect $7,000 left by [William] Lewis. has written clerk of Monroe County to stay execution until November.

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,Nashville, [Tennessee], to uncle [Archibald Woods], 10 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Robert Woods (uncle) wishes to purchase 200 acres of land from him. Price is $1,600. Has written father to give Archibald Woods a power of attorney. Owes Robert Woods. In addition owes $3,000-4,000 in Kentucky.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Asks to be recommended to be appointed a major in army to be raised in Ohio.

did.unittitle: Lists of officers and when they were sworn in, 25 April 1812.
Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Sheffey does not find it convenient to give a settlement at this time.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Freder[ic]k Farmer,26 April 1812.

scopecontent.p: Asks that bearer be paid thirty-nine dollars.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Poage,n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 May 1812.

scopecontent.p: Has seven thousand dollars as part of the execution against [William] Lewis in Woodsvs. Lewis.

did.unittitle: George Paull, St. Clairsville [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,9 May 1812.

scopecontent.p: Needs to enter quarters [of land?].
Includes, AMs, of [Archibald Woods]. Asking that volunteers for the army be encouraged. Tells what pay and rations soldiers will receive. 2 pages.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Archibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 May 1812.

scopecontent.p: Has seen Battial Harrison who has the Virginia military land warrants. Will make some proposition. James Paull has gone to Richmond. Would rather deal with Paull.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Gooding,West Alexander, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio C[ounty], Virginia [West Virginia], 23 May 1812.

scopecontent.p: Introduces Henry Greene who wishes to obtain advice respecting the validity of a claim of land.

did.unittitle: Isaac Kelly, n.p., to Colonel [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 May 1812.

scopecontent.p: Needs brick to mend a hearth. Asks for late newspapers.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Pannill,n.p., to Col[o]nel A[rchibald] Wood[s],n.p., 2 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Resigning his office in the Wheeling Light Infantry. Woods has written two names on the letter as possible replacements for Pannill.

did.unittitle: Nathan Holister, n.p., to Arch[ibald] Woods,n.p., 2 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Reports on the measurement of lumber. Does not like quality of the boards.

did.unittitle: James Crage [?], Fishcreek, to Archy [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Wishes to know if Woods intends to let him have Mr. Ramsey's place.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Put advertisement in paper for sale of town lots and sent notices.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Irwin,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Wood[s].n.p., 10 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: At the first muster of the [Weeling] Light Infantry, ensign of the company made known his intention to decline serving in the company in the capacity of an officer longer than five years from the date of his commissions. Company elected a replacement, John Richardson and recommended him to be appointed.
Includes, AN, of [Archibald Woods], listing possible officers. 1 page.

did.unittitle: J[ame]s Barbour,Richmond, [Virginia], to The commandant of the 4th Reg[imen]t, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 22 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Had sent commission to Jno Richardson to be ensign [in Wheeling Light Infantry]. Since Richardson has been accused in affidavit by [?J Zane of saying he would not interfere if slaves in eastern part of state rose up and murdered their masters, he should return his commission.

did.unittitle: Noah Zane, n.p., to Ar[chibal]d Woods,n.p., 22 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Recommends Mr. Ross to repair public arms. [Woods has written on the letter: William Ross at Frederick Town on Monongala River, Washington County, Pencilvania [Pennsylvania].

did.unittitle: Appointment of William McCoy as lieutenant in fourth regiment, tenth brigade, and third division of Virginia militia. Signed by J[ame]s Barbourand registered by J. H. Pleasants. Bears seal, 23 June 1812.
Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Enclosed will gives the course of the war. Woods' son, Thomas, stayed with him. Thinks it's high time for Congress to adjourn.

did.unittitle: Jo[seph] Woods,Nashville, [Tennessee] to uncle Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Still wants $1600 for the land he is offering to Robert Woods. News about Andrew [Woods], Robert Woods, and John M. Walker.

did.unittitle: Levi Hicks, n.p., to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 29 June 1812.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent horse pasture.

did.unittitle: J[ame]s Barbour,Richmond [Virginia], to Arch[ibald] Woods,Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 July 1812.

scopecontent.p: Tells Woods to have the public arms repaired.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., to D[aniel] Sheffey,Washington City, [D.C.], 10 July 1812.

scopecontent.p: Answer to a letter from Sheftey concerning Woods' manner of collecting money due him in Woodsv. Lewis.
Includes ACy of AL, which is an earlier draft of above. 2 pages.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Thomas Wilson, Washington City, [D.C.], 10 July 1812.

scopecontent.p: Encloses copy of [Daniel] Sheffey's statement which Woods thinks is incorrect. Tries to understand the statement. Thinks majority of people are opposed to war. Cannot raise troops, as commander of 4th Regiment, Virginia militia. Has on company volunteers, one company drafted. Wife had large son, W[illia]m. Nearly cost her her life.

did.unittitle: Asher Jones, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheling [Wheeling] Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 August 1812.

scopecontent.p: Whiskey Woods has sold him is indifferent. Discusses salt works. Cannot hire or sell slave because he has a sore leg.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Alexander Caldwell, n.p., 18 August 1812.

scopecontent.p: Cannot accept price Caldwell proposes for land. Gives his offer.

did.unittitle: Orders from Benj[ami]n Biggs,B[rigadier] Gen[era]l l0[th] Br[i]gad[e], to Lt. Col[one]l Arch[ibal]d Wood[s],31 August 1812.

scopecontent.p: Orders Woods to order his regiment to Wheeling for training.

did.unittitle: John J. Jacobs & Co., Wellsburgh [Wellsburg, Brooke Co.] Virginia [West Virginia], 7 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: Unable to raise money owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,near Louisville, [Kentucky] to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Woods for paying taxes for him. Sends money by son, John Croghan. Mentions George Croghan. Will consider exchanging land with Woods after he gets necessary information.

did.unittitle: John Connell, n.p., to Col. Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio [County] Virginia [West Virginia], 16 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: Asks questions concerning impressment of camp kettles, axes, and wagons. "The troops from this Regiment are to meet at this place on Tuesday next and will proceed in boats to the place of Destination, on Wednesday if possible, say Thursday at farthest. I shall be happy to meet and accompany the troop from your Regiment." Late orders authorize the Col. com[man]d[in]g to provide for the transportation of the baggage. "My opinion is that wagons should be procured in each regiment, they can be sent by water to point pleasant, the horses by land, the camp kettles so far as we may stand in need will be taken from Mr. Dutty... Keel Boats going to Kenhawn for salt can be procured if you can engage but I have as yet engaged by one, three will be necessary."

did.unittitle: John Connell, Charleston, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woodsof Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 18 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: Understands Woods' men are to meet this day at Wheeling. Sends Capt. Russel to receive from information as to boats for the transportation of the troops and also as to provisions.
