"Say five days Rations of bread and salt pork of Bacon, ready cooked, my wish being to go on Day and Night if possible until we arrive at Point Pleasant."

did.unittitle: Central Standing Committee (James Woods, John Campbell, Jr., Samuel Greenhow, William Fenwick, and Benjamin J. Harris), Richmond, [Virginia] to Archa[bald] [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 19 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: To raise supplies for families of soldiers.

Includes minutes of a meeting of citizens of Richmond, Manchester and their vicinities held at the Capitol. Resolved that name of association be "The Society for promoting the success of the War against Great Britain." Lists duties of the association, including the appointing of a standing committee in each town and County.... 2 pages. PD.

did.unittitle: Warrant from Archibald Woods, Lieut[enant] Colo[nel] Com[mandan]t 4th Reg[imen]t Virg[ini]a Militia, 23 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: to Capt. Lewis Bonnet to impress a keel boat.
Includes, DS, affidavit of John McLure, W[illia]m Irwin, and John Feay, that the value of the service of the keel boat is $50.00. 1 page.
Includes, ANS, of Archi[bal]d Woods,certifying above. 1 page.
Includes, copy of DS, warrant from Archibald Woods, to Benjamin Jefferies, to impress a keel boat. 1 page.
Includes, DS, affidavit of John McLure that the value of the service of the keel boat is $50.00. 1 page.

did.unittitle: John Wilson, Washington, Pennsylvania, to Arche[bal]d [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 September 1812.

scopecontent.p: Notifying Woods that a note endorsed by him for Morgan Jones is due and unpaid.

did.unittitle: Cha[rle]s K[ing] Mallory,Council Chamber, Richmond, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Lieut[enant] Commandant of Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 3 October 1812.

scopecontent.p: Has received, in the absence of the Governor, Woods' letter, asking to have made at Wheeling, arms for a troop.

did.unittitle: John Bready, n.p., to Archable [Archibald] Woods, near Wheelling [Wheeling], Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], October 1812.

scopecontent.p: Will attend court martial and pay his fine if it's proved he should have gone when called.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,[Virginia], 20 October 1812.

scopecontent.p: Will leave home in a week for Washington. Should be glad to hear result of your election for electors. Expects peace ticket to have a large majority in his County.

did.unittitle: S. R. Bakewell, Charleston, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 28 October 1812.

scopecontent.p: Tries to make arrangement with Woods concerning stoneware and earthenware. Unable to get salt he needed for his manufacture.

did.unittitle: F. McHenry, Elizabeth-town, [Pennsylvania?], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 November 1812.

scopecontent.p: Proposes to start a newspaper with the press to be in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] Thomas Wilson, Washington City [D.C.], 6 November 1812.

scopecontent.p: Madison ticket had a majority of 92. [Stephen] Van Rensselaer has met with a defeat. Has been informed that [Return Jonathan] Meigs has been insulted by the common soldiers and almost afraid of times at times to leave his quarters least [sic] he might meet with insults." "I am anxious to hear if peace is expected or if we must go on in this destructive war. If it is to continue God help the nation for in many places, the people are ready almost to cut other throats." Cites examples. Will write [Daniel] Sheffey for account with [William] Lewis.

did.unittitle: M[ichael] Cresap,Fish Creek [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archib[al]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia, [West Virginia], 16 November 1812.

scopecontent.p: Will sell land for $12,000.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 November 1812.

scopecontent.p: Thinks militia are expensive and ruinous. Thinks they can provide little real service "as well might you put unbroken Horses to a Wagon--they possess the strength & spirit--but they will not pull together." sees no prospect of speedy termination of the war. "the Administration which makes War does rarely make peace." Discusses War Hawks. Anxious to hear about Virginians in Western Army. Will present statement to [Daniel] Sheffey.

did.unittitle: Jo[seph] Cloyd,Natural Bridge, [Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 December 1812.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Cloyd military lands in Ohio County.

did.unittitle: General orders, Headquarters, N. W. Army, Upper Sanauskey [Ohio], signed by (L. Hukle, Ass[istan]t Dep[artmen]t Ad[jutan]t Gen[era]l.) Endorsement says G[enera]l Harrison's Order of P[a]rad[e], 22 December 1812.

scopecontent.p: Gives directions for morning and evening parades.

did.unittitle: Mary Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 24 December 1812.

scopecontent.p: Gives family news and news of household activities.

did.unittitle: Levin Okey, n.p., to Arc[h]able [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 3 January 1813.

scopecontent.p: Woods should rent to [?] Hollister. Terms are too high for Okey.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 January 1813.

scopecontent.p: Has spoken to Gen[era]l S. Smith about lands in Wheeling. Land is owned by James A. Buchanan of Baltimore. "No doubt the Papers give you an account how our Genls in the North have managed their campaigns . Was ever a Nation cursed with such officers." Secretary of Navy has resigned. Gives makeup of regiments and number. Thinks too many. "We attempt more than we can do well."

did.unittitle: Benj[amin] Ruggles,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 January 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns politics in Ohio.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Vi[rgini]a, [West Virginia] to Andrew Hamilton, Fincastle, Botetourt County, Virginia, 28 January 1813.

scopecontent.p: Sends statement concerning execution in Woods v. Lewis. Asks Hamilton to try to see execution and aid him in obtaining his money.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Robertson,C[lerk] of C[ouncil], In Council [Richmond, Virginia] to [Archibald Woods], Commandant of the 4th Regiment, Ohio [County, Virginia], 30 January 1813.

scopecontent.p: Transmitting advice of council that any artillery companies who are furnished with gun carriages may build sheds to protect them.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by John McLure) between Archi[bald] Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and William Cunningham of Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 February 1813.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to rent land (including orchard) to Cunningham.

did.unittitle: J.A. Buchanan, Baltimore, [Maryland], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 February 1813.

scopecontent.p: Has received Woods' letter. Lands on Wheeling Creek belong to heirs of his father. If Woods will make proposition, Buchanan will submit it to the heirs.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 10 February 1813.

scopecontent.p: Mentions [Buchanan] attitude toward selling land. Has received no news from [James] Winchester [concerning River Raisin defeat]. Disagrees with conduct of the war...."but you and I have it not in our power to regulate these things; but with the people we should speak a language which should be heard [even?] in the recesses of the palace."

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and Aaron Varney and Jedadiah Varney of Vermont, 18 February 1813.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to rent land to the Varneys. Woods is to supply livestock and utensils.

did.unittitle: John White, n.p., to Archibald Woods, n.p., 25 February 1813.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to suspend collection of fine against him because his son failed to attend regimental court.

did.unittitle: N[athaniel] Burwell,Salem, Botetourt County, [Roanoke County], [Virginia], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 February 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Woodsv. Lewis.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Washington, [D.C.], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 1 March 1813.

scopecontent.p: "You may expect something like an Embargo before we rise." Expects tax bills to go up. Has put letter before Sec[re]t[ary] of War.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Archi[bal]d Woodsand James Kelly) between Isaac Robinson of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and John Kelly of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 March 1813.

scopecontent.p: To be partners in purchasing flour for export to New Orleans or elsewhere.

did.unittitle: Bond (witnessed by James Kelly) between Archi[bald] Woodsand Issac Robinson, 9 March 1813.
Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to James Barbour, Governor of Virginia, Richmond, [Virginia], 22 March 1813.

scopecontent.p: Apparently, two commissions have been served to same person. Woods describes the two men.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,near Louisville [Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 March 1813.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Woods for saying he will tend to paying the taxes on his land. Since Woods title to land in Kentucky is disputed, he does not want to exchange.

did.unittitle: Agreement between James Barnett and Archi[bal]d Woods,23 April 1813.

scopecontent.p: For Barnett to build a log house. Gives details on how house is to be built.

did.unittitle: Promise by John Thompson to give Geo[rge] Paull,28 April 1812.1 April 1814.

scopecontent.p: Promise to give possession of a house and lot.

did.unittitle: John Carr, n.p., to [Robert Stuart], n.p., 9 May 1813.

scopecontent.p: Request to let John D. seaman have flour.

did.unittitle: John Anderson, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 1 June 1813.

scopecontent.p: Needs lime to finish house.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Nathan Holister) between Archi[bal]d Woods(for himself, Benj[ami]n Ruggles,George Paull & Levi Barber) and John Barrit, 5 June 1813.

scopecontent.p: To sell Barrit land.

did.unittitle: Asher Jones, n.p., to Ar[chibal]d Woods,n.p., 11 June 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns whiskey.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling], Virginia [West Virginia], 28 June 1813.

scopecontent.p: Has concluded a bargain with William Sharpless for house and lot. Troops have mounted. Col. Perkins has resigned. Paull expects to be colonel.

did.unittitle: Ben[jamin] Ruggles,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns opening a road from Woodsfield to Marietta, Ohio.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,in Camp at Delaware, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Making arrangements to sell property to [William] Sharplessin event he does not return from war. Intends to go into mercantile business. Have drawn clothing for 27th Regiment and tomorrow start for upper Sandusky and the Lower Sandusky.

did.unittitle: Power of attorney (witnessed by William Gill and James Shannon) from George Paull to John Patterson to execute a deed to William Sharpless, 12 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Includes, DS, affidavit of Josiah M. Smith. 1 page.

did.unittitle: N[oah] Linsly,n.p., to Archibald] Woods,n.p., asking Woods to inspect the construction of a road, 15 July 1813.
Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Troops are getting ready to march.

did.unittitle: John Davis, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Describes difficulties in provisioning troops.

did.unittitle: Benj[amin] Ruggles,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Woods' letter apparently miscarried. Must prepare for a campaign in September.

did.unittitle: A. Hamilton, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods, n.p., 24 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns payments for barrels [of flour?].

did.unittitle:
Lt. James Ewing, n.p., to Archibald Woods,
Lieut[enant] Col[onel] Com[mandan]t, [4th Regiment, Virginia Militia].

scopecontent.p: Lists repairs (and cost) to muskets and certifies that Adam Keller did the work.

did.unittitle: J. Caldwell, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 29 July 1813.

scopecontent.p: Settling of accounts.

did.unittitle: James Paull, Jr., n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 August 1813.

scopecontent.p: Trying to locate Betsy and arrange for her to be sent home.

did.unittitle: D. McClure, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p. Asks Woods to make a survey, 3 August 1813.
Benj[amin] Biggs, Brig[adie]r Gen[era]l, 10[th] Brig[a]de, [Virginia Militia],to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 11 August 1813.

scopecontent.p: Orders Woods to order troops for muster.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Lower Seneca Town, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 August 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns selling a house and lot to Sharpless.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Lower Seneca Town, [?], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 August 1813.

scopecontent.p: Thinks Woods' son, Franklin, can get an appointment in militia. Thinks serving will be good for him.

did.unittitle: Benj[amin] Ruggles,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns sale of house and land to a Mr. Mallory.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Camp Lower Seneca Town, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Franklin Woods arrives. Gen. [William Henry] Harrisonappointed him a third lieutenant. Paull gives his philosophy about serving in the army. Gives instructions about selling house and lot to Sharpless.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Sorry to hear of ill health of Mrs. Paull. Surprised to hear that Franklin had enlisted. Discusses war. "This war of glory or glorious war-which appears to be attended with every calamity defeat and disaster that ever in any shape befell any country ancient or modern-how is it? Are nations punished in proportion to their demerits?...I never once for a moment supposed that the contem[p]tibleprovince of Upper Canada peopled by semibarbarians could have held the United States at bay for more than a year-and even make inroads upon us--"

did.unittitle: Jno. Brady, Li[e]ut.,n.p., to Col. Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 13 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Sends forty-one guns and thirty six cartridge boxes.

did.unittitle: Charges sent to Colo[nel] John Connell, C[o]mm[an]d[an]t, 103 Reg[imen]t Virginia Militia,against Richard Roberts of David Pugh's Volunteer Rifle company attached to the 103d Regiment Virginia Militia, 14 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Charges that Roberts tried to avoid danger withdrew himself from Tyamochta and allowed the baggage of his company to be lost; let tobacco, coffee and chocolate be traded for sale and let other baggage be left and lost; said men did not have to serve past 22nd of March; and used threatening language to a captain. Signed by David Pugh.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., Noah Linsley, Charleston [Virginia] [West Virginia], 15 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Wants Linsley to try to settle an agreement made with [?] Ross.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,on the lake of Carrying[?], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 April 1813.

scopecontent.p: Mentions Oliver Hazard Perry's naval victory on Lake Erie.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Woodsfield, Monroe County, Ohio, 21 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods aid in helping a Mr. Dear enter land.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Issac Barrett) between Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia] and John Barrett of Belmont County, Ohio for Woods to sell land to Barrett, 28 September 1813.
Promissory note (witnessed by James Mays) of John Cunningham and Robert Paull to Samuel Robinson, 28 September 1813.

Warrant issued to arrest Lt. Richard Roberts on order of
Colo[nel] John Connell, 103[rd] Regiment, Virginia Militiaon charges brought by Capt. David Pugh, 28 September 1813.

scopecontent.p: Signed by B. D. adjutant.

did.unittitle: Nathan Holister, Capticana [Captuna, Ohio], to Archa [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 October 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns cutting trees and Woods' accusations that Holister has wasted nails and boards.

did.unittitle: Levi Barber, Marietta Court House [Ohio], to Archibald Woods & Benja[min] Ruggles,n.p. [?], 8 October 1813.

scopecontent.p: Malory has had trouble entering lands at Woodsfield. Barber wants to encourage settlers.

did.unittitle: Proceedings in the court-martial of Lt. Richard Roberts of 103rd Regiment, Virginia Militia, 14 September 1813.

Orders issued to Archibald Woods by
Bemj[ami]n Biggs, Br[igadier] Gen[era]l 10[th] Brig[a]defor Woods to preside at court-martial of Lt. Richard Roberts, 13 October 1813.
Geo[rge] Paull,Detroit, [Michigan], to [Archibald Woods, n.p.], 17 October 1813.

scopecontent.p: Discusses battle at Moravian Town [Battle of the Thames].
Includes, AM, copy, 12 October 1813, of general orders congratulating the troops after the battle of Moravian Town [Michigan]. 3 pages.

did.unittitle:
Muster roll of
[4th Regiment, 10th Brigade, Virginia Militia] written by L[ieutenant] Col[onel]Archi[bal]d Woods,[18 October 1813].
Levin Okey, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 October 1813.

scopecontent.p: Petitions are doing very well [perhaps concerning a division of Belmont County, Ohio]. Barretts have not yet marked out the road. George Swaney has not marked road. Wife wants to move back to river. Would like to rent from Woods.

did.unittitle: Absalom Ridgely, West Liberty, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, [Ohio], 20 October 1813.

scopecontent.p: Requests that Mrs. Woods acknowledge [release] of dower to his deed.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m E. Wilson,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 21 October 1813.

scopecontent.p: Sympathizes with Woods' rheumatism. Has resigned his pastoral charge and preaches only occasionally. Gives family and neighbor hard news. Only chance for peace is defeat of Bonaparte. Gives a calculation of no peace before 1866. Recommends George Stanley Faber's book on prophecies. Conrad Speece is preacher.

did.unittitle: Asher Jones, n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,living near Wheeling [Virginia] [West Virginia], 3 November 1813.

scopecontent.p: Gives excuses for why he has not paid money or salt to Woods.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by W[illia]m C. Chapline, Jr.,George Knox and Benjamin McMahan) between Stephen R. Wilson and Archibald Woods that Wilson will not challenge title to land, 6 November 1813.

scopecontent.p: Includes copy of DS, of affidavit, (witnessed by George Knox, Alexand[e]r Chaplinand Benj[ami]n W. Mahan) of Joseph Spencer that he will not challenge the title of Woods to the land. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Lloyd Biddle) between Archi[bal]d Woodsand James Atkinson for Atkinson to rent land, 12 November 1813.
Franklin Woods, Detroit [Michigan], to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 17 November 1813.

scopecontent.p: Arrived in Detroit "the second of October after a long and tedious march of about 30 days from camp Seneca. The 27th Regiment has taken quarters in this place for this Winter which was verry [sic] lucky for the officers having lost all their clothing." Has been sick with Billious [bilious] fever. Learning duties of a Lieutenant.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Nancy Woods) between John Parks and Archi[bal]d Woodsfor Woods to lease a cooper's shop and house to Parks, 25 November 1813.

scopecontent.p: Parks is to pay fifty flour barrels annually.

did.unittitle: Polly Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Ann Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 November 1813.

scopecontent.p: Is concerned about Betsy's ill health. Her family is well. She has eight children.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Webb,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 9 December 1813.

scopecontent.p: Needs flour.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Downey,Gurnsey County, Ohio, to Archey [Archibald] Woods, Whillin [Wheeling] [Virginia] [West Virginia], 11 December 1813.

scopecontent.p: Says it is second time he has written Woods to come for money. Asks to have deed drawn in Huey Gilliland's name.

did.unittitle: A. Hamilton, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 18 December 1813.

scopecontent.p: Sends to Woods for money.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 December 1813.

scopecontent.p: Letter from Gen. [Lewis] Cassindicates troops are sickly--upwards for 2,000 are down. Has sent Woods an old deed of trust.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Chillicothe, [Ohio], to Ar[chibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 December 1813.

scopecontent.p: Concerns possible repeal of a law [creating a new County?]. [?] Hammond has written [William] Sharplessadvising him to take Paull's property.

did.unittitle: James H. Relfe, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 24 December 1813.

scopecontent.p: Requests for flour.

did.unittitle: Order of Archi[bald] Woods, Lieut[enant] Col[onel] 4th Reg't., Virginia M[ilitia],to Basil Riggs, Sheriff to pay James Campbell and Thomas Hugh[e]sfor repairing public arms, 1814.
P[hilip] Doddridge,Charlestown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 January 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns money [?] McCluney hopes to recover in a law suit.

did.unittitle: John G. Young, Chillicothe, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 January 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns creation of and location of courthouse in Monroe County, Ohio. Did not pass lower house.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Spencer Biddle) between Lloyd Biddle of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] for Woods to lease to Biddle a tavern, house and twenty acres of land, 8 January 1814.
Franklin Woods, Detroit, [Michigan] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia. Illness among troops, 10 January.

scopecontent.p: Expects an attack before spring by British and Indians.

did.unittitle: Absalom Ridgely, West Liberty, Virginia [West Virginia], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 January 1814.

scopecontent.p: Making excuses for John Wheeler who has been unable to attend musters.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] White,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 February 1814.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy white oaks from Woods.

did.unittitle: Agreement between John Cunningham and Archi[bal]d Woodsboth of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] for Cunningham to work as carpenter, joiner and farmer, 4 February 1814.
W[illia]m Poage,Staunton, [Virginia], to Arch[i]b[al]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 February 1814.

scopecontent.p: Has received $200 from [Daniel] Sheffey.Requests family news. "the Democ[rats]here are very sanguin[e]in expectation of peace. I think the probability is that if Clay's oratorial powers can avert it he will."

did.unittitle: Levin Okey, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, living near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 February 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns creation of new County [i.e. Monroe]. Road has not been marked.

did.unittitle: Appointment of Lewis Bonnet as major of 4th Regiment, 10th Brigade, third Division of Virginia Militia, 7 February 1814.

scopecontent.p: Signed by J[ame]s Harbour,Governor. Registered by J. W. Pleasants. Bears seal of Virginia.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 February 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns selection of Wheeling.

did.unittitle: A. Hamilton, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Lieut. Colo[nel] Archibald Woods,4th Regt. Virginia Militia Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 3 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Change in law for time of training.

did.unittitle: Agness Ramsey, Fish Creek Hills, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling Creek, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods if he has purchased the place which Joseph Ramsey purchased.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Biggs,West Liberty, [Virginia], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Obligated to attend at West Liberty on business of Wheeling Bank. Capt. Howlett is gone to Washington. Lt. Brady will attend for him. Howlett's opinion is that companies of Capt. Jef[f]ries, Gratehouse,Frazier, and Howlett compose the upper Battalion.

did.unittitle: M. Smith, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Requesting terms a tract of land may be purchased on.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to [?], 18 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Doubts if appointment of M. J. White as president of [a bank to be organized by the Ohio Company?] would be good.

did.unittitle: Levi Barber, Marietta, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Has gotten commissioners to lay out road from Marietta to Monroe County line. Needs information from Woods on where a road from Woodfield ought to intersect.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s McClure,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 19 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Requests Woods' presence at a stockholders meeting.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,Locust Grove, [Kentucky], to [Archibald Woods], 21 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Received Woods' letter advising of Chapline succeeding against Crissap [Cresap]. Sending money by his son, John, to reimburse Woods for payment of land taxes. Knows nothing of [?] Doddridge, or of mortgage he has against Mr. Hall. Has asked about land and house belonging to Mr. Smith.

did.unittitle: Mathew [Sield?],Fish Creek [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, n.p., 29 March 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns runaway slave.

did.unittitle: Deed from Archi[bald] Woodsand Anne [Ann] Woods, to John Ramsey of Washington County, Pennsylvania, April 1814.

scopecontent.p: For 120 acres on the Ohio River.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clarisville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 April 1814.

scopecontent.p: Has settled with William Sharpless. Woods can receive 50 shares of bank stock.

did.unittitle: Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 7 April 1814.

scopecontent.p: Sends survey.

did.unittitle: John Mills, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] woods, n.p., 14 April 1814.

scopecontent.p: Needs six bushels of corn.

did.unittitle: Franklin Woods, Detroit, [Michigan] to [father] Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 17 April [1814].

scopecontent.p: [George] Croghan is commander. His mode of commanding is preferable to former commander, Col. Butler. Franklin Woods would like to resign. Is in debt. Did not receive money sent out by [George] Paull. Describes fort.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by W[illia]m Beckett) between Archi[bal]d Woodsand James Atkison, both of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 April 1814.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease land to Atkison.

did.unittitle: Aaron Denman, Philadelphia, [Pennsylvania], to Thomas Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 April 1814.

scopecontent.p: Discusses dry goods. "I would, not recommend your going into business until peace is made."

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Brownsville, [Pennsylvania] to Ar[chibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [28] April 1814.

scopecontent.p: Betsy [(Woods) Paull] continues to mend, On trip to visit his father. Major Gwynn says 26, 27, & 28th Reg'ts will be consolidated. Expects to lose his rank. "Betsy wishes you to write her as soon as her mother is confined."

did.unittitle: John Ewing, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[i]b[al]d Woods,n.p., 17 May 1814.

scopecontent.p: Applies for ar[r]est of Arch[i]b[al]d Hamiltonon charges he received twenty dollars from James Burrus who was applying for exemption from service.
Includes, DS, affidavit, n.d., of Samuel McClure. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Proxy (witnessed by [Ju?] R. Munzon) from Geo[rge] Paullto Archibald Woods, 21 May 1814.

scopecontent.p: To vote for directions in the Ohio Company.

did.unittitle: Arrest warrant for Archibald Hamilton signed by James H. [Relfe?], 21 May 1814.

scopecontent.p: Includes DS, copy of charges against Hamilton. 3 pages.

did.unittitle: Fran[klin] Woods,Detroit, [Michigan], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 May 1814.

scopecontent.p: Few soldiers left in Regiment. Mentions consolidations and possibility of Paull and himself being extra officers and struck off. 27th Regiment has been disgraced. Cannot yet clothes. "if any officer appears on parade without blue pantaloons and boots he is immediately arrest[ed].

did.unittitle: Ralph Smith, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 3 June 1814.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy land from Woods.

did.unittitle: Stephen R. Wilson, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 June 1814.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Chapline can inform about the discoveries about [property] lines. Will expect sheep and probably will take some half breed merino.

did.unittitle: Appointment of William Fans as captain in the fourth regiment, tenth brigade and third division of Virginia Militia. Signed by Linah Mims, lieutenant-governor and J. H. Pleasants. Bears seal of Virginia, 27 June 1814.
Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to William Poage, near Staunton, [Virginia], 27 June 1814.

scopecontent.p: Mrs. Woods had twins, one of whom died within 5 days. Expects Indian treaty. " I do not know but it will be my turn to go to Norfolk in the next call or requision of militia."

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Charles Ham[m]ond, Belmont County, [Ohio], 11 August 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerning sale of Sharpless house.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to John Connill [Connell], Comm[andan]t of the 10th Brigade, Brooke County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 19 August 1814.

scopecontent.p: Discussing uniforms.

did.unittitle: Garrison Jones, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 August 1814.

scopecontent.p: Trying to sell Woods a horse.

did.unittitle: Asher Jones, n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 August 1814.

scopecontent.p: Concerns W[illia]m Bakerwho denies endorsing Jones' note; and salt.

did.unittitle: Asher Jones, n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 11 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: Trying to settle debt.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Zanesville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: Will send Woods his horse if cannot find a better one at fair price.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Zanesville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: Sending Woods his horse. Will send epaulets.

did.unittitle: John Connell. Comm[an]d[in]g 10[th] B[rigade] Virginia M[ilitia], to A[rchibald] Woods,4th Reg't, Virginia M[ilitia] Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: Orders Woods to a muster.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to George Paull, Zanesville, Ohio, 16 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: Sold sorrell horse. Has got no marching orders yet. Petitions being circulated concerning location of County seat of Monroe [County, Ohio].

did.unittitle: Promissory note (witnessed by Thomas Wells) of Thomas [?] with Archi[bal]d Woods,19 September 1814.
Memorandum of an agreement (witnessed by B. Fawcett) made between John Fawcett and Archi[bal]d Woods,27 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: for Fawcett acting as attorney for Samuel Cope to sell a house and lot in Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Woods.

did.unittitle: Bond for title from Benjamin Farquher of Clinton County, Ohio and Josiah Updegroff of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] to Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 September 1814.

scopecontent.p: For a house and lot in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 9 October 1814.

scopecontent.p: Sends what he thinks register's fees are.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to William Irwin, Richmond, Virginia, 10 October 1814.

scopecontent.p: Sends a petition concerning militia fines. Expects lawsuit.

did.unittitle: The Librarian, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] Library Room to Archibald Woods, n.p., November 1814.

scopecontent.p: Gives hours. Fines will be strictly enforced. All funds on hand will go to purchase books. Arrears on shares must be paid.

did.unittitle: John S., Baltimore, [Maryland], to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 December 1814.

scopecontent.p: Does not have any desire to sell land he owns in Ohio County.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Franklin Woods) between Daniel Steenrod and Archi[bal]d Woodsboth of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 December 1814.

scopecontent.p: for Woods to lease land to Steenrod.

did.unittitle: H. McCluny, Brooke Court House, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a lawsuit [Philip] Doddridge is handling for Woods.

did.unittitle: General orders from Claiborne W. Gooch D[eputy] A[djutant] G[eneral] for Moses Green, A[djutant] Gen[eral]. Adjutant-General's Office, Richmond, [Virginia], 12 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Orders 10th, 17th, 18th, and 10th Brigades to Norfolk.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to L[evi] Barber,Marietta, [Ohio], 15 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Makes a deposit on quarter sections. Has been at Woodfield clearing streets. Hopes to see Barber when commissioners meet to fix seat of justice for Monroe. Has been engaged marking a road to the Ohio from the new town.

did.unittitle: Bill of sale (witnessed by Lloyd Biddle) from Spencer Biddle to Archi[bal]d Woods,19 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: For property given to Woods by Biddle to satisfy rent that is in arrears.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to James Smith, Capteena, 23 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Concerns quarter section of land Smith wants to enter. The bearers, Mr. Smith and Baker want to rent. Show them the land where Duvall lives.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Levi Barber, Marietta, [Ohio], 24 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Wants to enter quarter sections.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Has been recommended as coroner of his County. Would like appointment to Woods staff. Wants appointment and hope Woods' staff are not required to march.

did.unittitle: Zach[aria]s Biggs,Round Bottom Mills, near Cincinnati, [Ohio] to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 January 1815.

scopecontent.p: Jesse Hunt's brother owns land Woods is interested in. Jesse Hunt offers ten dollars per acre for land Woods owns near his brother's land. Discusses flour milling and whiskey distilling.

did.unittitle: Henry Stevenson, Charlestown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archib[al]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 February 1815.

scopecontent.p: Asking to be appointed surgeon to [4th] Reg't, Virginia Militia.
Includes, LS, [4 February 1815] of John Connell. H. Marshall and W[illia]m McHenry to Woods, recommending Stevenson.

did.unittitle: Muster roll of a company of the 4th Regiment Virginia Militia commanded by Herman Greathouse, 9 February 1815.
Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., and John Cunningham, n.p., 10 February 1815

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease land to Cunningham.

did.unittitle: John Mills, n.p., to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 11 February 1815.

scopecontent.p: Is satisfied that he received thirteen bushels of corn.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 11 February 1815.

scopecontent.p: Adam Kellar wishes to ride home to Richmond instead of marching with rest of troops.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 12 February 1815.

scopecontent.p: Trying to rent land for Woods.

did.unittitle: Muster roll of a company of the 4th Regiment, Virginia Militia commanded by William Irwin, 13 February 1815.
Noah Zane, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to J[ohn] Marshall,Richmond, [Virginia], 14 February 1815.

scopecontent.p: Introduces [Archibald] Woods to Marshall.

did.unittitle: Appointment of John Millet as ensign in the 4th Regiment, 18th Brigade and third Division of the Virginia Militia. Signed by W[ilson] C[ary] Nicholas. Registered by J. W. Pleasants. Bears seal of Virginia, 20 February 1815.
Communication from A[rchibald] W[oods],Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to his troops in the 4th Regiment, Virginia Militia, 11 March 1815.
W[illia]m [?], Brooke Courthouse, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio [County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 March 1815.

scopecontent.p: John Spence has been arrested for desertion. Asks for a court martial.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Joshua Molliston) of Nathan Goodridge, n.p., and John Morley, n.p., with Archibald Woods, n.p., 20 March 1815.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease land to Goodridge and Morley.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Chapline,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Wood[s],Wheeling Creek, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 March 1815.

scopecontent.p: Neither state nor federal government has funds to pay troops. Arrangements will be made to pay them at a later date.

did.unittitle: John Connell, Charlestown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 26 March 1815.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to remit John Spence's sentence for desertion and release him.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by James Smith) between James Barrett, n.p., and Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 27 March 1815.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease land to Barrett and for Barrett to repair a cabin and clear land.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Adjutant General at Washington City, [D.C.], 27 April 1815.

scopecontent.p: Woods explains the unusual nature of his muster return due to the circumstances of their march.

did.unittitle: Lewis Bonnett, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 12 May 1815.

scopecontent.p: Bonnett resigns his commission as major of the 1st Battalion of the 4th Reg't of Virginia M[ilitia].

did.unittitle: Roll of officers of 4th Reg[i]m[en]t, [Virginia Militia], 16 May 1815.
Thomas Smith, Capteena, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 July 1815.

scopecontent.p: Got three quarter [sections] of land.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Elliott,St. Louis, [Missouri],to A[rchibald] Woods,6 August 1815.

scopecontent.p: Woffert does not want to sell his land.

did.unittitle: Wil[l]iam Nolin,n.p., to Arche [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 6 August 1815.

scopecontent.p: Has bought land from Jacob Ash that he had no right to sell.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 7 August 1815.

scopecontent.p: Has no recollection of articles of agreement between Geo[rge] Poageand Woods.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,Carlisle, Pennsylvania, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 15 August 1815.

scopecontent.p: Will stick to his terms for selling land. Asks Woods to sell his lame horse.

did.unittitle: Deed from John Feay (deputy sheriff acting for Basil Riggs, sheriff) to James Arbutton both of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 August 1815.

scopecontent.p: For 56 acres of land sold for delinquent taxes.

did.unittitle: Promissory note from [Archibald Woods] and [?] with Northwestern Bank of Virginia, 2 September 1815.
Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 11 September 1815.

scopecontent.p: Send note against James Woods (with deed to him) to Joseph Woods.
Includes, ALS, n.d., from J[ames] Woods to [Robert Woods?]. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses W. Chapline, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 September 1815.

scopecontent.p: Although Woods thinks settlement of Poages' claim against him made by Chapline and Thomas [Woods] is totally against him, he will agree to it.

did.unittitle: John McLure, Bedford, [Virginia] to James McLure, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 October 1815.

scopecontent.p: Has found a slave who ran away from Archibald Woods. Has promised slave if he would return he would not be whipped.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Jeffery,Major 4[th] Regt. Virginia M[ilitia], n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Whelling, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 October 1815.

scopecontent.p: Requests commission as lieutenant for Jon Curtis if Woods has it.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., to [?] Jeffries, n.p., 23 October 1815.

scopecontent.p: States when he wants to hold a battalion court of inquiry and a regimental court of inquiry.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to William Croghan, Ju[nio]r, Litchfield, Connecticut, 12 November 1815.

scopecontent.p: Does not wish to buy Croghan's land at the price Croghan named. Will sell his horse for him.

did.unittitle: A. Caldwell, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 23 Nov[ember 1815?].

scopecontent.p: Tells Woods, McCluny of Charlestown is in Wheeling if he wishes to see him.

did.unittitle: John Eaton, Morristown, Ohio to Archibold [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 November 1815.

scopecontent.p: A man wishes to buy land. Asks Woods for amount. Mr. Scot[t] wants to know if Mr. Morrison can have a set of stable logs.

did.unittitle: Caleb Nice, n.p., to officers of the court martial, 25 November 1815.

scopecontent.p: Did not know of muster until day of muster. His knee was out of place and he had no horse to ride.

did.unittitle: John Poage, Greenup County, [Kentucky], to Archib[a]l[d] Wood[s],near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 November 1815.

scopecontent.p: Wants to make some disposition of a military land claim placed in his hands by Woods fourteen years previously.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] and Jasper Malory and John Long of Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 December 1815.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease land and ferries to Malory and Long. Malory and Long can also tap sugar maples.

did.unittitle: George Madison, Frankfort, [Kentucky] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 2 December 1815.

scopecontent.p: Woods' land has been sold for taxes but can redeemed within two years of sale by paying taxes plus interest. Woods should send money for taxes for 1814 and 1815.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 December 1815.

scopecontent.p: Clay has drawn up petition to President to establish road to Wheeling. Meigs says tract for sale in Indiana Territory will be open for sale in April or May.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], [1816?].

scopecontent.p: Will not be able to go [to Indiana Territory?]. Fears prices will be too high. A tract of his land (4066 acres in Wood County) was sold for taxes. Asks Woods to redeem.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of the behavior of Lydia Dill in trying to alienate W. J. Zane from his daughters, [1816?].
John Connell, B[rigadier] G[eneral], Brooke Courthouse, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Colo[nel] A[rchibald] Woods,4th Reg[imen]t, [Virginia Militia], n.p., 8 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Orders a day of training of officers and a day of regimental muster.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Miller,New York, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Miller's brother does not yet know the result of his application to cob. Walker relating to lands on Green River. Discusses bank paper. Hears there is petition before Maryland legislature to establish a state bank. Has Phila[delphia] worried. Mentions possibility of a turnpike to Wheeling.

did.unittitle: E.C. Wilson, [Washington, D.C.], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 January [1816?].

scopecontent.p: Does not expect deposit being replaced by any act of Congress. Cumberland Road must await annual appropriation.

did.unittitle: L[evi] Barber,Marietta, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Does not have extra capital. to invest in Woodfield [Ohio].

did.unittitle: Samuel Wilson, n.p., to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Will return a runaway slave for Woods for a fee.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 20 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Decision on U.S. Road to Wheeling has been referred to Sec. of Treasury; however, Dallas is a Pennsylvanian.

did.unittitle: Robert Pogue, Mason County, [Kentucky], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Unable to check on Woods' land, but thinks it has been sold for taxes. Woods' mother is in her usual state of health, but her memory fails her. Gives news of his family.

did.unittitle: Felix Scott, Grandville, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 January 1816.

scopecontent.p: Defends the assessment of Woods' land which Woods thinks is too high.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 February 1816.

scopecontent.p: Chief of Wyandot Indians is dead and his tribes are desirous of selling their lands. No report on U.S. Road. House of Representatives are now discussing direct tax. Mentions birth of a son to Mrs. Paull [Woods' daughter].

did.unittitle: John Reiley, n.p., to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 18 February 1816.

scopecontent.p: Offers to trade money and horses for land.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 February 1816.

scopecontent.p: Forwarded Woods' letter and memorial from citizens of Wheeling to Clay. James Ross and Charleston people are exciting opposition. [?] Connel has obtained depositions on a road from Charleston to Zanesville and made a statement relative to Town of Charleston. Asks Woods for depositions concerning Wheeling. Lands in Indiana not ready for sale yet.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], March 1816.

scopecontent.p: President has made a communication to both houses concerning Cumberland Road. It contains a statement of expenditure already made and those necessary to complete it. Commissioner of land office has promised a complete map of Indiana Territory. Will send to Woods.

did.unittitle: Samuel Parr, Vincennes, [Indiana Territory], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Describes Indiana Territory, its land, its inhabitants and prospects for the sale of the public lands.

did.unittitle: Moses Shepherd, City [of] Washington, [D.C.], to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Secretary of Treasury reported in favor of Wheeling [for u.s. Road].

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Secretary [of Treasury] has decided in favor of Wheeling for the Cumberland Road route. Senate has passed bill for levying direct tax of three million dollars. House of Representatives is considering bank bill.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City,[D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Secretary of Treasury reported to President on Cumberland Road, in favor of Wheeling. Mentions land tax of three million dollars. National Bank bill is under consideration in the House of Representatives. House passed bill authorizing members to frank during recess. Doesn't think it will pass Senate.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Charles D. Knox and Geo[rge] Knox) between Samuel Cockayne and Archi[bal]d Woodsboth of Ohio County, Virginia, 6 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: For Cockayne to sell Woods two hundred acres of land in Warren County, Ohio. Woods has right to give land back.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Has been informed that President confirmed report of Secretary of Treasury concerning the [Cumberland] Road. Exertions now will be to procure a large appropriation. Commissioners of land office cannot fix any time when land in Indiana Territory will be sold.

did.unittitle: Alpheus D. Willson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archib[al]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio [County] Virginia [West Virginia], 14 March [1816].

scopecontent.p: Has received five dollars from Woods. Sends pantaloons back to him. Asks about his militia discharge. J. G. Jackson has declared as a candidate. Willson is coroner.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington City, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Report on Cumberland Road has been referred to Committee in House of Representatives. Republican caucus voted Monroe and Tompkins as candidates. "on the subject of the road Monroe was decidedly your friend, his influence was important. I hope it will not be forgotten. However this subject must remain with yourself." Owing to sickness of draftsman in the land office has not been able to procure a map of the Indiana Territory.

did.unittitle: Zach[aria]s Biggs,Round Bottom Mills, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Two hundred acres of land bought from Sam[ue]l Cockainis worth about four dollars an acre. Discusses Capteena land owned by Jeremiah Hurst. Glad [Cumberland Road] is settled. Gives price of flour.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: The committee to whom the Cumberland Road was referred have reported in favor of the appropriation. House of Representatives laid 30 per cent ad valorem duty on imported cottons. National Bank bill is now is Senate.

did.unittitle: Moses Shepherd, City [of] Washington, [D.C.], to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: [Cumberland] Road being confirmed, he is wa[i]ting the result of the Appropriation. Connell and Doddridge still have plan for a military road. Shepherd hopes to be appointed a Superintendent, but if not wants contract for a section of it. "Mr. Clay has done all he promised but Ruggles never gave out for which I do regard him as one of our particular friends. "

did.unittitle: Thomas Smith, Mouth of Captinah [Capteena], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 March 1916.

scopecontent.p: Would like to rent place where James Barrett lives.

did.unittitle: Samuel Parr, Vincennes, [Indiana], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Public lands have not been surveyed because Indians ordered the surveyors of f. [William Henry] Harrison owns land near Vincennes and has laid it out in town lots.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 27 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Wants to borrow $1500 to use to buy bank stock.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] White,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 27 March 1816.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy or borrow anvil.

did.unittitle: Bond for an unidentified person to pay Archi[bal]d Woods125 dollars, 30 March 1816.
B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Resolutions introduced to appoint committee to look into military road through Charleston. Bills passed House to admit Indiana and Mississippi as states. Nothing done on appropriation for building Cumberland Road.

did.unittitle: John Gardiner, General Lana Office [Washington, D.C.], to [Benjamin] Ruggles, Senate U[nited] States [Washington, D.C.], 3 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Draughtsman in office is unable to attend to business. Sends sketch of Indiana Territory taken from Bradley's maps by a pupil of the draughtsman.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Senate Chamber, [Washington, D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: House has passed appropriation of $300,000 for Cumberland Road.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to L[evi] Barber,Marietta [Ohio], 11 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Necessary for Woods and Barber to pay up all the installments on the land Woodfield stands on so lot owners can have deeds. Wants Barber to go to Indiana with him. Wants to speculate with Barber's interest in Woodfield.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Irwin,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Resigns his commission as captain in the Wheeling Light Infantry.

did.unittitle: John Richardson, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,17 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Asks to borrow $160.

did.unittitle: E. McClandhan, Botetourt County, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: McClandhan's father needs taxes paid on land.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Concerns appointment for superintendent of Cumberland Road. Connell has withdrawn. [Moses] Shepherd and Rolfe are applicants.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Claiborne W. Gooch, Adjunct Gen[era]l Richmond, [Virginia], 28 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Concerning legal difficulties in collecting militia fines.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,29 April 1816.

scopecontent.p: Will pay money to redeem land for taxes to County clerk of Wood County. Wilson's daughter died on [April] 15.

did.unittitle: Wil[lia]m McCoy,Lt. n.p., to Col. Archibald Woods, n.p., 2 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Resigns commission.

did.unittitle: L[evi] Barber,Marietta, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Has not heard from servants. Sends amount due on a fractional section. Has heard nothing from Indiana lands.

did.unittitle: John Bonnett, Big Wheeling, Creek, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 6 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Cannot attend training or regimental muster because of illness. Sends company return.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 15 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Sale of lots to [David] Person and [?] Jackson.

did.unittitle: David Person, n.p., to [?] Woods, n.p., 16 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Asks terms for a lot.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Stephen R. Wilson, n.p., 27 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Will take depositions in lawsuit of Wilson (as administrator of Rich[ar]d Nichols) vs. John Caldwell, Robert Woods, Archibald Woods et al. in District Chancery Court at Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia].

did.unittitle: A. Hamilton, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 29 May 1816.

scopecontent.p: Sends for corn meal.

did.unittitle: Thomas Wells, Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 4 June 1816.

scopecontent.p: Sends for land patents.

did.unittitle: S[tephen] R. Wilson,Wood County, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 June 1816.

scopecontent.p: Unable to attend taking of depositions in Wilsonvs. Caldwell, Woods et al.

did.unittitle: Cornelius Peterson, Woodfield, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 16 June 1816.

scopecontent.p: Shall be ready to raise house for Franklin Woods. Needs flour and money.

did.unittitle: [Spencer Biddle] To Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Verginney [Virginia] [West Virginia], 16 June 1816.

scopecontent.p: Request for payment of son's board.
Includes, AMs of account of [?] Woods with Biddle. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Philip Dod[d]ridge,Charleston, Brooke County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 June 1816.

scopecontent.p: Does not want to buy lots at Doddriage's price.

did.unittitle: E. C. Wilson, [Washington, D.C.], to G[eorge] Wash[ing]t[on] Wilson,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 June [1816].

scopecontent.p: Cumberland Road bill for $300,000 has passed. Majority struck out $30,000 for surveys of harbor bill. Determined to pro8trate system of interval improvements.
Includes speech, AM of Wilson, of [David] Crockett from notes made while Crockett was speaking. 2 pages.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, 29 June 1816.

scopecontent.p: Politics.

did.unittitle: Bond of title (witnessed by William T. Good) of John Feay with Archi[bald] Woods,both of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 July 1816.

scopecontent.p: For 178 acres in Ohio County.

did.unittitle: E. McClandhan, Botetourt County, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 July 1816.

scopecontent.p: McClandhan's father is concerned he will lose his land due to taxes. Asks Woods to pay them.

did.unittitle: John McCormick, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 July 1816.

scopecontent.p: Wanted to build house on his lot but County has laid foundation of temporary courthouse in front of his lot at Woodsfield.
Includes, ANS, of A[rchibald] W[oods]stating that he agreed to pay six dollars to commission to alter foundation of jail. 1 page.

did.unittitle: John Barr, Pickaway, [County, Ohio] to Archi[bal]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 July 1816.

scopecontent.p: Sends plat of public lands in Indiana. Gives his route to Indiana.

did.unittitle: S. Wing, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling Creek, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 July.

scopecontent.p: Watch with small glass is disposed of. Has two hunting watches left. Suggests Woods come to see them.
Includes, AM of Woods, memorandum of an agreement between G[eorge] P[aull]and A[rchibald] W[oods] for the purchase of land in Indiana. 2 pages.

did.unittitle: P[hilip] Doddridge,Charlestown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 July 1816.

scopecontent.p: Has looked at transcript of answers in lawsuit of S. R. Wilson vs. Woods et al. Thinks deeds are in office as part of W. Chapline, Jr.'s answer. Nothing more is necessary. Attendance at next term not necessary except for presence of patents.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Virginia [West Virginia], 1 August 1816.

scopecontent.p: Formal subpoena to attend at Chillicothe. Prisoner will not give his consent to his not going.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, [?], to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 August 1816.

scopecontent.p: James Smith has been to Marietta to enter fraction mar[k]ed A. Woods. He left deposit of sixteen dollars. Asks Woods to be his special bail in suit of James [Reff?]

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Cincinnati, [Ohio], to Ar[chibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 August 1816.

scopecontent.p: Gen[era]l [William Henry] Harrisonrecommends white river country very highly. Paull is concerned about what bank notes will be accepted as payment for land. Some of his are counterfeit.

did.unittitle: L[evi] Barber,Marietta, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 August 1816.

scopecontent.p: Gives circumstances of James Smith entering Woods' land.

did.unittitle: A. Swearingen, Washington, [Pennsylvania?], to Archabeld [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 19 August 1816.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to give his recollection of a settlement of an estate.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 August [1816].

scopecontent.p: Asks for two s[u]p[oen]as to be sent in lawsuit of Wilson vs. Woods et al. "We hung a negro here last Friday for rape on his mistress. The Methodists say he went strait [sic] to heaven." Shall have a new Judge on this circuit.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Louisville, [Kentucky], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 August 1816.

scopecontent.p: Concerns land in Indiana.

did.unittitle: Eug[enui]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 September 1816.

scopecontent.p: Asks if Woods' family will accompany his family to Augusta County, Virginia on a visit.

did.unittitle: Subpoena issued to William Chaplin, Joseph Coldwell, Alexander Coldwell, Archibald Woods and others as defendants in a lawsuit brought by Stephen R. Wilson (administrator of Richard Nichols) in the High Court of chancery of Clarksburgh [sic], [Virginia] [West Virginia]. Issued by [Sam Sprigg?], 11 September 1816.
Geo[rge] Paull,Vincennes, [Indiana], to Ar[chibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 September 1816.

scopecontent.p: Fourth day of [land] sales. Has not bought an acre. Describes lands and prices. Jesse Hunt will not sell until he writes his brother.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Vincennes, [Indiana], to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheelling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 September 1816.

scopecontent.p: Has bought 2 1/4 sections. Describes land and sales.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Capt. Henry Sockman, n.p., 22 September 1816.

scopecontent.p: Asks Sockman to assist Doct[o]r James Rolfe to count the public arms.
Includes ANS, of Sockman stating he has complied with the request. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Alpheus [D.?] Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Uncle A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 September 1816.

scopecontent.p: Franklin [Woods] fell from horse and dislocated shoulder. Wilson's mother and other family has started for Staunton.

did.unittitle: Elie Williams, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 24 September 1816.

scopecontent.p: Concerns meeting with Woods to discuss location of [Cumberland] Road.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Capt[ina Creek, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 October 1816.

scopecontent.p: Can not come to Wheeling because hogs get in his corn everyday. Has business at Court. Asks Woods to tend to a note at the bank.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 October 1816.

scopecontent.p: Describes assault and battery by James Smith over hogs getting into corn.

did.unittitle: Elij[ah] McClandhan,Botetourt C[oun]ty, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, at Wheeling, Ohio County, 31 October 1816.

scopecontent.p: Virginia Thanks Woods for paying taxes on land. A. Hamilton does not think he owes Woods any money [probably in setting Woodsvs. Lewis].

did.unittitle: Resignation of Arch[ibal]d Woodsas lie[u]t[enant] Col[one]l and commandant of the 4th Reg[imen]t Virginia M[ilitia], 4 November 1816.

scopecontent.p: Has served in militia for 37 years.

did.unittitle: Agreement of Zebadiah Miex, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] with [Archibald Woods], 6 November 1816.

scopecontent.p: To build a house. Gives specifications.

did.unittitle: Agreement [witnessed by Franklin Woods] between Archi[bal]d Woodsand Gabriel Wallings both of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 November 1816.

scopecontent.p: For Wallings to clear twenty acres of land within two years for which Woods will give him fifty acres in Monroe County, Ohio.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bald] Woodsand Samuel Sweney [Sweeney?], 23 November 1816.

scopecontent.p: For Sweney to clear eight acres of land.

did.unittitle: Spe[nce]r Biddle,n.p., to Col[o]n[e]l Woods, n.p., 3 December 1816.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to bring him teaspoons.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Irwin,Richmond, [Virginia], to Archabald [Archibald] Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 December 1816.

scopecontent.p: Concerns bank bills in Virginia General Assembly.

did.unittitle: M[atthe]w Houston,Natural Bridge, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: Informs Woods of the death of his brother, James Woods.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Washington City, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: Discussed embassy with Secretary [of State ?]. The committee have reported a bill favorable to the Caldwell resolutions and made Columbus [Ohio?] a point. Compensation bill is repealed. Banks will commence specie payment.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsand Henry Bowers, 12 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease eleven acres to Bowers.

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,Nashville, [Tennessee], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Jackson's Treaty with the Creek Indians and the opening up of land in Georgia and Alabama as a result. Describes land. Gives news of death of his father [James Woods].

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: Election of James Moore. Sale of public lands.

did.unittitle: J[asper] Mallory,Capteen [Captina Creek, Belmont County, Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 15 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: Samuel [Sweeny ?] has left place. James Smith has Mallory indicated for keeping a disorderly house.

did.unittitle: S. Connell, Brooke Courthouse [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 February 1817.

scopecontent.p: Dispute between John Connell, and John Dix over their co-partnership in Brooke Furnace will be arbitrated. Woods is to serve on panel.

did.unittitle: Lease from Archi[bald] Woodsto James Atkinson for land, 1 March 1817.
R. E. Higginbotham, Cash[ie]r Union Bank of Maryland, to F[ranklin] Woods, Cash[ie]r, 4 March 1817.

scopecontent.p: Gives status of Wheeling bank notes.

did.unittitle: John Coli, James Philops, Woodsfield [Ohio], to Archabale [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 March 1817.

scopecontent.p: Have plank and are ready to start on a house for Woods.

did.unittitle: Jo[seph] Cloyd,Rockbridge County, [Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 12 March 1817.

scopecontent.p: Death of James Woods. Account of murder of one negro slave by another. Discusses prices. Asks Woods help in settling debts in Ohio. Neighborhood news.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Levi Barker, Marietta, [Ohio], 17 March 1817.

scopecontent.p: Asks Barber to send land certificate.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of lease from Archi[bal]d Woodsto John Stewart of a house in Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 March 1817.
Ja[me]s Gilliland,n.p., to Archa [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 March 1817.

scopecontent.p: Wants to meet Woods at St. Clairsville and pay him principle. Then Woods can see W[illia]m Downeyfor interest.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by Geo[rge] Paull) between Jacob McKinney of Northampton County, Pennsylvania and Moses Shepherd of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 April 1817.

scopecontent.p: For McKinney to build a bridge on the [Cumberland] Road.

did.unittitle: Elie Williams and Moses Shepherd, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 16 April 1817.

scopecontent.p: In conference with [?] Thompson, they have decided to delay purchase of goods till season for laying in fall cargo. Regret Franklin Woods cannot be put on a certainty as to company's employ.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to [Elie] Williams and [Moses] Shepherd, 20 April 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerning their letter to him about the business of their company and their not hiring his son, Franklin.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,Locust Grove near Louisville, [Kentucky], to Archebald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 May 1817.

scopecontent.p: Opened Woods' letter to William Croghan, Jr. Gives Woods opinions on land in Indiana. Thanks Woods for previous friendly acts.

did.unittitle: Bond of Cleaburn Simms and Richard Simms with Archibald Woods (sheriff of Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia]), 7 May 1817.

scopecontent.p: For Cleaburn Simms to serve as deputy sheriff to finish up his business as the former sheriff.

did.unittitle: Jim Carrel, Steubenville, [Ohio], to Franklin Wood[s],Wheelling, [Wheeling] Virginia [West Virginia], 13 May 1817.

scopecontent.p: Asks compensation for a great cost given to Woods by [George] Paul[l].

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,Baltimore, [Maryland], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 May 1817.

scopecontent.p: Sends four hundred dollars to pay Robert Woods.

did.unittitle: Promissory note, of John Miller to Archi[bal]d Woods,20 June 1817.
Agreement between John Dugan and Benj[ami]n Lintonon one part and Moses Shepherd and Archi[bal]d Woodsof the other part, 1 July 1817.

scopecontent.p: For Dugan and Linton to build a bridge as part of the [Cumberland] Road.
Includes agreement, (witnessed by Thomas McGeer), DS, of Matthew Stewart of Pittsburgh to fulfill above contract, 19 September 1817.
Includes agreement, (witnessed by Ben Galloway), DS, of Thomas McGeer and Henry Jordan to fulfill above contract.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paul[l],n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 13 July 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerns [land purchase?].

did.unittitle: Jacob Windle, Woodsfield, Monroe County, Ohio, to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheelin[g], Ohio County, Virginia,[West Virginia], 21 July 1817.

scopecontent.p: Boards for Woods' house in Woodsfield are ready.

did.unittitle: Daniel Steenrod, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 5 August 1817.

scopecontent.p: Dispute over stone the Irishmen quarried.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Monroe County, Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 August 1817.

scopecontent.p: Unable to do Woods' work.

did.unittitle: Daniel Steenrod, n.p., to A. Woods, n.p., 21 August 1817.

scopecontent.p: Would like to keep a hand he has hired to drive his oxen a few more days.

did.unittitle: Mary F. Mallory, Captine, [Capteena, Belmont County, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 August 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerns digging a well.

did.unittitle: John Hart, Steubenville, [Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Will build wall. Asks for advance of fifty dollars.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 9 September 1917.

scopecontent.p: Speaks of a third party [J. Mallory] who has done all in his power against him and against whom he has a judgment.

did.unittitle: J[asper] Mallory,C[aptina?], Belmont [County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Does not think [James] Smith has proof of slander.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of an explanation by Archi[bal]d Woods[while sheriff of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia]], 19 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Of his handling of an execution.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Captina, [Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Needs planks. Hopes to settle dispute between himself and [James] Smith.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Thomas Smith, Capteena [Belmont County, Ohio], 22 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Sonny Smith has been ill so long. Man from Kentucky needs his horse.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to uncle A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: A. Werninger has Negro boy for sale. He ran away and is confined to jail. "The family are well and doing well considering the great loss we have sustained." Asks it he will be safe in receiving the notes of the Ohio Company for taxes.

did.unittitle: H[e]nry [Boos?],Vinsennes [Vincennes, Indiana], to W[illia]m Clark,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Writes by Mr. Woods. Enjoys good health and expects to settle there.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses Shepherd, n.p., 30 September 1817.

scopecontent.p: Problems with building a bridge [for Cumberland Road].

did.unittitle: Daniel Steenrod, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 3 October 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerns problems with his hauling stone for the Cumberland Road.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Jos[ias] Thompson,n.p., 3 October 1817.

scopecontent.p: Woods is upset over Thompson's suggestion that someone else should take charge of bridge building in the area [for the Cumberland Road].

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to John Long, Capteena [Belmont County, Ohio], 7 October 1817.

scopecontent.p: Directions for building a house.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 October 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerns elections.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses Shepherd, n.p., 10 October 1817.

scopecontent.p: Concerns building bridge at Lee's Run [for the Cumberland Road] and paying the laborers.

did.unittitle: William Croyhan, Jr., Louisville, Kentucky, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 November 1817.

scopecontent.p: Will accept Woods' offer to buy his land.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Archibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 November 1817.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to draft a form of an assignment of the contract for Paull to endorse.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, to Col. Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 20 November 1817.
Geo[rge] Paull,Columbus, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 December 1817.

scopecontent.p: Legislature has done nothing of importance. Legislature is discussing defects in the Constitution. Mentions various bank bills. "The Legislature seems very much in the Spirit of making banks and new counties." Col. Poage mentioned in his letter that Woods' mother has been stricken with the palsy.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 December 1817.

scopecontent.p: Mallory is upset that Woods has rented the store at the mouth of the Capteena with one acre of ground to Henry Swippe. Does not want Swippe to have the ground. Thinks J[ames] Smith and Swippe are trying to run him off.

did.unittitle: Memorandum (draft) of an agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsand William Waddell both of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1818.

scopecontent.p: for Woods to lease a grist mill and house to Waddell.

did.unittitle: John Scott, n.p., to Archibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 January 1818.

scopecontent.p: Discontent of people renting land from Woods.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Wood[s],Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 January 1818.

scopecontent.p: Mallory is going to give up possession of Woods place. Blames troubles on [James] Smith and H[enry] Swippy. Asks Woods not to rent the place to them.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, n.p., to A[rchibald] Wood[s],Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 31 January 1818.

scopecontent.p: Needs Woods to appear at suit of [Fract?] against him. Blames [James?] Smith for the lawsuit being brought. Discusses his dispute with Smith involving a letter.

did.unittitle: John Wishart, Washington, [Pennsylvania], to Tho[ma]s Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 1 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Sends vacine crust.

did.unittitle: James Vance, n.p., to Archie [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 1 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Will move to the place Mr. Parks lives on and intends to comply with barga[i]n Vance and Woods agreed on.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to Rob[er]t Bre[c]kenridge,Louisville, Kentucky, 2 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Traces chain of title for a lot and house in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to [Archibald Woods], 2 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Tells Woods how to proceed in collecting pay for his son from Paymaster General.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Wood[s],n.p., 9 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Promises to make a final settlement of their business.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,Jr., Louisville, Kentucky to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Has written previously accepting Woods' offer for his land. "The family of my father has been greatly distressed occasioned by the death of my uncle Genl. G. R. Clark." Growth of Louisville is astonishing.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of a lease from Archi[bal]d Woods,to James Vance, 12 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: For a house, shop, garden and field.

did.unittitle: James Atkinson, n.p., to [Archibald] Woods, 25 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Is leaving plantation and wants to settle up with Woods.
