did.unittitle: Robert Pogue, Maysville, [Kentucky] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, 7 April 1818.

scopecontent.p: Merchants in Maysville are dissatisfied with those in Pittsburgh, Would like for men to set up commission business in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 April 1818.

scopecontent.p: Ohio members have called upon [William Henry] Crawford on subject of his orders to receivers of public monies. Has received money for Woods' son, Franklin. Bill has passed Senate to allow purchasers one more year to pay for lands.

did.unittitle: John Jones, Monroe County, Virginia [West Virginia], to Archi[bald] Woods,Whelan [Wheeling], Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 April 1818.

scopecontent.p: Concerns business dealings with [?] Nichols.

did.unittitle: Ro[ber]t Breckinridge,Louisville, [Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 April 1818.

scopecontent.p: Doubts sale of a lot in Wheeling due to foreclosure is legal. As Martin's executor, he must try to recover the property.

did.unittitle: James Atkinson, n.p., to [?] Woods, n.p., 26 March 1818.

scopecontent.p: Dispute over number of rails counted toward rent.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Smith,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 May 1818.

scopecontent.p: Concerns the arbitration of a dispute over whiskey.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods], to Geo[rge] R. Poage,[Maysville], Kentucky, May 1818.

scopecontent.p: Men in Wheeling are planning a commission merchant house to supply merchants in Kentucky so they no longer have to deal with Pittsburgh.

did.unittitle: [?] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia].

scopecontent.p: Took warrant of attorney to enter judgment against Charles Wells.

did.unittitle: L[evi] Barber,Marietta, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 July 1818.

scopecontent.p: No Kentucky paper in the Bank. Negotiation with Bank at Cincinnati has taken all our paper south of Chillicothe.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 July 1818.

scopecontent.p: Received Woods' letter and a letter and power of attorney from Robert [Poage?]. Will investigate possibility of brother defrauding a brother and the helpless children of the brother.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 19 July 1818.

scopecontent.p: Encloses assignment of Stepp certificate. Certificates assigned by Paull to Woods must have County seal. Flood has killed Jno. Hardesty family and ruined crops.

did.unittitle: Amos B. Jones, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 July 1818.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay Woods.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Breckinridge,Stau[nton, Virginia] to Arohebald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 July 18[18].

scopecontent.p: In notion of going to Kentucky but now thinks of Woods' area. Seeks information.
Includes, N, in a different hand of a genealogical chart of the Breckinridge family. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibal]d [Woods],Wheeling, Creeke, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to John Cox, Washington, Pen[n]sylvania, 13 August 1818.

scopecontent.p: Has received Cox' letter containing charges exhibited against Williams and J[osias] Thompsonas agents of the National Road. Assumes they are the charges stated by James Marshall. Will state what he knows about. Charges concern sinking of ground on hill above and adjoining Wheeling, distance of road at Shepherd's Mill, too many bridges on little Wheeling Creek, contracts to bidders who could not carry them out and for purchasing land and changing road to pass land he purchased.

did.unittitle: Archi[bald] Woods,Wheeling Creek, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to Josias Thompson, n.p., 20 August 1818.

scopecontent.p: Woods has made statement towards exculpating Thompson and Williams from charges concerning their handling of building of National Road. "I think Col. Williams conduct in relation to this business cannot well be impeached as he has acted uprightly and in most instances as the charges relate to you they are groundless also. Although such are the facts, yet good grounds for charges against your official conduct do exist." Criticizes Thompson for changing road, and allowing contractor to use logs and brush, for want of firmness and decision, and did not look at a place where he could have saved a spring. Thompson had mentioned in Wheeling that some mystery existed respecting the drafts drawn by Shepherd and Paull causing a suspicion that Woods was concerned in that transaction.

did.unittitle: Josias Thompson, Triadelphia, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 16 September 1818.

scopecontent.p: Rebuttal against Woods' letter. If Woods knew Steenrod was using logs and brush, he should have reported it. Thinks Woods is angry because Thompson removed him from managing a sector of the road. Thinks Woods is trying to have him removed as superintendent. "You may shew your teeth but cannot bite."

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Josias Thompson, Superintendent, Cumberland Road, 21 September 1818.

scopecontent.p: States Thompson did not remove him. He discontinued himself. Knows Thompson saw logs and brush placed in road bed. "This would not be a dispute between Charleston and Wheeling. It will be simply whether the government will permit their superintend[en]t to be a contractor also at the same time." Has three articles proving it and will disclose it.

did.unittitle: Advertisement of a runaway slave belonging to Archi[bal]d Woods,3 October 1818.

scopecontent.p: Description of him and his clothing.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,[Ohio County] Virginia [West Virginia], 8 October 1818.

scopecontent.p: Will come tomorrow bringing money for land. Authorizes Woods to make arrangement with Feay.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Wickham,John C. Whiden, Ben Gassaway, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 9 October 1818.

scopecontent.p: Woods must move his fence which is interfering with [National Road]. In absence of superintendent have consulted Steenrod. "Owing to the ill health of Steenrod's family we think by the tract [sic] you pursue you are treating him with that injustice that a neighbour ought to shudder at.

did.unittitle: John W. Lee, Sh[eri]ff, Monroe County, Indiana, to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 20 October 1818.

scopecontent.p: Woods' land will not be sold for taxes.

did.unittitle: Zach[aria]s Biggs,Round Bottom Mills, [?] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 October 1818.

scopecontent.p: Asks land values for purchase by others and himself.

did.unittitle: Daniel Steenrod, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 4 November 1818.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a disputed account for hauling.

did.unittitle: Joseph Spencer, Wood County, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 November 1818.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a debt owed by Spencer.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Jos[ep]h Spencer,Marietta, [Ohio], 16 November 1818.

scopecontent.p: Trying to negotiate a settlement with Spencer concerning money.

did.unittitle: Zach[aria]s Biggs,Round Bottom Mills, [Ohio], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 November 1818.

scopecontent.p: Concerns terms of land deals. Gives opinion of how difficult Jeremiah Hunt will be to deal with. Lists prices of wheat, rye, corn, whiskey and flour.

did.unittitle: Archi[bald] Woods,n.p., to John G. Jackson, Washington City, [D.C.], 23 November 1818.

scopecontent.p: Wants pay for himself and the 10th Brigade of Virginia militia.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Three New England families have arrived. John Coll was elected Colonel of militia. Wants Woods help in establishing a land office at Woodsfield. "The mail from Marietta arrived for the first time at Woodsfield on Wednesday past."

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Subject of where to locate National Road through Ohio is before committee. Anonymous writers are addressing Secretary of Treasury on the subject of road, imputing misconduct to [Elie] Williams, [Josias] Thompson and others.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s P. Rau[Morgantown, Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Woods for paying an installment for him.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Columbus, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia), 15 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Discusses Ohio legislature and describes inauguration of Governor [ ]. Debating right of privilege on memorial of Joseph Kerr who was arrested while serving in General Assembly. "Mr. Hoge and family are well. He has not been invited to give us prayers nor do I expect that he will."

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Robertson,C[lerk of] C[ouncil, Richmond, Virginia] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Ohio County [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Appoints Woods, William Chaplin[e]and Peter Yarnal, directors of the Northwestern Bank.
Includes, DS, of minutes of Governor of council making the appointments, 17 December 1818. 1 page.

did.unittitle: James Leffler, [Richmond, Virginia?] to Shannon Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Announces Archibald Woods', [William] Chaplin[e]and [Peter] Yarnal's appointment to Board of Northwestern Bank. Details opposition to their appointments.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Pindall,Washington City [D.C.] to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Has received Woods letter and with directions therein and papers from Jona[than] Jacksonand will shape declarations in ejectment. Denies he is friend of U. S. Bank.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paul[l],Columbus, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: John Stipp has left down payment on land. State Senate passes resolution for convention. John Rowan and Jacob Burnett are there wishing to get a canal connecting Lake Erie to Ohio. Gives the legislative news. "Mrs. Hoge has got a son and is well and the rest of the family."

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Treaty with Indians in Ohio is signed and land will be surveyed and offered for sale. Treaty with Indians for purchase of land in Indiana is undecided. Secretary of Treasury is making exertions to have road completed from Uniontown to Washington.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 December 1818.

scopecontent.p: Is sending copy of will of sister A. Poage and includes a copy of an affidavit for Woods to execute.

did.unittitle: Austin P. Bishop, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to [Archibald Woods], 4 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Sends estimate to erect a building for Woods.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Tells volume of mail he is handling as postmaster of Woodsfield. Sends Bishop's estimate.

did.unittitle: Isaac Leffler, Richmond, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Has checked into payment of [revenue?] for Ohio County. Last three years have been paid. Have not received any papers from directors of Northwestern Bank. Bill to raise legislators salary passed House of Delegates. Has bill before House to benefit [Zacharias] Biggs. Bill to make paper of valley Bank receivable in treasury is applied for. Intend to have paper of Northwestern Bank included. Program slowly on revision of laws.

did.unittitle: Thomas Smith, Captina [Creek, Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent property from Woods.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio to Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Deerskins are not finished. Mr. Henry Jackson wants to rent a house from Woods. "Squad of Yankeys have arrived at Woodsfield."

did.unittitle: Jer[emiah] Hunt,n.p., to [Archibald Woods], 18 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Lists terms he will sell his land on.

did.unittitle: Zach[aria]s Biggs,Round Bottom Mills, [Ohio] to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Encloses Jeremiah Hunts' terms. Send prices of wheat, rye, corn and flour. Sent flour to New Orleans.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Is working for establishment of a land office at Woodsfield.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Columbus, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 January 1819.

scopecontent.p: Discusses a bank bill and other legislation pending before the Ohio legislature.

did.unittitle: Austin P. Bishop, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 February 1819.

scopecontent.p: Sends itemized estimate for erecting a building.

did.unittitle: John Eaton, Morristown, Ohio, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 February 1819.

scopecontent.p: Excuse for not having sent Woods money.

did.unittitle: Elisha Talbot, n. p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 4 February 1819.

scopecontent.p: Wants to borrow 1000 to 1500 dollars from bank in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 February 1819.

scopecontent.p: Ezekiel Davis wishes to buy two lots in Woodsfield.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 February 1819.

scopecontent.p: Received final certificates.

did.unittitle: Affidavit of Archibald Woods, [March 1819].

scopecontent.p: Concerning land disputed between William Croghan and the heirs of Moses Chapline.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Hamilton,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,4 March 1819.

scopecontent.p: Asking Woods if he can occupy a situation for an office on Woods' lot.

did.unittitle: John Yoho, Captina [Creek, Belmont County, Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia] 23 April 1819.

scopecontent.p: Asking about militia pay in War of 1812.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 11 May 1819.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a lease from Woods to Henry Jackson which was signed over to John Coll. Coll has gone over mountains. Owes money. Many think he will not return. Two merchants, a wheelwright and one hatter have come to Woodsfield.

did.unittitle: J.C. Wright, Steubenville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 May 1819.

scopecontent.p: Reports on suit against [James?] Dunlop.

did.unittitle: J. Wilson, Jr., Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,20 May 1819.

scopecontent.p: Authorizes Woods to borrow 1500 dollars from Northwestern Bank of Virginia at Wheeling. He will use land as collateral.

did.unittitle: Alexandria Darnes, Waynesbrugh, [Pennsylvania] to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 May 1815.

scopecontent.p: Will drive Woods' carriage to the springs. Needs some notice.

did.unittitle: J. C. Wright, Steubenville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 June 1819.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Woods' case against Dunlop.

did.unittitle: Daniel Steinrod, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 1 July 1819.

scopecontent.p: Sets up a meeting.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 July 1819.

scopecontent.p: Is enclosing J. C. Wright's bond for Woods' shares of stock in the Steubenville Bank. Paull sold Wright his shares of stock on the same terms. Cannot procure anyone to drive carriage.

did.unittitle: Jane Greaves, n.p., to Mrs. [?] Woods, care of T. Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 2 July 1819.

scopecontent.p: Sends medicine to Mrs. Woods' daughter whom doctor has diagnosed as having consumption.

did.unittitle: J. Wilson, Jr., Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 7 July 1819.

scopecontent.p: Has received letter from directors. Is unable to pay money. Wants to know if one hundred barrels of Great Kanamha salt could be sold.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia , [West Virginia], 13 July 1819.

scopecontent.p: Thinks David Parson will pay money owed to Woods but money is scarce.

did.unittitle: William Croghan, Louisville, [Kentucky] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 July 1819.

scopecontent.p: Offers his land again for sale. If Woods doesn't wish to buy, ask Capt. George Taylor. Has purchased a sugar plantation in Louisiana.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to W[illia]m Croghan, Jr.,n.p., 10 August 1819.

scopecontent.p: Has talked to Capt. [George] Taylor about Croghan's land. Lists his reasons for not purchasing it.

did.unittitle: A. Sameuls, Middlebourne, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia, [West Virginia], 16 August 1819.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods what paper he'll accept to discharge notes.

did.unittitle: Jacob Yoho, Mills Creek, [?] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 August 1819.

scopecontent.p: Wants Woods to come out to settle money owed to him. Asks him to bring compas[s] and chain.

did.unittitle: Anson Brewster, Woodsfield, Ohio to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 September 1819.

scopecontent.p: Has built a frame store on his lot. Wants boards for window sashes. Money is scarce.

did.unittitle: Henry F. Sweppe, Point Captina, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 September 1819.

scopecontent.p: Wants rent reduced and gives reasons.

did.unittitle: William Croghan, Jr., Louisville, Kentucky, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 7 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Accepts Woods' offer for his land and will make a special warranty deed.

did.unittitle: Amos Miles, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 15 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Asks for money for wool carding.

did.unittitle: M. Woods, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Mother Ann Woods, Wheeling, Ohio C[oun]t[y], Virginia [West Virginia], 17 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Gives news of Wilson family. Asks permission to go to Augusta [County, Virginia].

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to D[aniel] Steenrod,n.p., 22 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Is letting Steenrod know what he plans to report to the Superintendent of the National Road concerning the section made by Steenrod.

did.unittitle: Amos B. Jones, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Offers house and lot to repay notes.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Suit of Nicholas Adm[inistrator]svs. Caldwell, Woods et al.was decided for the defendants.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Col [George] Paul[l's]slave has been bound to Mr. Lyon of Uniontown, Pennsylvania Reports on Nichol's administratorsvs. Caldwell, Woods, et al.Decree has been made in Woodsvs. D. Lewis.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 28 October 1819.

scopecontent.p: Trying to arrange a land deal.

did.unittitle: R[olf] Berkshire,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 1 November 1819.

scopecontent.p: Wants to move to Wheeling. Offers Woods his farm near Morgantown.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Rolf Berkshire, Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 November 1819.

scopecontent.p: Makes an offer for Berkshire's property.

did.unittitle: William Crogan, Jr., Louisville, [Kentucky], to Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 20 November 1819.

scopecontent.p: Accepts Woods offer for his land. His father is dangerously ill.

did.unittitle: Agnes P. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to aunt, Ann Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 November 1819.

scopecontent.p: Alpheus Hil[l]sonstarted for Richmond. She intends going to school to Mrs. Gilison. Wants Mary Woods to come back and go with her.

did.unittitle: A. Samuels, Middlebourne, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: Trying to collect debt owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: Has attended to Woods' request for a distributing post office at Wheeling and McLure will be retained as postmaster.

did.unittitle: H. Eckstern, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 15 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: Announces Board of Trustees meeting of "Seminary for the Education of Young Ladies."

Includes announcement, [1819], of appointment of A[rchibald] Woodsand others to serve on Board of Trustees of a "Seminary for the Education of Young Ladies" to be established by Mr. and Mrs. H. Eckstern. 1 page. M.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Irwin,Richmond, [Virginia], to Archabald [Archibald] Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: Is enclosing the dates of the grants. Will pay taxes shortly. Thomas M. Randolph is elected governor. Three directors have been appointed for the N[orth] W[estern] Bank.

did.unittitle: Advertisement by Archi[bal]d Woods,20 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: To contract for building a mill race.

did.unittitle: R. J. Meigs, General Post Office [Washington, D.C.], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 20 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: Does not think it expedient at this time to make Wheeling a distributing office.

did.unittitle: T[homas] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: To Thomas Thornburgh, n.p. Pay Franklin Woods ten dollars for a set of chairs.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Walker,East Tennessee, Roan County near the Post Office Oak Spring to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 December 1819.

scopecontent.p: Asks about land warrants.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: Is sending a power of attorney.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to Joseph Caldwell, n.p., [1819-1820].

scopecontent.p: Asks Caldwell to make public charges against Thomas Woods and himself.

did.unittitle: Answer of T[homas] Woodsto charges made by Joseph Caldwell against his conduct as cashier of the North Western Bank, [1819-1820].
Extract of resolutions of Board of Directors of North Western Bank concerning charges against Thomas Woods, cashier, [1819-1820].
Jos[eph] Woods,Nashville,[Tennessee], to Uncle Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: Discusses his business. Has reduced debt in Phila[delphia] from $85,000 to $20,000. Expects Gen. Jackson will be ordered to take the Floridas. Discusses land in Alabama. Gives news of Woods family.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: Has seen postmaster general regarding setting up a post office in Belmont County, Ohio.

did.unittitle: John Pickaway, [County, Ohio] to George Paul[l],St. Clair[s]ville, Ohio, 10 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: Is enclosing transfer of land you sold to John Sipp. Transfer needs witnesses. Sipp cannot pay money owed to Woods. Money is scarce.
Includes ALS of George Paull to [Archibald Woods]. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Notice to Archibald Woods, late sheriff of Ohio County, 19 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: That Moses M. Chapline shall apply for a judgment against Woods because his deputy, Archibald Hamilton failed to return a "Capias Ad Sales Faciendum."

did.unittitle: Promissory note (witnessed by James Harisson) of Robert Clark to Archi[bal]d Woods,21 January 1820.
W[illia]m Irwin,Richmond, [Virginia], to Archabald [Archibald] Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: Encloses a grant of land. Treasurer of Virginia [John Preston] has promised to refund money and resign. [German] Baker of Cumberland has been appointed. First teller of Richmond branch of U.S. Bank has left with money. Mentions other legislative business.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Uncle A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wilson is deciding where to practice law. Applied for office of Councilor from Virginia. "I was too well acquainted with the Tuckahoes to expect that any backwoodsman would be elected to that office..." Asks his uncle's advice.

did.unittitle: Patrick Adams, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Has eight thousand brick ready for Woods.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Philip Doddridge, Washington, [D.C.], 12 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Woods' son Thomas is commencing a suit against Joseph Caldwell for slander and wants to engage Doddridge.

did.unittitle: J. Wilson, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to McAdam Heckman, 11 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wants to see agreement between Woods et al and Stephen R. Wilson adm[inistrato]r & Joseph Spencer. Asks Woods to send copy.

did.unittitle: Henry F. Sweppe, Point Captina [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 15 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Trying to settle a note. [Will W. Man?] wants to have a job to clean land and a place to live.

did.unittitle: John Mills, n.p., to Archibald Woods, n.p., 16 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Does not wish to sell his land.

did.unittitle: John Eaton, Morristown, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheelling, [Wheeling], Virginia [West Virginia], 21 February 1820.

scopecontent.p: Unable to find anyone to rent Woods' place.

did.unittitle: Jacob Israel, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March 1820.

scopecontent.p: Offers to sell his land to Woods.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 March 1820.

scopecontent.p: His friends have announced him for the Senate. Gives family news.

did.unittitle: Eugenius M. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 March 1820.

scopecontent.p: Disturbed over the lawsuit between Thomas Woods and J. Caldwell. Gives legal advice concerning a dispute between Woods and the Chapline family over [William] Croghan's land. Knows Woods will consult with [Philip] Doodridge. Pindall wishes to decline in favoring [Thomas Wilson] at next Congressional election.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to William Croghan, Louisville, Kentucky, 16 March 1820.

scopecontent.p: Declines buying disputed land from Croghan because Chapline's have sold to a [?] McCaine.
Includes, ALS, of Woods which is a copy of above. 2 pages.

did.unittitle: Rich[ar]d McClure,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Archibald Woods], 17 March 1820.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to forward his memorial to the Postmaster General via [Benjamin Ruggles] to counter one being sent around for [?] yarnall.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 3 April 1820.

scopecontent.p: Has presented [memorial] of Richard McClure to Postmaster General. Bill has passed Congress giving further time to purchasers of public lands to make the last payment. Thinks bill passed by Senate changing the land system will pass House of Representatives. Does not think bill to extend road through Ohio will pass.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Reed,Point [Captina Creek, Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 12 April 1820.

scopecontent.p: Dispute over who is to rent Woods' land.

did.unittitle: John W. Campbell, H[ouse of] R[epresentatives, Washington, D.C.], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 April 1820.

scopecontent.p: Has conferred with Pindall. McClure will be kept as postmaster unless a distributing office is set up at Wheeling. Did not address Postmaster-General.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Wellsburgh [Wellsburg, Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 April 1820.

scopecontent.p: Willson does not think his chances of election to Congress are very good.

did.unittitle: Arthur Inghram, Tyler Cou[nty, Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 April 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wants to exchange land 3 1/4 miles above Middlebourne with Woods.

did.unittitle: Invitation to [Archibald and Ann (Poage)] Woods, 28 April 1820.

scopecontent.p: To dine with Josias Thompson and his wife, Tridelphia.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsand [?] Kirney, 2 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: For Kirney to lease a house and garden in Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia].

did.unittitle: Nathan Hanes, n.p., to Archibald Woods, living 2 miles from town, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wants to know if Woods will buy iron [orcastans?] from him.

did.unittitle: Statement by And[re]w Woods, Jr.,15 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: That his Uncle Arch[ibal]d Woodshas nothing to do with the breaking off of a marriage proposal between him and E. Cross.

did.unittitle: Daniel Steenrod, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 15 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Reports his version of a conversation between himself and James Spriggs concerning the marriage not taking place between [E.] Cross and A[ndrew] Woods, Jr.
Includes ANS, of Jos[eph] Wilson, n.p. to [Archibald] Woods, n.p. Statement of Jos[eph] Wilson as a witness to a conversation between Steenrod and Spriggs. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to John Armstrong, n.p., 15 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Denies allegations made by Armstrong about Woods' role in preventing marriage between And[re]w Woodsand E. Cross.

did.unittitle: John Armstrong, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archib[al]d Woods,n.p., 15 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Surprised that Mr. Sprigg should bring him in as author of a report concerning Woods' connection with the breakup of a proposed marriage between Andrew Woods, Jr. and E. Cross.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to James Monroe, n.p., 22 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Woods would like to serve as one of the commissioners to locate the National Road from Wheeling to the Mississippi.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to N[oah] Zane,n.p., 24 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wants to obtain a statement from [?] Washington about Woods' appointment as a [commissioner of the National Road.]

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Has written to President to try to get Woods' appointed a commissioner for the National Road.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 May 1820.

scopecontent.p: Report on the progress of a house Coll is building for Woods.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 June 1826.

scopecontent.p: Defends himself against accusations by Woods that Coll has wasted boards.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Croghan, Jr.,Louisville, [Kentucky], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 16 June 1820.

scopecontent.p: Unable to send deed.

did.unittitle: J. E. Eckstern, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 June 1820.

scopecontent.p: Sends account for education of Miss E. Woods and Miss Wilson.

did.unittitle: J. C. Wright, Steubenville, [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 June 1820.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay note due to Woods. Offers alternatives.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Croghan, Jr.,Louisville, [Kentucky] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 July 1820.

scopecontent.p: Sends deed by [?] Drury whom he introduces to Woods. Asks that the $800 for the land be given to Drury.

did.unittitle: Gales & Seaton, Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 July 1820.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to pay his bill for the National Intelligencer.

did.unittitle: Nathan Holister, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archab [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 August 1820.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay money he owes Woods. has let [?] Bishop go into a house owned by Woods.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 9 August 1820.

scopecontent.p: J[ames] Pindallhas resigned his seat in Congress. Wilson discusses those vying to succeed him.

did.unittitle: Micheal Cresap, n.p., to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 August 1820.

scopecontent.p: Tries to arrange for two slaves to be sold together.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 August 1820.

scopecontent.p: Analyzes political race to succeed James Pindall in Congress.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to W[illia]m Croghan, Jr.,n.p., 27 August 1820.

scopecontent.p: Outlines legal issues over title to Croghan's land. Woods is unable to pay cash. Offers slave and flour. People in Ohio are protecting runaway slaves. The slave he offers in exchange for land he fears will run away to Ohio.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 August 1820.

scopecontent.p: [?] Zane needs to exert himself more to be elected to Congress.

did.unittitle: J. C. Wright, Steubenville, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Unable to raise money.

did.unittitle: H. H. [Mott?], Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wants to borrow money from Woods if Woods will "higher" [hire] out the money he has a judgment for.

did.unittitle: Arche[bal]d [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to G[?] P. Beacher, 17 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Asks Beacher, a lawyer, to collect money for him.

did.unittitle: S. Minor, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arc[hibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Tells of families and rentals in Woodsfield.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Jackson got a majority of votes in [Monongalia] County to succeed James Pinball in Congress.

did.unittitle: John Barr, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 27 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Discusses money owed to Woods by Anthony Weaver.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan, Jr.Louisville, [Kentucky], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 30 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Will accept slave for land, but not flour.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 October 1820.

scopecontent.p: Discusses election to succeed [James Pindall] in Congress.

did.unittitle: Power of Attorney (unexecuted) from Moses Shepherd to Archibald Woods, November 1820.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to act as proxy in election of directors for Northwestern Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: Archi[bald] Woods,n.p., to William McKinley, West Liberty, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 November 1820.

scopecontent.p: Concerns appointment of directors to Northwest Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to W[illia]m McKinley,n.p., 14 November 1820.

scopecontent.p: Concerns the nomination of directors to Northwest bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: S. S. Salisbury, Wood[sfield, Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 November 1820.

scopecontent.p: Want to continue using Woods' house as a school.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to [Archibald Woods], 26 November 1820.

scopecontent.p: Wants Woods to offer his [George Paull] land to [Daniel] Steenrod.

did.unittitle: John Mills, n.p., to Archib[al]d [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 2 December 1820.

scopecontent.p: Discusses running a property line.

did.unittitle: John Mills, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 11 December 1820.

scopecontent.p: Discusses survey of land.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 December 1820.

scopecontent.p: [Thomas Wilson] thinks Woods probably should sue [John?] Wilson. No opinion of Spencer case yet. Wants to marry Woods' daughter, Mary, who is his first concern. Discusses Congressional prospects.

did.unittitle: Franklin Woods, [Smythfield], to Thomas Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 December [1820?]

scopecontent.p: Explains his delay because of stage accident.

did.unittitle: Anny Foster, n.p. to Archable [Archibald] Whoods, [Woods], Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 December 1820.

scopecontent.p: Asks questions about her husband's land.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond,[Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 December 1820.

scopecontent.p: W[illia]m Chapline, Jr.,[?] Yarnal and Woods are appointed directors of Northwest Bank of Virginia. Does not think Zane will be elected to Congress.

did.unittitle: Mary McCommant, Washington, [Pennsylvania], to Franklin Woods, Wheelon, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 29 December 1820.

scopecontent.p: Has received a counterfeit bill from Woods.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 January 1821.

scopecontent.p: Lists directors of Northwest Bank of Virginia Three new counties passed House of Delegates. Does not think legislature will act on re-apportionment.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 3 January 1821.

scopecontent.p: Sends patent from Land Office. Thinks law will pass granting relief to purchasers of public land. Three members of Congress have died.

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] & R[obert] Woods,Nashville, [Tennessee], to Thomas Woods, Cash[ie]r W. B. V. Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 January 1820.

scopecontent.p: Attempts to collect money owed to [Northwest bank of Virginia?]
Includes, ALS, Jos[eph] Woods, Nashville, [Tennessee], to uncle Arch[ibald] Woods,n.p. Has moved to farm and bill outside of Nashville. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 January 1821.

scopecontent.p: Recollections on appointments of Directors of Northwest Bank. Election of two persons to Council.

did.unittitle: Nathan Davis, n.p., to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 January 1821.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy land from Woods to settle a dispute.

did.unittitle: Franklin Woods, Georgetown, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 January 1821.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a report of debits and credits between [Moses] Shepherd and U.S. in regard to building the National Road.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 February 1821.

scopecontent.p: First story of Woods' home is finished. Wants to put a shop on Woods' lot.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Pindall,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 February 1821.

scopecontent.p: Hopes to have cases tried for lands on Middle Island. Needs surveys made.

did.unittitle: N. Evans and R. Berkshire, Morgan Town, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A. Caldwell, A[rchibald] Woods,Dan[ie]l Spriggs,J. Shannon, E. B. Swearinger and Isaac Leffler, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 February 1821.

scopecontent.p: [Thomas] Wilson will run for Congress against the Harrison County Candidate, [E. B.] Jackson.

did.unittitle: Eug[enius] M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia], [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 February 1821.

scopecontent.p: Pleased Woods has given him permission to gain Woods' daughter, Mary's affections. Does not want to elect E. B. Jackson unopposed. Analyzes his father's [Thomas Wilson] chances.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Pindall,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Wood[s],near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 February 1821.

scopecontent.p: Letter of recommendation for Sommerville & Moore who wish to borrow money from North West Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: J. Holister, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibal[d] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 February [1821].

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to be a character witness at his father's trial.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 March 1821.

scopecontent.p: Needs to have special bail entered. Asks it a freeholder in Virginia can be sued although a resident out of the state. Asks that bonds be sent over by Thomas Woods.

did.unittitle: Franklin Woods, n.p., to Thomas Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 March 1821.

scopecontent.p: politeness of Mr. [Henry] Clay. Sec[retary of Treasury] will decide how [Moses] Shepherd' accounts with U.S. (concerning the National Road) should be settled. "Mr. Clay has given some assistance."

did.unittitle: Mark Douglass, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 21 March 1821.

scopecontent.p: Request for cornmeal.

did.unittitle: A. S. Birckhead, Middlebourne, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archeble [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 March 1821.

scopecontent.p: Has been informed that Woods is going to Indiana. Asks him to look into a land dispute for him.

did.unittitle: Meix William P., n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 March 1821.

scopecontent.p: Sends an account to Woods and asks for money.

did.unittitle: Agreement (witnessed by E. Hamilton) between Benj[ami]n Coleof Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] and Archi[bal]d Woodsof Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 April 1821.

scopecontent.p: For Woods to lease to Cole a tavern, farm, and terries at mouth of Capteena [Captina Creek].

did.unittitle: A.S. Birckhead, Middlebourne, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 April 1821.

scopecontent.p: Needs Woods to tend to collecting money for him.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woodsto James Smith, Capteena [Captina Creek, Ohio], 9 April 1821.

scopecontent.p: Woods gives his philosophy of buying land and gives terms for an exchange of land with Smith.

did.unittitle: John Stipp, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 April 1821.

scopecontent.p: Gives excuses for not paying money owed to Woods and his prospects for paying it.

did.unittitle: Nathan Hanes, n.p., to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 April 1821.

scopecontent.p: Hanes makes offer to work off debt owed to Woods by making brick.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 April 1821.

scopecontent.p: Smith makes his offer to exchange land.

did.unittitle: Notes made by [Archibald Woods] of land he is inspecting [in Indiana?], 24 April 1821.
Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to William W. Irvin, Lancaster, Ohio, 5 June 1821.

scopecontent.p: Presents an offer to settle money owed to Woods by Jno. Stipp.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 14 June 1821.

scopecontent.p: [Thomas Wilson] has lost election to Congress. Wilson's [Eugenius M. Wilson] law practice has doubled due to the death of [?] McGee, Woods' daughter, Mary, has agreed to marry Wilson.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Nathan Davis, Middleburn [Middlebourne], Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 July 1821.

scopecontent.p: Needs Davis to close contract on land.

did.unittitle: R. Berkshire, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[iba]ld Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 July 1821.

scopecontent.p: Offers to sell his house, lot and farm to Woods.

did.unittitle: John Bowland, Bloomington, [Indiana], to [Archibald Woods], 24 July 1821.

scopecontent.p: [?] Buchanan is waiting Woods' reply about selling land.

did.unittitle: Nathan Davis, n.p., to Richard Simms, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 July 1821.

scopecontent.p: Has examined land records concerning heirs of Moses Chapline.

did.unittitle: John & Ch[arle]s White,n.p., to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia, August 1821.

scopecontent.p: Charles White has written to Raccoon Mills to pay taxes on Woods' land. Asks Woods to pay amount due to John White.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to John Good, n.p., 15 August 1821.

scopecontent.p: If Good will hire his bellows out to [Joseph] Hanlin [Handlon], Woods will see they are taken care of.
Includes, DS of Joseph Handlon (witnessed by Andrew Donaldson) acknowledging receipt of the bellows. 1 page.

did.unittitle: John Stipp, Jefferson [County, West Virginia], to Archibald Wood[s],Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 August 1821.

scopecontent.p: Needs a reply from Woods.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 August 1821.

scopecontent.p: Col. Berkshire will write Woods. Wilson describes the house Berkshire has for sale in Morgantown and other houses available in the town.

did.unittitle: James Huftman, Mead Township, Belmont [Coun]ty, Ohio, to Archall [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 1 September 1821.

scopecontent.p: Has collected money owed to Woods by Asher Jones.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l [Peck?],n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 3 September 1821.

scopecontent.p: Gives Woods legal advice on a landlord collecting from a tenant.

did.unittitle: Joseph Spencer, Woods County, [West Virginia?], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 September 1821.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods for patents to land. Woods has had money for the land for 25 years.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 September 1821.

scopecontent.p: Does not think house will suit the land or her business. Commission wants to tear it down. Mrs. Jackson has quit housekeeping.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses Shepherd, n.p., 24 September 1821.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a dispute between Woods and Shepherd over Woods asking for security for a loan. Woods rehearses various incidents involving the building of the National Road.
Includes draft of ALS, of Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses Shepherd, n.p., 24 September 1821, concerning a dispute between Woods and Shepherd. 3 pages.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 November 1821.

scopecontent.p: Suggestions about a possible suit against [?] Booth. Wilson wedding with Woods' daughter, Mary, is set for December 6. N. Evans can not yet tell if he will sell house. [?] Stealey may be interested in exchanging property with Woods. Stealey's landed property is bound so he cannot sell or exchange it.

Includes, ALS, or Eug[enui]s M. Wilson, [Morgantown, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia]. Knows she will miss her daughter, but hope she will not delay the wedding. 1 page.

did.unittitle: John McCoy, "Mounthill", Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 November 1821.

scopecontent.p: Agrees with Woods that honest, independent men should be appointed to Board of Directors of North West bank of Wheeling.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Benj[ami]n Wilson,n.p., 28 November 1821.

scopecontent.p: Deliver pork to Jasper Mallory.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l [Peck?],n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 November 1821.

scopecontent.p: Has paid taxes for Woods.

did.unittitle: Henry C. Lewis, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 1 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Wants to settle in Indiana and found a newspaper. Needs information from Woods on likely places to settle.

did.unittitle: J. Holister, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibal[d] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy a house and lot from Woods.

did.unittitle: Josias Thompson, Tridelphia, to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 8 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods' help in settling accounts with [Moses] Shepherd [concerning the building of the National Road].

did.unittitle: Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 25 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Thinks they need to obtain advice of [Philip] Doddridge.

did.unittitle: James Shannon, Richmond, Virginia, to Ar[c]h[ibal]d Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Archibald Woods, William Chapline and Peter Yarnall have been continued as directors in Northwest Bank of Virginia Board of Public Works are determined to coerce payment of state dividend due from North West Bank.

did.unittitle: Mary (Woods) Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Ann [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Discusses trip and social events in Morgantown.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Ar[chibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 December 1821.

scopecontent.p: Congress has asked for commissioners to file report in [Moses] Shepherd "buisiness" [sic] [Shepherd's accounts with the U.S. in the building of the National Road.]

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,"Westwood" [near Nashville, Tennessee], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Is enjoying life in the country. Gives disadvantages of Wheeling over Pittsburgh for trade. Involved in building the steamboat, "Nashville of Tennessee." Still owes debts in Kentucky of $2l,4000. Gives news of Woods family in Missouri, Kentucky and Virginia.

did.unittitle: Thomas Wheeler, Was[h]ington County, Pennsylvania, to Archabild [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent for only one year.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Captina [Creek, Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Outlines a dispute with Isaac Jones.

did.unittitle: John Hinthorn, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 19 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Has received Woods' letter and expects to agree to the propositions.

did.unittitle: Cleaburn Simms, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 20 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Discusses terms of a land deal.

did.unittitle: Forsyth[e] Curtis,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, n.p., 23 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to give bearer, J. P. Seaman, two barrels of flour. Will be credited to Woods' subscription to the Presb[yteria]n meetinghouse.

did.unittitle: Isaac Jones, Captee[na] [Captina Creek, Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 26 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Gives terms on which he will rent land from Woods.

did.unittitle: J.[?] Williams, Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 28 Janery [January] 1822.

scopecontent.p: Statement requested by John Nichols of what Samuels & Burckhaud had said respecting yours & his business.

did.unittitle: Cha[rle]s P. Wells,Tyler County, [Virginia], to [Archibald Woods, n.p.], 29 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Wells gives his statement concerning business between John Nichols and Woods.

did.unittitle: D.B. Spencer, Parkers[bur]g, Virginia [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wellsburgh, [Wheeling?] Virginia [West Virginia], 29 January 1822.

scopecontent.p: Does not think Jno Wilson will bring suit. Needs copies of agreement regarding the compromise of a lawsuit.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Wood[s],n.p., to D. B. Spencer, n.p. 2 February 1822.

scopecontent.p: Declines complying with Spencer's request.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 February 1822.

scopecontent.p: Rehearses his dispute with [Isaac] Jones.

did.unittitle: Mikel Enlows, Belmont County, Ohio, to Archy [Archibald] Woods, 15 February [1822?].

scopecontent.p: Would like to live on Woods' land another year.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 February 1822.

scopecontent.p: Housing alternatives in Morgantown.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Has moved into house formerly occupied by Wido[w] Jackson. Has gone in partnership with [?] Gray in the tavern.

did.unittitle: Benj[ami]n Cole,n.p., to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to get [paints?]

did.unittitle: Thomas Smith, Captina [Creek, Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheling, [Wheeling] Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Corn is put up. Other farm business is tended to. Asks if Franklin Woods is going down the river.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Wood,Marietta, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: How and when money for public land is due.

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Gadd,A. N. C., Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Notifies Woods his house must be moved.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Surprised Woods will not advance liquor for the tavern Coll and Gray want to establish in a building by Woods.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Pindall,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Bill for two land suits he is handling for Woods have not been paid.

did.unittitle: John Wilson, Jr., Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 March 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asks if a suit should be brought.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 April 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asking for liquor for his tavern.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 April 1822.

scopecontent.p: His conveyance of land to Woods omits lifting an obligation to [?] Cole. Cannot meet a proposal of Woods concerning flour and whiskey.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 April 1822.

scopecontent.p: Misunderstood agreement with Woods.

did.unittitle: A. Samuels, Middlebourne, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archi[bald] Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 30 April 1822.

scopecontent.p: Recollection of a settlement of lawsuits against [?] Nichols.

did.unittitle: Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 10 May 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to survey some land.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Joseph Woods, [May 1822].

scopecontent.p: Register of the land Office, Marietta, [Ohio]. Asks Woods to send patent for land. Asks about a forthcoming sale.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] [Vermums?]to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 6 May 1822.

scopecontent.p: Request to let W[illia]m Clarkhave two barrels of flour out of Woods' subscription to the meeting house.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 4 June 1822.

scopecontent.p: Encloses receipt for [James] Pindall's fees. Wilson's suit against Booth will be lengthy. Still finishing his house. [Philip] Doddridge is candidate for Congress. Extreme politeness shown Wilson family by Edward Brake [?] Jackson.

did.unittitle: Jesse Hunt, Cincinnati, [Ohio], to Archibald Wood[s], Near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 June 1822.

scopecontent.p: As executor of [Jeremiah?] Hunt, he cannot exchange his brother's land, but can sell it.

did.unittitle: D. O. Conner, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[r]ch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [15 June] 1822.

scopecontent.p: Does not wish to buy Woods' house.

did.unittitle: William Mason, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 15 June 1822.

scopecontent.p: Wants use of a lot.

did.unittitle: John Bowland, Bloomington, Indiana, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 25 June 1822.

scopecontent.p: Thinks [?] Meadows will buy land, if not, [?J Buchanan will. Gives report on crops and prices. Describes hailstorm with stones measuring fourteen inches in circumference.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 13 July 1822.

scopecontent.p: Will set out for Indiana. James Paull has a bond on agents of the Penetentiary at Frankfort.

did.unittitle: Jesse Hunt, Cincinnati, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 July 1822.

scopecontent.p: Offers to divide and sell brother's estate's land.

did.unittitle: Nathan Hanes, n.p., to Arche [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 21 July 1822.

scopecontent.p: Estimates cost of thirteen hundred dollars to build a house for Woods.

did.unittitle: Mary [(Woods)] Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Mrs. Ann [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 July 1822.

scopecontent.p: Eug[eniu]s has had fever. House is not finished yet.

did.unittitle: F[ranklin] Woods,Natchez, [Mississippi], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 July 1822.

scopecontent.p: On his way to [New] Orleans. Gives prices.

did.unittitle: John Davenport, n.p., to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 9 August 1822.

scopecontent.p: Has given information to [?] Chesbrough. Recommends Chesbrough as a tenant.

did.unittitle: John Bowland, Bloomington, Indiana, to Arch[ib]a[l]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 August 1822.

scopecontent.p: Sold Woods' land to James Buckhanon. Gives news of his family.

did.unittitle: Invitation from Lau[?] A. & Mary D. Washington, Hills, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Archibald & Ann (Poage)] Woods for dinner, 16 August 1822.
John Bowland, Washington County, [Pennsylvania], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 August 1822.

scopecontent.p: Wants to know if Woods would exchange land in Ohio, for land in Indiana for Bowland's brother, Matthew.

did.unittitle: John Eaton, Morristown [?], to Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., 23 August 1822.

scopecontent.p: Concerns property lines and rye.

did.unittitle: [?] Dugan, Zanesville [Ohio], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 August 1822.

scopecontent.p: Appreciates Woods' offer regarding his house in Wheeling, but his wife is unwilling to reenter tavernkeeping.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of Franklin Woods 29 August 1822.

scopecontent.p: Saying that he shipped himself on board the brig "Harriot" for Baltimore with paid passage & thirteen hundred & thirty dollars.

did.unittitle: James Smith, Racoon Mills Park[e]r County, Indiana, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Illness of everyone, Wants more land.

did.unittitle: J. M. Chesbrough, Baltimore, [Maryland], to Archibal[d] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Cannot keep tavern because wife is ill. Recommends John Isett.

did.unittitle: Lau[?] A. & Mary D. Washington, "Hills", [Ohio County, Virginia?] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 9 September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Would like to visit the next day.

did.unittitle: George Poage, Ripley, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Vir[gini]a, [West Virginia], 16 September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Brother Rob[er]t Poagegot ankle dislocated. Has not heard anything respecting Mr. Jening's recent [receipt?]

did.unittitle: Benj[amin] W. Wilson,n.p., to Archable [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 16 September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Concerns a legal dispute. Will come in about October 5 or 6. concerns other collections.

did.unittitle: W. Bounds, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 21 September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Will write a lawyer he knows in Kentucky to get information for Woods.

did.unittitle: W. B. Hamilton, Philadelphia [Pennsylvania], to Archibald Wood[s],Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 September 1822.

scopecontent.p: Describes death of Franklin Woods on board brig "Harriott". Woods' money, watch, and trunk are in possession of Capt. Diamond in Baltimore.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 September 1822?

scopecontent.p: Concerns taking of depositions of Philip Doddridge, [Thomas] Wilson and [?] Hammond. "I am of your opinion that the cause ought to be tried while Judge Tucker is on the Bench. I like his bold strait-forward way of getting at justice." [Thomas Wilson's] health is not good. His [E. W.] wife and child went out in carriage.

did.unittitle: E. C. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 October 1822.

scopecontent.p: Encloses a short address and petition relative to removal of the Seat of Government.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Pannell,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Creek [Ohio County, Virginia], 4 October 1822.

scopecontent.p: Supervision of cleaning out of street. Expresses sympathy in loss of Woods' son.

did.unittitle: Receipt for James Buckhannon's note which John Bowland is to collect. Signed by Bowland, 29 October 1822.
J. [?] Edmondson, Louisville, [Kentucky], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods for a description of his house in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Judgment has been obtained in case of Paul's ass[ign]ee vs. Boothe. Mary is in as good health as could be expected from her "delicate situation." Does not think he will move to Wheeling.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Gives legal advice from [?] Hammond concerning the building of a house.

did.unittitle: John Coll, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Has discussed deal with [?]. Minor Coll will take the bargain under certain arrangements.

did.unittitle: David Person, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, n.p., 21 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to deliver to Woods, Paull & Co. the bonds of Joseph Vanmeter as security.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., to Eugenius Wilson, Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Recounts death of Franklin Woods. Gives statement of Barr Wilson in lawsuit of Wilson against Daniel Booth.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses Shepherd, n.p., 22 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Goes over his side of an argument with Shepherd apparently concerning Shepherd's business with the North West Bank.

did.unittitle: William Madden, Washington County, Pennsylvania, to Archabal [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Will take Woods' property if Woods will put house in order.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p,, to Will[ia]m Croghan, Jr.,n.p., 26 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Has tended to paying Croghan's land taxes. Gives his terms for exchange of land.

did.unittitle: David Person, Clemington, [?], to A[rchibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 November 1822.

scopecontent.p: Recommends [?] Gray.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia], to Tho[ma]s Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 December 1822.

scopecontent.p: James Pleasants elected governor. W[illia]m Brownof Williamsburg was elected chancellor of Fredericksburgh [sic] of Williamsburg [sic] Districts. Mentions possibility of removal of seat of justice in [Ohio County, Virginia].

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 December 1822.

scopecontent.p: Bill appointing commissioners to locate seat of justice in Ohio County was rejected [by committee]. Bill passed House of Delegates ratifying the convention entered into by H[enry] Clay and B[enjamin] W[atkins] Leigh. Discusses re-apportionment.

did.unittitle: James Shannon, Richmond, [Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 December 1822.

scopecontent.p: Outlines debate over moving seat of justice in Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] "Doddridge conducts himself well and is decidedly the ablest man in the House."

did.unittitle: James Smith, Terre Haute, [Indiana], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 January 1823.

scopecontent.p: Has received letters "giving the sad tidings of your sons deths [deaths] both of them esteemed by us all...." Lists his selections of public lands. Excuses why he has not been to White River. Has built four cabins. Gives crop prices.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to E. B. Swearinger, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 9 January 1823.

scopecontent.p: Declines making a contract for a house belonging to Swearinger and gives reasons.

did.unittitle: Eliza (Woods) Paull, n.p. to [Anne (Poage) Woods] near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 January 1823.

scopecontent.p: " I am very much so [feeble] as much as possible to be out of be & troubled with doleful low spirits. The Lord knows I have not had much in a mar[r]ied life but what has been pain to body and mind;" Grieves for brother. Writes about her son, Alfred.

did.unittitle: M[ary (Woods)] Wilson,n.p., to Ann (Poage) Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 January 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks that Silv[i]a [a slave] be sent to her.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Gives his terms for exchange of land.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Encloses form of deed and an opinion. Has referred matter of slave, Sylvia, to Mary, but is fearful that if Woods can not manage her, he will be unable to. Pleased to send Washington [Wilson?] to Philadelphia for glasses. Discusses benefits sight will provide.

did.unittitle: Jacob Atkinson, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Excuse for not getting brick for Woods.

did.unittitle: John Barr, n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 10 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Is writing for John Stipp to ask Woods to stay execution for money owed Woods.

did.unittitle: John Stipp, n.p., to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 12 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to indulge him on debt for a while.

did.unittitle: John Stipp, n.p., to George Paull, n.p., 12 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks for receipt and that Paull would try to get Woods to indulge him on debt for a while.

did.unittitle: Joseph Handlan, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 1 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Request for corn and straw.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., to Yarnall & Chapline, n.p., 17 February 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asking them to hurry to complete a house they are building for him to minimize fire hazard.

did.unittitle: Joseph Handlan, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 7 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Request for flour and bran.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Ann [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: His wife, Mary, is in excellent health.
Includes, ALS, of Mary [(Woods)] Wilson, [Morgantown, Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Ann (Poage) Woods] Gives news of family. 1 page. ALS.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Sends form of a deed. Has asked Alpheus [Wilson] to decide to go to Wheeling or stay in [Morgantown]. If he stays, Eugenius Wilson will go to Wheeling.

did.unittitle: D. P. Cook, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to George Paul, St. Clairsville, Ohio, 12 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Thinks he can collect money from McLean & Guard.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia] to George Panell, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Urges him to finish house.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchiba]d Woods,Wheelling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to have his lot for a house surveyed.

did.unittitle: Cornelius Okey, Woodsfield [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Explains delay in settling debt of James Okey to Woods.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Anne [sic] [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Announces birth of a daughter.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 March 1823.

scopecontent.p: Lists quarters of public lands. Asks that deeds for certain lands be sent.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Philip Dod[d]ridge,n.p., 5 April 1823.

scopecontent.p: Lists two questions about the Cumberland Road and asks Doddridge to respond so people can decide whether or not to vote for him for Congress.
Includes MS, of Doddridge responding to Woods' questions. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Claudius L. Fisk, Amesville Ohio, to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 April 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks information about land on Fishing Creek.

did.unittitle: Richard Hardesty, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 April 1823.

scopecontent.p: Needs to go to Washington, [D.C.] to save himself for an endorsement in the North West Bank.

did.unittitle: Mary Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to [Ann (Poage) Woods], 24 [April] 1823.

scopecontent.p: Describes how she feel after her daughter is one month old. Has no one with her except a black woman named [Dark?] Would rather Silva [Silvia] not come.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to C. D. Knox, 13 May 1823.

scopecontent.p: Discussing possibility of lawsuit between N[oah] Zaneand Woods.

did.unittitle: A[rchiba]ld Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to John G. Jackson, Clarksburgh [sic], [Virginia] [West Virginia], 22 May 1823.

scopecontent.p: Unable to comply with summons.

did.unittitle: Philip Former [Farmer?], n.p., to Elisha Woods, n.p., 22 May 1823.

scopecontent.p: Request for flour.

did.unittitle: J. Dunlap, Washington County, Pennsylvania, to [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 June 1823.

scopecontent.p: Is trying to sell his farm.

did.unittitle: Lau[?] A. Washington, "Hills" [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 28 June 1823.

scopecontent.p: Flour from Woods' mill is too dark. Asks to buy some more.

did.unittitle: Senia S. Salisbury, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 June 1823.

scopecontent.p: Offers deal to Woods to lease land with option to buy.

did.unittitle: Mary Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Ann [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 July 1833 [1823].

scopecontent.p: Describes the activities of the household. Plans trip. Mentions slave, Dark.

did.unittitle: E.C. Wilson, Bloomington, Indiana, to George Paull, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], July 1823.

scopecontent.p: Description of Indiana and Indianapolis, in particular.

did.unittitle: Joseph Briggs, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 July 1823.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy a lot.

did.unittitle: Agnes Wilson, Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia], to Ann Woods, Wheeling, Ohio C[oun]t[y Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 July [1823?].

scopecontent.p: Family news.

did.unittitle: Edgar C. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio Count[y, Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 July [1822?].

scopecontent.p: Wants to move West, but needs Woods' advice on where to settle. Eugenius ill with billious [sic] fever. Lists candidates for Congress, including Philip Dod[d]ridge.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 July 1823.

scopecontent.p: Reports on Edgar [C. Wilson's] trip to Indiana. Alpheus has not yet decided about moving. A lawsuit in Clarksburg has been continued. Gives Chancellor's reasons and states that North West Bank needs to answer.

did.unittitle: A. M. Satten, n.p., to Archibald Woods, n.p., 24 July 1823.

scopecontent.p: Request for money. Brother is dying.

did.unittitle: John Bowland, Bloomington, Indiana, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 5 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: A man has applied for a lease of Woods' land to make saltpetre.

did.unittitle: Ar[chibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to James Pleasants, Governor of Virginia, [Richmond], 5 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks for a legal opinion concerning one of the North West Bank of Virginia directors [Moses H. Shepherd] owing money to the Bank.

did.unittitle: Joseph Spencer, Wood County, [Ohio] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 7 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods about land in Tyler County.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Indianapolis, [Indiana] to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Describes Indiana and his circumstances living in Indianapolis.

did.unittitle: [?] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Vi[rgini]a, [West Virginia], 12 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Cannot get his money from [Moses] Shephard [Shepherd] for building a bridge on the National Road.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to James Burns, n.p., 15 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Sends five dollars although he doesn't think he owes Burns.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Indianapolis, [Indiana] to Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, Monongalia County, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Describes court system in Indiana. Complains about its Constitution and laws. Death of Mrs. Eli Stealey. Col. Paxton who owes money to Thomas Wilson lives there. Mentions Jacob Whitsel [Wetzel?]

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Does not want to go back to Captina. Has hogs ready to drive.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Pindall,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Eugenius M. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Concerns an injunction gotten by [?] Booth.

did.unittitle: Eugenius M. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Mrs. Mary [(Woods)] Wilson, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 30 August 1823.

scopecontent.p: Needs answers of Benjamin W. Wilson, Geo[rge] Paulland [Archibald Woods] to an injunction obtained by Booth. Bears notes by Archibald Woods.

did.unittitle: Rob[er]t Woods,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 1 September 1823.

scopecontent.p: Leaves a contract for land up to Woods.

did.unittitle: P[hilip] Doddridge,n.p., to Th[omas] Woods,Cashier, [North Western Bank of Virginia, Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia].

scopecontent.p: Requests $13 on Archibald Woods' account.

did.unittitle: Gales & Seaton, Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 25 September [l8]23.

scopecontent.p: Bill for the National Intelligencer.

did.unittitle: Ebenezer McKinley, n.p., to Archibald Woods, 27 September 1823.

scopecontent.p: Wants Woods to stop a survey being entered by Neil Gunn.

did.unittitle: Henry Carothers [Caruthers], Pleasant Mill, Harrison County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to [Archibald] Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 September 1823.

scopecontent.p: Interested in land owned by Woods on Middle Island.

did.unittitle: Thomas Smith, Parke County, Indiana, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 October 1823.

scopecontent.p: Serving as deputy clerk.
