"A good many Indians allways [sic] about Fort Harrison...they are quite peacable [sic] however I was under the necessity of giving a Potawatomy a flogging a few days ago for his impudence." Has a full set of surveying instruments. Has written Thomas Woods about his land. Is guardian of 12 year old boy.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 October [1823?].

scopecontent.p: Concerns taking of depositions in lawsuit involving [?] Wilson.

did.unittitle: James Pleasants, Jr., Richmond, [Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 October 1823.

scopecontent.p: Does not think anything should be done regarding threat against North West Bank of Virginia until director carries out threat.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheelling, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia] to James Pleasants, Governor of Virginia, Richmond, [Virginia], 21 October 1823.

scopecontent.p: Director who owes money to bank has hired able lawyers including [Philip] Dod[d]ridge.Should bank settle debt by accepting stock at par?

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to John G. Jackson, 24 October l82[3].

scopecontent.p: Unable to travel to Clarksburg as witness in U. States vs. Salathial Curtis. Asks to be excused.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 October 1823.

scopecontent.p: Injunction of Booth vs. Paull was dissolved as to all except $350. Case of Caruthers against [North West Bank of Virginia] was decided in favor of bank. Case of Poage against [Thomas Wilson] decided for Wilson. People in Clarksburg want to effect a reorganization of judicial districts.

did.unittitle: John Miller, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], ? November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy clay from Woods' swamp.

did.unittitle: J. Mallory, St. [Clairs]ville, [Ohio], to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Dispute over security for rent.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Indianapolis, [Indiana], to Archibald Wood[s], Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Describes situation of lawyers in Indianapolis.

did.unittitle: Amos B. Jones, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Has a man, W[illia]m Drenninger,who wishes to lease Woods' property.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Alpheus P. Wilson, Richmond, Virginia, 12 November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Asks him to send patents and to speak to governor about money owed to North West Bank of Virginia by [Moses H.] Shepherd. Asks him to see if land in Tyler County was sold for taxes.

did.unittitle: W. Underwood, Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Lists taxes owed on land in Tyler County.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Jacob Ash, McIlroy's fork, Middle Island, Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 November 1823.

scopecontent.p: Unable to see him. Ash can rely on Woods' doing what he said he would.

did.unittitle: Henry Carothers, Pleasant Mills, Harrison County, Virginia [West Virginia] to Arche [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: [Jacob] Ash cannot pay for land on Middle Island. Carothers would like to buy on same terms.

did.unittitle: W. Croghan, Louisville, [Kentucky] to Arch[ib]a[ld] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: Will accept slave in trade for Hog Run land.

did.unittitle: Humphry Finch, Fishing Creek [Tyler County] Virginia [West Virginia] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 7 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: Read letter to Bar[r] who is interested in land if he can sell his. Finch is not interested in proposal made to him by Woods as it stands.

did.unittitle: Senecca S. Salisbury, Woodsfi[eld, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheelling [Wheeling], Virginia [West Virginia], 9 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy land from Woods.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: Governor will not express an opinion on money [Moses] Shepherd owes to North West Bank. Directors will be appointed next week. Willson does not wish to run again for General Assembly.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: Has begun suit against Booth. Elated at prospect of armory being fixed at Jackson's Forge on Cheat [Mt.] six miles from town. "If we get the Armory-then the canal will come near that-and what a space does that open for building castles in the air!"

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,[W]heeling, Ohio County, Virginia, 29 December 1823.

scopecontent.p: Is enclosing copies of patents. Elkins' patent cannot be found. Old directors of North West Bank re-appointed. Discusses several bills concerning the Bank and taxation. Friends of [William] Crawford are in favor of Congressional caucus.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [31 December] 1823.

scopecontent.p: Prefers Leffler for Senate over Morgan. Thinks Morgan's name and residence will give him a large majority in this County over Leffler, Edgington or McCloy. Asks Woods to send circumstances of lawsuit involving land purchased from William Croghan. If he runs for General Assembly would have to give up office he holds, would lose business while in Richmond and could not save money "if a man mingles with the first ranks of Society & lives with the most influential members which I should certainly do in order to give myself standing which would enable me to be useful to my constituents." Attempting to contract for books in Baltimore. "Stephen does tolerably well after having rec'd several whippings." Does not think Armory will be located yet.

did.unittitle: Jacob Ash, n.p., to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Continues in readiness and waits for Woods to come.

did.unittitle: Isaac Leffler, Richmond, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: General assembly business. Richmond Junto is for Crawford, Clay next.

did.unittitle: James McLure, Princeton, [New Jersey] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: N[orth] American Insurance Companywill insure Woods' house. Presents terms.

did.unittitle: Isaac Leffler, Richmond, [Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Bill to amend charter of Northwestern Bank was rejected in Committee. Majority for Crawford. Clay stands next to Crawford. Morgan is candidate for the Senate. Expect to elect Charles F. Mercer a brigadier gen[era]l. Bill for additional appropriation to the University [of Virginia] has many enemies.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Weston, Lewis County, [Indiana] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Has toured various countries. Describes Weston. Thinks [Philip] Doddridge will have a better chance for election this election.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to George Graham, Commissioner of Land Office, n.p., 13 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Applies to Graham for redress because Joseph Woods would not sell land.

did.unittitle: Mary (Woods) Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Ann (Poage) Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Describes her household.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to A.D. Clarke, Capteena [Creek, Ohio], 15 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Needs information on whether to bid against Clarke for land.

did.unittitle: W. Croghan, Locust Grove [?], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Cannot find patents to land on Hog Run.

did.unittitle: Joseph Driggs, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 January 1824.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy land.

did.unittitle: W. Croghan, Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: Has not find papers for Hog Island land. Has no objection to suit being instituted in his name.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia, 2 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: "The presidential quesion is slumbering & the cause of the Greeks is occupying its place." Against the state borrowing money to improve James and Potomac Rivers.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: Is enclosing a legal opinion. Gives advice on suit in Croghan's name. Also legal questions regarding suit against Booth. Joseph T. Daugherty will run for General Assembly.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, Richmond, [Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: Has settled Woods' delinquent land tax.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Indianapolis, [Indiana] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: Alterations made in judiciary system. Presidential politics in Indiana.

did.unittitle: Cornelius Okey, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: Sale of house, lot and tan[n]ery of James Okey, deceased.

did.unittitle: Leonard Daniel, Bloomington, Indiana, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 February 1824.

scopecontent.p: Has leased Woods' land and would like to buy it. Makes offer.

did.unittitle: S. S. Salisbury, Woodsfield, O[hio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 February? 1824.

scopecontent.p: Terms for leasing land from Woods.

did.unittitle: D. O. Conner, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Whe[e]ling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Misunderstanding over Conner working for Woods the previous fall.

did.unittitle: Testimonial by Moses Rhodes, Bridgeport, Ohio, to the character of Jesey [Jesse?] Walker, 10 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Includes draft of AL, of [Archibald Woods] to [?] Rapp, n.d. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s Wilson,Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Cites laws pertaining to military land warrants. "My greatest anxiety at this time is to get a library."

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Purchased 27 acres on hill north of town.

did.unittitle: Amos B. Jones, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: [William] Deringer has agreed to lease part of Woods' quarter. Questions about location of water.

did.unittitle: John McLure, Louisville, [Kentucky], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Hunt is ready to sell land and can make a good title.

did.unittitle: W. Croghan, Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 30 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Arrangements to obtain slave Woods is trading for land.

did.unittitle: Charles D. Knox, Louisvill[e, Kentucky], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 March 1824.

scopecontent.p: Detained by lowness of river.

did.unittitle: Louisa A. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to [Ann (Poage) Woods?], April [1824?].

scopecontent.p: Norval [Wilson?]. Has a fine girl. Ready to change her name. Is giving [?] short "soft looks." Gives other family news.

did.unittitle: Joseph Woods, Marietta, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, n.p., 7 April 1824.

scopecontent.p: All fractions and part of fractions [of land] will be offered at remaining sales in half quarters.

did.unittitle: Deed from Archi[bal]d Woodsand Anne [(Poage) Woods] of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] to Jacob Ash of Tyler County, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 April 1824.

scopecontent.p: for 16,4000 acres in Tyler County. Bears affidavits by A. S. Brickhead. Copy made by D. Hickman.

did.unittitle: James Smith, [Roseville, Indiana] to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 13 April 1824.

scopecontent.p: Is not interested in selling land and buying any of Hunt. Concerned about healthiness of the land. Describes number of game killed. Describes his property. Expects Whetsel [Wetsel?] to go with him to look for a le[a]d mine the Indians have told him of.

did.unittitle: Daniel O'Connor, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 April 1824.

scopecontent.p: May expect him within two weeks.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Frederick Rapp, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, 23 April 1824.

scopecontent.p: Informs Rapp of a mistake in quantity of land.

did.unittitle: John Bowland, Bloomington, [Indiana] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 April 1824.

scopecontent.p: Could not send money by John Owens because he does not get along. "...Mrs. Bowlnad has not spoke to her father, nor uncle since the time of her marriage." Will send money by E[dgar Campbell] Wilson."I am about to open a house of Intertainment [sic] in this place."

did.unittitle: W. Croghan, Louisville, [Kentucky] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Unwilling to compel slave to leave Woods [that was to be exchanged for land.] Send $400 instead.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to [William Croghan], 4 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: "...I send Hazel and have no doubt he will please you. As he has not seen you I have had to promise that if he is not pleased with his situation I will replace him..."

did.unittitle: Fred[eric]k Rapp,Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Cannot meet with Woods about land deal.

did.unittitle: J[asper] Mallory,Capte[e]n, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 5 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Has purchased land at Woods' request.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to [Joseph Woods, Register land office, Marietta, Ohio], [8 May 1824].

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy a fractional part of a quarter of public land.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to [?] Skinner, 8 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Asks Skinner to convey a letter and money to [Joseph] hood for public land.

did.unittitle: Mary Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Speculates on a trip. Slave, Darky, is ill. Children, Ann and Steve, always get into mischief. Washington started yesterday to Canonsburgh to collage [college]. Neighbor, Mrs. Dougherty is dying of consumption.

did.unittitle: B. Reeder, Clarksb[ur]g, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to George Paul[l],Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Asks payment of fees for legal services rendered in Paulv. Dan[ie]l Booth [Daniel Booth].

did.unittitle: [Sol Wardell?], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 22 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Defends himself from Woods' remarks concerning the painting of a fence by his son and other remarks.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Skinner,Marietta, [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeland [Wheeling] Virginia [West Virginia], 26 May 1824.

scopecontent.p: Tried to carry out Woods instructions in regard to the purchase of a fraction of public land but was unable to because of rules cited by [Joseph Woods, Register of Land Office] and by the Receiver.

did.unittitle: James Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Crops, hunting.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m V. Jarrett,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Offers slave for sale.

did.unittitle: A.D. Clarke, Capteena, [Captina Creek, Belmont County, Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 7 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Concerns vines.

did.unittitle: John McLure, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Jesse Hunt, Captena, Ohio, 9 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy land from Hunt.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan,Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Will forward deed to Woods when he picks it up in Louisville. Would like to see slave & reconcile him to accompany him to Kentucky, "for I assure you, I can not resort to force to induce it... I could not think of having him delivered to me at this place, or of his remaining here any time, the best of servants would get spoiled in this place directly."

did.unittitle: P[hilip] Doddridge,Wellsburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Chancellor's opinion is that redress should be sought on covenant of warranty which rests in the heirs, not the administrator."

did.unittitle: W. W. Irvin, Lancaster, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 June 1824.

scopecontent.p: Bank is not selling drafts until September.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Graham,Treasury Department, [Washington, D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 24 July 1824.

scopecontent.p: Is suspending the issuing of a patent until after next Congress.

did.unittitle: George Roush, Dillies Bottom, [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 July 1824.

scopecontent.p: Woods' land at Woodsfield do not live up to his expectations. Would like list of Indiana lands.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 July 1824.

scopecontent.p: Description of journey from Wheeling to Morgantown. Daniel Booth and John Wilson have been committed to jail by marshals.

did.unittitle: L. A. Beatty, Cambridge, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Cannot find record that Woods paid taxes. Needs to pay to keep land for being sold.
Includes ALS, of Benj[amin] W. Wilson, n.p. to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., n.d., asking Woods for money and informing him he could not get oxen. 1 page. ALS.

did.unittitle: John [Ransone?], Woods County, [?], to Arcabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Desires to buy land.

did.unittitle: William Croghan, Louisville, Kentucky, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Apologizes for sending deed after Woods declined to purchase the land. Still would like to sell it.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of an agreement for Archi[bal]d Woods,17 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: To sell 300 acres of land to Andrew Ragu, Drury Baker and George Baker.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Dan[ie]l Boothand Juno Wilson were bonded out of jail and broke the bond. General Booth was security and now is bound for whole debt. Family news. Edgar has given up intention of returning to Indiana.

did.unittitle: Mikel L. Martin, [?]ia, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Will bring cattle the following week.

did.unittitle: Michael Cresap, Fish Creek, [?], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Needs depositions from Woods for Chapline's lawsuit in which Woods will be cross examined.

did.unittitle: James Smith, Roseville, Indiana, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Illness in neighborhood. Is thinking of leaving. Asks about land owned by Woods.

did.unittitle: Arthur Okey, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virg[inia] [West Virginia], 29 August 1824.

scopecontent.p: Will transfer land when requested.

did.unittitle: Archibald Woods, n.p., to Matthew Mageery, n.p., 24 September 1824.

scopecontent.p: Will be at Woodsfield, 11 October. Offers tanyard.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to J. Johnston, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 September 1824.

scopecontent.p: Makes offer for lots.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to John Johnston, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 September 1824.

scopecontent.p: Makes offer for lots.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 September 1824.

scopecontent.p: Family news.

did.unittitle: Joseph Tomlinson, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Wood[s], n.p., October 1824.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to endorse for $500.

did.unittitle: Matthe[w?] Mageery,Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 October 1824.

scopecontent.p: Asks for specifics of land offer.

did.unittitle: M. W. Miller, n.p., to Archibald Woods, [Wheeling], Virginia [West Virginia], 12 October 1824.

scopecontent.p: Wishes to buy lot in Woodsfield.
Includes, AN of memorandum by Woods of an offer to Miller, 30 October 1824. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Mich[ae]l Cresap,Fish Creek, [?], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 October 1824.

scopecontent.p: Asks for more information for Chapline's lawsuit.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to John G. Jackson, Clarksburgh [sic] [Virginia] [West Virginia], 22 October 1824.

scopecontent.p: Unable to attend court in case of U.S.vs. Salathiel Curtis.

did.unittitle: Amos B. Jones, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeing [Wheeling] Virginia [West Virginia], 16 November 1824.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay for lot. Lists different alternatives.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 November 1824.

scopecontent.p: Legal advice pertaining to Woodsvs. John and Stephen R. Wilsonand the land claimed by William Croghan, Jr. and the Chaplines.

did.unittitle: Isaac Leffler, n.p., to James Pindall, Clarksburgh, [sic] Virginia [West Virginia], 1 December 1824.

scopecontent.p: Concerns bill for Ohio Company presented to bank that should be paid if Thomas Wilson says it should be paid.
Includes, ADS, of Tho[ma]s Wilson,stating that he did not handle the suit, but James McGee did. Tells what he knows. 1 page.

did.unittitle: M[ary (Woods)] Wilson,Morgantown [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 December 1824.

scopecontent.p: Edgar has gone to Mason County, Virginia. Alpheus does not like living in Pennsylvania. Nancy (Wilson) Crawford died in June, leaving three month old child.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of agreement between George Baker and [?], [1825?]

scopecontent.p: To build a log cabin. Gives specifications.

did.unittitle: Jacob Israel, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 January 1825.

scopecontent.p: Has not been paid by Moses Chapline.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Sillett,Fairview, to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 14 January 1825.

scopecontent.p: Wants more information about tending mill for Woods.

did.unittitle: John L. [Sehon?] Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Jacob Israel, n.p., 19 January 1825.

scopecontent.p: Needs answer to Archibald Woods' question.
Includes, ANS, of Israel to [Sehon?] n.d., stating he has already responded to Woods. 1 page.

did.unittitle: John L. Sehon, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 January 1825.

scopecontent.p: Immediately sent Woods' letter down to [Jacob] Israel.

did.unittitle: Benjamin W. Wilson, [Barnsville, Belmont, Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 February 1825.

scopecontent.p: Makes an offer for property.

did.unittitle: S. S. Salisbury, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheelling, [Wheeling], Virginia [West Virginia], 8 February 1825.

scopecontent.p: Wants to lease land from Woods.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 February 1825.

scopecontent.p: Thinks bill for [Moses H. Shepherd and his account with the National Road] will pass both houses in Congress. Vote for President and Vice President will be held that day. Bill has passes House for continuation of Cumberland Road.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 February 1825.

scopecontent.p: Heard of opposition in Ohio County to [Philip] Doddridge. Doddridge is favorite of Monongalia. "The people here appear to be weary and ashamed of such a feeble, inefficient cypher as our present representative." Interest in Union canal.

did.unittitle: Mary [(Woods)] Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to father, Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 February 1825.

scopecontent.p: Mrs. McLeery's house and lots are for sale. She is interested in living there. "you mentioned in your last letter you would like to sell Sye and his wife to some person here. I don't know any person here that is able to unless Alpheus would. When he moved to Pennsylvania he set his free and now he is coming to Virginia he will want them." Alpheus' wife has another daughter.

did.unittitle: [Dummy referring to Folder 1481.]
P[hilip] Doddridge,Washington, [D.C.], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March [18]25.

scopecontent.p: Since Cumberland Road continuation is settled, district will no longer be divided. Asks that Woods bring correspondence between E. W. Wells and [?] Morgan to the election. "I have a strong personal desire to be elected at this time. I feel that I have almost subdued a habit which has long held me depressed. A change of circumstances would assist me with a powerful moral force."

did.unittitle: John L. Sehon, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 March 1825.

scopecontent.p: Pays debt to bank. Asks to borrow more money.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to James Smith, Powhatan Point, [Belmont County, Ohio], 17 March 1825.

scopecontent.p: Wants to know it he will lease for another year.

did.unittitle: W. P. Bryant, Rockville, Indiana, to Archie [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [10 March 1825?]

scopecontent.p: Deposit in Bank of Indiana for money owed to Woods by John and Joseph Smith.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 29 March 1825.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Woods for 10 volumes of state papers. "Mary is in no conditon to travel...." Received $200 for Booth money in PaullV. Booth.Would like History of the Council of Trentfrom Woods' library. Doddridge is campaigning well. Hopes for canal.

did.unittitle: Thomas Smith, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 13 April 1825.

scopecontent.p: Dispute over hogs.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Fleming,Barnesville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 April 1825.

scopecontent.p: Concerns rye.

did.unittitle: James Pindall, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Isaac Letfler, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 April 1825.

scopecontent.p: Legal opinion concerning judgment of Ohio Company against Edward and Jonathan Jackson.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 April 1825.

scopecontent.p: Upset that [Joseph] Johnson will be elected. Has not heard who is appointed judge in place of [?] Jackson.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 April 1825.

scopecontent.p: Received Woods' agreement in case of Woods et al.v. Wilson.Woods can take Charles Hammond's deposition in Cincinnati. Questions to ask.

did.unittitle: J[asper] Mallory,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 April 1825.

scopecontent.p: Concerns parts [for a repair?]

did.unittitle: James Smith, Park County [Indiana], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 May 1825.

scopecontent.p: Will pay him as soon as he can. Cannot find purchaser. If bad health this season, he will leave.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Moses Shepherd, n.p., 12 May 1825.

scopecontent.p: Asking Shepherd to pay debt owed to Franklin Woods.

did.unittitle: Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., to Alexander Caldwell, n.p., 12 May 1825.

scopecontent.p: Authorizes Caldwell to execute deed of trust in debt owed to Franklin Woods by Moses Shepherd.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Capteena [Belmont County, Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 18 May 1825.

scopecontent.p: Sends oxen to be sold. Deletes land deal between [?] Clarke and [?] Martin.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 May 1825.

scopecontent.p: Concerns taking of Hammond's deposition in Wilsonv. Woods.Thinks Woods or someone should "attend for Doddridge may be absent-may be drunk...." Does not trust Doddridge because he is employed by Spencer if Wilson wins lawsuit. Mentions canal. Family news.

did.unittitle: [Z.?] Jacobs, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Eug[enius] M. Wilson,Morgantown, Monongalia County, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 May 1825.

scopecontent.p: Asks questions regarding notices on the taking of depositions in Wilsonvs. Woods.
Includes Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to [Eugenius M. Wilson] Concern Wilsonvs. Woods.1 page. ALS.

did.unittitle: J[asper] Mallory,Capte [Capteena, Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 8 June 1825.

scopecontent.p: Will keep the oxen.

did.unittitle: P[hilip] Doddridge ,Columbus, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 June 1825.

scopecontent.p: Purchased a pair of [bears?] Will not again be a candidate unless that should entirely consist with the views of E. M. Wilson and Thomas Hayward.

did.unittitle: Charles [Cracraft?] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 June 1825.

scopecontent.p: Ready to do millwright work.

did.unittitle: C[harles] Hammond,Cincinnati, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 June 1825.

scopecontent.p: Needs to know time he is to give deposition in Wilsonvs. Woods.Needs note in North West Bank of Virginia continued.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 June 1825.

scopecontent.p: Failed to get Hammond's deposition because no hour specified in the notice. Thomas Wilson has dropsy. His best "negro man, George, whether from some physical disease or from grief...of his master's death...suddenly went mad...got into the river and was drowned."

did.unittitle: Samuel Owens, Bedford, [Indiana], to Archi[bal]d Woods,near Wheeling, Ohio C[oun]t[y], Virginia, 4 July 1825.

scopecontent.p: Woods' lands near Salt Creek will be valuable because of salt.

did.unittitle: A[nthony] D. Clarke,Capteena, [Belmont County, Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 8 July 1825.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Woods for catching his mare.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 July [1825?]

scopecontent.p: [Apparently has been elected to a church conference?] of the Methodist Episcopal Church. Family news, including wife's approaching confinement and father's [Thomas Wilson] health.

did.unittitle: Mary [(Woods)] Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 July 1825.

scopecontent.p: Family news including her approaching confinement, health of her father-in-law [Thomas Wilson]. Husband, Eug[eniu]s, has been elected to convention at Staunton.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m McKinley,West Liberty [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 July 1825.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods' help with note to be put in North Western Bank.

did.unittitle: Louisa A[nn] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [10 August 1825?].

scopecontent.p: Mary had girl. Sick afterwards. Treatments described.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to J[asper] Mal[l]ory,Capteena [Belmont County, Ohio], 20 August 1825.

scopecontent.p: Unhappy over route through his land. Also not pleased with goods sent by Mallory.

did.unittitle: C[harles] Hammond,Cincinnati, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 August 1825.

scopecontent.p: Depositions have been taken in [ Wilsonvs. Woods].

did.unittitle: Deed (witnessed by A. Caldwell and Michael T. Tanner) from Anthony D. Clarke of Belmont County, Ohio to Archibald Woods of Ohio County, Virginia, 26 August 1825.

scopecontent.p: For 1180 acres in Belmont County, Ohio. Bears affidavit of Samuel Fitch and recorded by W[illia]m Paris, Jr.

did.unittitle: A[nthony] D. Clarke,Captina, [Belmont County, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, n.p., 6 September 1825.

scopecontent.p: Needs $300 to be given to Knox & McGee.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 September 1825.

scopecontent.p: Unable to obtain [Philip] Doddridge's deposition. Left him drunk at Staunton. Legal advice to Woods. Family news.

did.unittitle: Louisa Ann Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, 17 September 1825.

scopecontent.p: Ill-health of Mary [(Woods) Wilson]. Baby is names Frances. Prospective trips.

did.unittitle: James Bleakmore, n.p., to Archabel [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 29 September 1825.

scopecontent.p: Needs to depend upon having Woods' place to rent.

did.unittitle: Receipt to James Blakemore for rent for House and ferries at Capteena [Captina Creek, Ohio], 17 October 1825.

scopecontent.p: Includes, ADf of [Archibald Woods] to [?] defending himself from charge he induced Knox & McKee to not honor recipients drafts. 2 pages.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,"Vine Grove" [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to J. Leet, n.p., 10 October 1825.

scopecontent.p: Will not attend examination because son, William, has nothing memorized to deliver. Asks why.
Includes AcyS, of A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., to J[asper] Mallory, n.p., concerning money owed by Mallory to Woods. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Charles D. Knox, New York, [New York], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 October 1825.

scopecontent.p: Emily would like to go to school in Baltimore.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 October 1825.

scopecontent.p: Wilsonv. Woodswas not tried. "Negro woman and three children" belonging to estate he was administering ran away. He may be liable. "The negros are leaving this County by whole families and very few retaken. I look for Darky to go next and I shall not much regret it for although she is a good house servant yet I cannot (unless I lock her up every night) prevent her from getting into bad company, and she has now become almost a common strumpet--a being that I loathe to look upon." has not received money in Paullvs. Booth.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to D[aniel] Steenrod,n.p., 19 November 1825.

scopecontent.p: Needs to know what arrangement is to be made for [Moses H. Shepherd] to pay debt.

did.unittitle: Thomas Edmunds, Boonsborough [?], Washington County, Missouri to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 November 1825.

scopecontent.p: Woods' son-in-law, C. D. Knox has left word regarding Tavern. Asks Woods to send terms.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to McKinley & Letler, n.p. 2 December 1825.

scopecontent.p: Concerned over a director owing bank money.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Thomas Edwards, Boonsborough, Washington, County, 12 December 1825.

scopecontent.p: Describes his tavern in Wheeling and its location.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 26 December 1825.

scopecontent.p: Family news from Augusta County, Virginia. Eugenius Wilson is unpopular because perceived as spearheading prosecution against two members of General Assembly, [Edward] Watts and [Francis] Billingsley for bribery. Mentions effect of death of [James] Pindall.

did.unittitle: John J. Allen, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia]. 4 January 1826.

scopecontent.p: Suit has been instituted in Superior Court of Law [against [?] Childers?]

did.unittitle: Lewis Maxwell, Weston, [Lewis County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 January 1826.

scopecontent.p: Concerns about lawsuit which charges a title to land Woods is involved in is vague. Asks for patents and information.

did.unittitle: J. Smith, Turkey Run, [?], to [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 22 January 1826.

scopecontent.p: Redeems watch. Asks Woods to come survey land.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 January 1826.

scopecontent.p: Asks if a position is available at Knox & McKee for Washington Wilson. Death of Thomas Wilson.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 15 February 1826.

scopecontent.p: Washington [Wilson] declines position with Knox & McGee and has accepted one elsewhere. Death of [Thomas Wilson] and death of Sarah [Woods].

did.unittitle: W. B. Hubbard, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Arch[ibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 March 1826.

scopecontent.p: Suggests Woods come to next Court when Court House will be discussed.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Baltimore, [Maryland], to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 April 1826.

scopecontent.p: Pork is rejected by Navy inspectors. Settled business with [Moses H.] Shepherd who will dismiss lawsuits.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Mary [(Woods)] Wilson, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 May 1826.

scopecontent.p: Political prospects for Congress. News of Morgantown. Summarizes letter from a runaway slave.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Clarksbury, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 May 1826.

scopecontent.p: Progress of lawsuit in Wilsonv. Woods.

did.unittitle: Jacob Ash, McElroy Fork, [?], to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 May 1826.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay money owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 May 1826.

scopecontent.p: Chancellor Tucker has rendered decision. Wilsonv. Woodsmust be decided by jury. Doddridges' arguments good. Received Booth money.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 May 1826.

scopecontent.p: Outlines political strategy to convince Haymond not to run for Congress.

did.unittitle: Henry Miller, Morristown, Ohio, to Archy [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 June 1826.

scopecontent.p: Roadmakers are ready to cut drain through Woods' field.

did.unittitle: E. C. Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 June 1826.

scopecontent.p: Predicts results in congressional race. Brother Norval [Wilson] married to [?] Howland.

did.unittitle: Benj[amin] W. Wilson,n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Whe[e]ling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 June 1826.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay money.

did.unittitle: Knox & McKee, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Creek, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 July 1826.

scopecontent.p: Order for flour.

did.unittitle: Henry Miller, Morristown, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 July 1826.

scopecontent.p: Builders of N[ational] Road have let water onto his garden.

did.unittitle: James Mitchell, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 31 July 1826.

scopecontent.p: Recommends [?] Kennon to purchase land.

did.unittitle: J[ohn] L. Sehon,Clarksb[ur]g, Virginia [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 August 1826.

scopecontent.p: Has checked lawsuits of Kershnerv. England, Morris, Woods & Caldwell.

did.unittitle: Josias Thompson, Triadelphia [Virginia] [West Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 September 1826.

scopecontent.p: Would like to be appointed superintendent of road.

did.unittitle: Elij[ah] McClandhan,n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 September 1826.

scopecontent.p: Inquires about land his deceased father owned in Ohio County. If Woods never collected money for A. Hamilton, he won't from his estate which will be insolvent. McClandhan's mother died May 1824.

did.unittitle: David Scott, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 19 September 1826.

scopecontent.p: William Brookover would like to rent land from Woods.

did.unittitle: M[ary (Woods)] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Anne [(Poage)] Woods, n.p., 23 September 1826.

scopecontent.p: Darky, slave, has tried to run away twice. Is being returned to Woods family.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to John Tyler, Governor, Richmond, [Virginia], 6 October 1826.

scopecontent.p: Concerned over money owed Northwestern Bank by a director. Recommends three names to be appointed as director.

did.unittitle: John Sexton, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 8 October 1826.

scopecontent.p: Suggests Woods direct finishing of his warehouse.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Clarksburgh, [sic] [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 October [1826].

scopecontent.p: Transmits money owed to Woods by [?] Maxwell.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 October 1826.

scopecontent.p: Compromise proposed in Wilsonvs. Woods.Cresapvs. Chapline's heirswas decided in favor of Cresap. Has sold Darky to man in Harrison County for $300.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 October [1826].

scopecontent.p: Thinks Doddridge will stand better chance of winning than Leffler for Congress.

did.unittitle: T. G. Haymond, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Archibald Woods?], 7 November 1826.

scopecontent.p: Concerns appointment of Woods as a director of Northwestern Bank.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 November 1826.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Wilsonv. Woods,Woodsv. Booth, and Woods' place as director of Northwestern Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: Isaac Leffler, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 18 November 1826.

scopecontent.p: Will defend three directors of Northwestern Bank of Virginia against being surplanted.

did.unittitle: Richard Norris, Baltimore, [Massachusetts], to C[harles] D. Knox,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 November 1826.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Emily Knox's dissatisfaction with her school in Baltimore.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 November 1826.

scopecontent.p: Does not recommend compromise in Wilsonvs. Woods.Problem with directors of Northwestern Bank of Virginia T. P. Ray and Alpheus P. Wilson will attend canal convention before going to Richmond. Does not trust Thomas S. Haymond. Passes on name of George Kyger for tavern. Wilson will act as clerk in T. P. Ray's absence.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arc[hibal]d Woods,n.p. [?], 30 November 1826.

scopecontent.p: Maxwell expects to pay money owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: Daniel Steenrod, Wheeling, Creek, [Ohio County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arche [Archibald Woods], n.p., 5 December 1826.

scopecontent.p: Moses Shepherd wants to meet with Woods.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 December 1826.

scopecontent.p: Defends [Henry St. George] Tucker from charge of being an agent of Jno R. Wilson [charges perhaps levied by Philip Doddridge].

did.unittitle: W. D. n.p., to B[enjamin] Ruggles,Senate Chamber, [Washington, D.C.], 19 December 1626.

scopecontent.p: Notifies Ruggles that there is already a post office named Capatina Creek in Belmont County, Ohio so suggests another name.

did.unittitle: Agnes Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia], to Ann [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [22 December 1826?].

scopecontent.p: Family news.

did.unittitle: A.C. Baker, Bowling Green, Missouri to sister Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 24 December 1846.

scopecontent.p: Travel in Missouri in winter.

did.unittitle: Lewis Maxwell, Weston, [Lewis County, Virginia] [West Virginia], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 December 1826.

scopecontent.p: Making arrangements to pay note. Candidate for next Congress. Hopes Woods will not move against Middle Island Company.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 January 1827.

scopecontent.p: Need postal route on west side of Ohio River. Asks Woods' advice.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arc[hibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 January 1827.

scopecontent.p: Satisfied with how situation regarding indebtedness of directors of Northwester Bank of Virginia has turned out. Yarnall, Sprigg and Shepherd together owe about $70,000. Sprigg and Shepherd re-elected. Quotes Woods' misgivings about [Henry St. George] Tucker. Should resist any change in venue in Woodsvs. Wilson.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Benjamin Ruggles, Senator in Congress, Washington, City, [D.C.], 13 January 1827.

scopecontent.p: Advice on a postal route west of Ohio River.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 January 1827.

scopecontent.p: Route has been established to serve Captina Point (now Powhattan [Powhatan Point]).

did.unittitle: Jer Hollister, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 January 1827.

scopecontent.p: Has horse for sale.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s Collier,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 31 January 1827.

scopecontent.p: No reply to previous letter. Will call on Woods to take deposition concerning claim of Moses Shepherd for building National Road.

did.unittitle: Henry Miller, Morristown, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 February 1827.

scopecontent.p: Sends dried peaches. Does not want to rent Woods' place when lease expires.

did.unittitle: A[nthony] D. Clarke,Captina [Belmont County, Ohio], to Archibald Woods, n.p., 5 February 1827.

scopecontent.p: Major Smith intends to become a tenant under Woods.

did.unittitle: B[enjamin] Ruggles,Washington, [D.C.], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 February 1827.

scopecontent.p: Post route has been established including Woodsfield.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 March 1827.

scopecontent.p: Advice in Wilsonvs. Woods.Family news including the education of an orphan child.

did.unittitle: John Eaton, Morristown, Ohio, to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 March 1827.

scopecontent.p: Damage done to Woods' land by a tenant. Suggests a [?] Davis to make 100,000 brick.

did.unittitle: Josiah Dillon & Son, Captina Mills, [Belmont County, Ohio] to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Powhatan, Ohio, 10 March 1827.

scopecontent.p: Will take along with James Smith the store and warehouse.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Richard Norris, Baltimore, [Maryland], 12 March 1827.

scopecontent.p: Will pay bills for daughter, Emily, and make arrangements for her trip home.

did.unittitle: Nicholas Rodgers, [i.e. John Eaton?], Morristown, Ohio to Archib[ald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 March 1827.

scopecontent.p: Does not consider land cleared properly by Miller.

did.unittitle: Michael Cresap, n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 23 April 1827.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy wood from Woods.

did.unittitle: Cornelius Okey, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 May 1827.

scopecontent.p: Has sold tanyard--asks Woods or George Paull to make out deed to William Craig, the purchaser. Business is stirring at Woodsfield.

did.unittitle: James Rose, Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 May 1827.

scopecontent.p: Concerns land claimed by James McHenry. Gives information concerning McHenry's family. Probably concerns Wilsonvs. Woods.

did.unittitle: Z. Jacobs, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 23 March 1827.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to call on him at his office.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 May 1827.

scopecontent.p: Concerns money owed by [?] Maxwell.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 May 1827.

scopecontent.p: Woodsv. Boothe.Has settled with Mrs. Pindall. Woodsv. Wilsondid not gain a change of venue and [Henry St. George Tucker's] opinion.

did.unittitle: A. J. McDowell, Steubenville, [Ohio], to T[homas] Woods,Cashier [Northwestern Bank of Virginia], Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 June 1827.

scopecontent.p: Asks about note for money owed by [?] Smith.

did.unittitle: Benj[amin] W. Wilson,n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 June 1827.

scopecontent.p: Inability to pay money owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: J. Henthorn, Sunfish, [?] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 10 July 1827.

scopecontent.p: Will tend to collecting money for Woods.

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,"Westwood" [near Nashville, Tennessee] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 July 1827.

scopecontent.p: Bad health of Robert Woods. Gives news of extended family. Wants flour sent to him on a regular basis.

did.unittitle: Mary (Woods) Wilson, Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Ann (Poage)] Woods, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 July 1827.

scopecontent.p: Family news.

did.unittitle: Robert F. Naylor, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 July 1827.

scopecontent.p: Sends eight dollars.

did.unittitle: Alexander [Ferret or Ferril?], Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 August 1827.

scopecontent.p: Agrees to buy land.

did.unittitle: Tho[mas] McClintock,Philad[elphi]a, [Pennsylvania] to Isaac P. Wilson, St. Clairsville, Ohio, 20 [October] 1827.

scopecontent.p: Has deposited $1520 in bank for Wilson's use. Bring deed to Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: Jer. Hollister, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 August 1827.

scopecontent.p: Shall attend a sale.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 August 1827.

scopecontent.p: Needs to stay in Morgantown to attend to client's business. Will have subpoenas served. Thinks Doddridge should be examined as a witness.

did.unittitle: Ja[me]s McGuire,Dillies Bottom, [Belmont County, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 September 1827.

scopecontent.p: Needs aged whiskey.

did.unittitle: John Rector, Captain [Capteena, Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 24 September 1827.

scopecontent.p: Wants to give up place. Recommends Obed Morris to have it.

did.unittitle: Alpheus P. Willson, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 September 1827.

scopecontent.p: Learned through Tho[ma]s S. Haymondthat it is intention of Yarnal & Co. to make a violent effort to get the ascendancy in the direction of the N[orth]w[estern] Bank.Has erred in recommending Zane as a director.

did.unittitle: C. H. Picken, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 October 1827.

scopecontent.p: Unable to see [John] Rector.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 October 1827.

scopecontent.p: Encloses $250 From [?] Maxwell. Thinks Chancellor [Tucker] will refuse motion for a new trial. Jacobs and Doddridge "argued rather feebly....I explained to the Judge all the circumstances of the trial on our journey up from Morgantown to this court."

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,"Westwood" [near Nashville, Tennessee] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 October 1827.

scopecontent.p: Asks questions about the building of a turnpike since one has been authorized by legislature from Nashville to Columbia.

did.unittitle: Josiah Dillon, Captina Creek, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 October 1827.

scopecontent.p: Dispute over Woods' not putting warehouse in repair and over the price of a horse.

did.unittitle: H. N. Bakewell, Wellsburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 October 1827.

scopecontent.p: Has gotten load and a halt of clay and has filled up holes in bank which he understands is Woods' objection to taking clay.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, Virginia [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Disappointed at Chancellor Tucker's decision in Wilsonv. Woods.Gives advice on next legal steps to take.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Answers inquiries made by Woods in Wilsonv. Woods.Doddridge upset at remark he was unwell. Has put a piece in the paper under signature of "concert" supporting Adams meeting.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to W[illia]m B[ranch] Giles,[Richmond, Virginia], 8 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: States condition of Northwest Bank of Virginia Recommends against appointment of Moses W. Chapline or [?] Yarnall as directors.

did.unittitle: Notices that land in Vigo County, Indiana has been sold for taxes and redeemed, 12 November 1827.
Memorandum of John McLure, 14 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Answering questions posed by Archibald Woods about methods and cost of building National Road. Also mentions Ohio Road and McAdams Plan of road construction. Questions in handwriting of Woods.

did.unittitle: [Senia?] S. Salisbury, Woodsfield, [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheelling, [Wheeling], Virginia [West Virginia], 19 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Asks delay in paying money.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Had anti-Jackson meeting. Ladies have formed literary society which meets in Wilson's office every Monday evening in which the bible [sic] makes a part of their reading.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Denniston,Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania] to Cha[rle]s D. Knox,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent Woods' tavern in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: And[re]w Woods,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 29 November 1827.

scopecontent.p: Terms of land deal.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 December 1827.

scopecontent.p: Must have whole record copied--not selected parts. Legal advice in Wilsonvs. Woods.Believes Chancellor [Tucker] was wrong in directing issue to be tried. Advises an appeal.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Messrs. Haven & Smith, Philadelphia, [Pennsylvania], 10 December 1827.

scopecontent.p: A[nthony] D. Clarkeborrowed $5,000 from Woods secured by deed of trust for land. Asks it they have the funds.

did.unittitle: Joseph Talbott, Frederick Town, [Maryland] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 December 1827.

scopecontent.p: Will give up his house in Frederick. Then will look out for a first rate hotel. Thanks [Charles D.] Knox for writing him about Woods' hotel in Wheeling.

did.unittitle: M[ary (Woods)] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to [Ann (Poage) Woods, Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 21 December 1829.

scopecontent.p: Asks her father to visit. Discusses her children. Has clergyman boarding with them who will teach school.

did.unittitle: Joseph Strean, Wellsvill[e, Ohio] to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 4 January 1828.

scopecontent.p: Wants to buy land.
Includes, ALS, of John H. Jenkins, n.p. to [Archibald] Woods, recommending [Strean?].

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 January 1828.

scopecontent.p: Describes arrival of first steamboat, "Reindeer" at Morgantown. Court record of [ Wilsonvs. Woods] will not be copied for a month because it is so large and clerk has other records to copy. Alpheus [P. Willson] and T. P. Ray started to Richmond to attend Anti-Jackson Convention.

did.unittitle: Michael Cresap, n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 January 1828.

scopecontent.p: Would like to rent a house if Woods or any of his friends buys it.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 January 1828.

scopecontent.p: Has received court record of 216 pages in Wilsonv. Woods.Gives legal advice for the appeal. Morgan has declared for Senate.

did.unittitle: Stephen Colwell, St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 February 1828.

scopecontent.p: Legal advice.

did.unittitle: Hiram Haymond, Monongalia C[oun]ty, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods or [?] Chaplin, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 February 1828.

scopecontent.p: Send survey of 800 acre tract at Middle Island and he will make offer.

did.unittitle: D. Scott, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 February 1828.

scopecontent.p: Ready to give out brickmaking contract, [for courthouse in Woodsfield?].

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Sam[ue]l Caldwell,23 February 1828.

scopecontent.p: Asks Caldwell to stop cutting timber on land sold to Nathan Ilanes.
Includes, AM, of memorandum of letter to Governor by Woods concerning Northwestern Bank of Virginia. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Moses Shepherd, Washington, [D.C.] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 March 1828.

scopecontent.p: Does not think the bill [concerning his account with the U.S. for building the National Road] will be acted upon this session.

did.unittitle: T. S. Haymond, Middletown, Virginia, to Arch[ibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March 1828.

scopecontent.p: Needs to borrow money from Northwestern Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: [P. W. Gale?], Hills, [?], to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 27 March 1828.

scopecontent.p: Asks help in getting a note discounted.

did.unittitle: Nathan Hanes, [Sistersville, Virginia] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 April 1828.

scopecontent.p: Asks if he can pay debt with steers and horses.

did.unittitle: M[ary (Woods)] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 April 1828.

scopecontent.p: Sends carpet yarn to be colored and woven. Does not want a little girl [to help in house] Mr. Russ [Presbyterian minister] is boarding with them.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Crawford,Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Arcabold [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 April 1828.

scopecontent.p: Asks help in obtaining loan from Northwestern Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: John R. Mulvany, n.p., to [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 5 May 1828.

scopecontent.p: Sends two pigs.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 28 April 1828.

scopecontent.p: Has procured two six week old pigs for Woods.

did.unittitle: Promissory note of James Russell with Archi[bald] Woods,13 May 1828.
Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 21 May 1828.

scopecontent.p: Believes [Henry St. George] Tucker's decision in Wilsonv. Woodswill be reversed. Chapman Johnson is tending to appeal. High spirits in Morgantown due to prospects for railroad. He and Ray are directed to invest $3200 in bank stock as executors of N. Evans.

did.unittitle: Mathew Stewart, Terrehaut [Terra Haute, Indiana] to [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 May 1828.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods' help in getting payment from [Moses Shepherd] for helping to build bridge as part of the National Road. [Daniel] Steenrod owes him.

did.unittitle: M[ary (Woods)] Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 May 1828.

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for new saddle. Hope he will go to the Springs.

did.unittitle: T. H. Genin, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, [West Virginia], 29 May 1828.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to advance fee.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 June 1828.

scopecontent.p: There is a case against Dillon for $1,000 ordered by Jacobs. Clark will appeal in ejectment case.

did.unittitle: William Gregg, n.p., to Arch[ibald] Woods,n.p., 10 June 1828.

scopecontent.p: Answers complaints about the shoeing of Woods' horse.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: Hesitant to give advice in Clark lawsuit, but does so. Has applied to be Commonwealths Attorney in Brooke, Tyler and Randolph [counties].

did.unittitle: Jer. Hollister, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: Cannot pay him yet. Since Woods is concerned with Wheeling foundry, asks for a cast screw and plate for pres[s]ing cloth at his fulling mill.

did.unittitle: John S. Sehon, Clarksb[ur]g, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: Adams has sold land in Delaware. Will pay Woods when that is settled. Sehon will pay his part even if he has to borrow.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Merchant,n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 19 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: Would like to borrow two hundred dollars from Woods.

did.unittitle: Noah Zane, New York, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: New York is in favor of [Andrew] Jackson. [New York] "is destined to be a Great Nation within itself."

did.unittitle: James McGuire, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 29 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Daniel Clark.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 July 1828.

scopecontent.p: Leaving for Bedford. Did not get appointment as Commonwealth's Attorney for Brooke County or Tyler County. Still a candidate for Randolph County.

did.unittitle: David Shriver, Cumberland, [Maryland], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 3 August 1828.

scopecontent.p: Concerns possibility of a canal. Public is losing confidence in R[ail]road company.

did.unittitle: Pattrick [Patrick] Adams, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 7 August 1828.

scopecontent.p: Father-in-law needs land. Send terms.

did.unittitle: Augustus Stone, Marietta, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 August 1828.

scopecontent.p: Will attend to entering land for Woods.

did.unittitle: Joseph Smith, Powhatan Point [Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 September 1828.

scopecontent.p: Clark says Woods has libeled and will not agree to terms.

did.unittitle: Stephen Colwell, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 September 1828.

scopecontent.p: Legal advice concerning injunction against Clarke.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Ar[chibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 September 1828.

scopecontent.p: Passes on legal advice from Genin and his advice in lawsuit against Clark.

did.unittitle: A. Campbell, Bethany, Virginia [West Virginia] to Archibald Wood[s],Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Horatio Bakewell needs clay.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 2 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Gives his advice in lawsuit against Clarke. Thinks Woods should have compromised. Sends money for Alfred's bill.

did.unittitle: Daniel Peck, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Legal advice regarding the administration of an estate.

did.unittitle: Jeremiah Evan, Union Town, [Pennsylvania] to [Archibald] Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Interested in renting house.

did.unittitle: Bond of [Josias Adams] with Archibald Woods, 9 October 1828.
Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,[Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Washington Wilson is seeking a new position.

did.unittitle: Peter Tallman, n.p., to [George Paull?], 23 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Clark did not give security in lawsuit.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 24 October 1828.

scopecontent.p: Clark did not give security. May compromise. Have lost member of Congress.

did.unittitle: Albert McVeigh, Wheeling, Creek, [Ohio?] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 November [l8]28.

scopecontent.p: Interested in being miller.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 November 1828.

scopecontent.p: Advises against lawsuit in name of [Northwestern] Bank [of Virginia] against [?] Adams. Justifies Sehon's bill for copying court record. Alpheus P. Willson has son, Evans.

did.unittitle: Cyrus H. Picken, Captina, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 November 1828.

scopecontent.p: [Megurder?] unwilling to give bail to close deed.

did.unittitle: Louisa A[nn] Wilson,Pittsburgh, [Pennsylvania], to Ann [(Poage)] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], December 1828.

scopecontent.p: Describes stay in Pittsburgh.

did.unittitle: W[illiam] Croghan, Jr.,Louisville, [Kentucky] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, 15 January 1829.

scopecontent.p: Will make deed and send it. Father's health is bad.

did.unittitle: J. S. Seaman, Captina Mills, [Belmont, County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 January 1829.

scopecontent.p: Will lease stove and storehouses at Powhatan Point.

did.unittitle: Louisa [Ann Wilson], Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to George W[ashington] Wilson,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 February 1829.

scopecontent.p: News of Morgantown and their mutual friends.

did.unittitle: Augustus Stone, Marietta, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 February 1829.

scopecontent.p: Has entered land for Woods.

did.unittitle: William Sayre, n.p., to Archibald Wood[s],Ohio County, Virginia, 9 February 1829.

scopecontent.p: Dispute with [Jasper?] Mallory.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Fitzhugh,H[ouse] of R[epresentatives? Richmond, Virginia] to Arch[i]b[al]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 19 February 1829.

scopecontent.p: Woods has been appointed state proxy to represent state in the North Western Bank of Virginia. General Assembly is discussing Georgia and South Carolina anti-tariff resolutions.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Paull,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Has decided to marry Mrs. McFerran, sister of Stephen Clowell. Gives reasons.

did.unittitle: Alexander Ferrel, n.p., to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay Woods.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to George Pannell, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 13 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Pannell need to finish house he is building for Woods.

did.unittitle: E. S. Duncan, Clarksburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Remits money.

did.unittitle: T.H. Genin, St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virg[ini]a [West Virginia], 21 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Legal advice in lawsuit against Clarke.

scopecontent.p: Asks for location of Woods' land near his land so he can examine it.

did.unittitle: Eug[eniu]s M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 24 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Concerns candidates for election to Constitutional Convention of 1829. Mentions Edgar [Campbell] Wilson's prospects for re-election. Is worried about financial matters. Has spent one-fourth of income on religious and charitable matters.

did.unittitle: Isaac P. Wilson, St. Clairsvill[e, Ohio] to Archablad [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Would like to meet concerning mill.

did.unittitle: E[dgar] C[ampbell] Wilson,[Morgantown, Virginia] [West Virginia] to George Washington Wilson, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 March 1829.

scopecontent.p: Discusses his reelection campaign. Mentions newspaper. Eugenius' candidacy for Convention of 1829.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Tillett,Captina Mills, [Belmont County, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1829.

scopecontent.p: Cannot wind up business and take Woods' mill for two months. Would like to be let off contract.

did.unittitle: R. McKee, [Wheeling, Virginia], to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia], 4 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: Needs Woods to attend bank board meeting [of Northwestern Bank of Virginia] and bring Steenrod so Board can authorize Thomas [Woods] to release a claim.

did.unittitle: John Russel, Union Mills, to Archabal [Archibald] Woods, Two Miles from Wheelling [Wheeling, Virginia], 7 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: Would like to take Woods' mill.

did.unittitle: Eug[enius] M. Wilson,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: His candidacy for the Constitutional Convention of 1829 and his position on reform.

did.unittitle: Jacob Ash, Tyler County, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Wood[s],Ohio County, Virginia, [West Virginia], 13 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: Cannot pay money owed to Woods.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Alexander,Morgantown, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to John McLure, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: Thought McLure had sold his foundry.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] Pannell,n.p., to A[rchibald] Wood[s],at his mill, Wheeling Creek, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 18 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: Cripled [crippled] and unable to do anything. Dispute over building a house for Woods.

did.unittitle: Daniel Peck, n.p. to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 April 1829.

scopecontent.p: Tries to settle debt.

did.unittitle: [?] Booth, Sunfish, to Archa[?] [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 17 May 1829.

scopecontent.p: Gives terms for selling land to Woods.

scopecontent.p: Deed needs to be re-done. Buckhannon unable to pay. Sylvanus Tarkington makes offer for land. Leffler and brother do not like the country.

did.unittitle: Arc[hibal]d Woods,n.p., to Joel Randolph, Woodsfield, [Ohio], 25 June 1829.

did.unittitle: Arc[hibal]d Woods,n.p., to Alexand[e]r Ferril,near Woodsfield, [Ohio], 26 June 1829.

scopecontent.p: Needs note discounted.

did.unittitle: Jos[eph] Woods,Marietta, Ohio to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 July 1829.

scopecontent.p: Does not know when patent will be issued on Peter Hines' land.

scopecontent.p: Needs to meet with Woods regarding the "Captina Business."

did.unittitle: S. S. Salisbury, Woodsfield, [Ohio], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 23 September 1829.

scopecontent.p: Gives terms on which he will rent land from Woods.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods' help with debt owed by James Woods & Co.

did.unittitle: Appointment of Archibald Woods as proxy to represent state in Northwestern Bank of Virginia, 22 January 1830.

did.unittitle: Geor[ge] Miller,Terre Haute, [Indiana] to Archi[bal]d Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 June 1830.

scopecontent.p: Found house. Will pay Woods for pasture.

scopecontent.p: Terms for King to lease a tavern.

scopecontent.p: Will be in Wheeling to negotiate lease.

scopecontent.p: Wants to know if Woods will agree to sell his father's [E. McClanahan] land. Has nine children, all daughters. He will be sixty-one in April. Other news of his family.

did.unittitle: Henry F. Barnand, Tyler County, Virginia, [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 January 1833.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to [John McCoy], 17 January 1833.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Northwestern Bank of Virginia.

did.unittitle: Isaac Leffler, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], January 1833.

scopecontent.p: Have gained a most significant victory in the lower house over the Virginia nullifiers. Defeated by one vote. We shall either run Tyler or McCoy for the Senate...we shall not likely [rally?] Tyler. The west and middle regions are well organized and we can elect him to a certainty.., resolved to put down these southern notions. In Virginia much is to be done in the election of a senator. Rives is with us and if we get Tyler we are safe, at the request of several western members on Thursday last I addressed a letter to Tyler, to know his sentiments on secession and nullification. This evening I send his answer. Gives defense on appointment of directors to Northwestern Bank. Determined about spring election.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Grafton and Mr. King have closed their bargin [bargain]. Sends reports of board of health, "I have this morning seen Doctor Houston an he informs that he has not heard of any new cases today."

did.unittitle: Arthur Okey, Woodsfield, [Ohio] to Archabld [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 June 1833.

scopecontent.p: Have not brought money to Wheeling because of fear of the colerry [cholera] Gutherie is selling land.

did.unittitle: Charles D. Knox, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia], 20 June 1833.

scopecontent.p: Sylvia [?] left at house of John F. Clarke things left by Mr. Paull. Encloses reports of Board of Health. "The ... sickness with two exceptions is confined to the immediate neighborhood of McConnell's old tan yard. I am informed that the old vats is full of water and all kinds of filth & that they have been in that situation for the last two years."

did.unittitle: M[ary] Woods,n.p., to mother Mrs. Anne Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 June [1833].

scopecontent.p: M[ary] Woods, n.p., to mother Mrs. Anne Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia]. Received letter from Dr. Houston. Trusts her Ann is obedient. Mr. Laurie preached his trial sermon.

did.unittitle: Daniel Peck, St. Clairsville, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, 21 June 1833.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Ruggles and wife deeded lot to Gutherie. People are frightened of cholera. "If anyone dies in this neighborhood & wee [sic] have had a number of deaths, the person is rolled up in his bed, & bedclothes & his own clothes tumbled into a rough box, as soon as dead, & immediately buried." Guthrie will deed lots to Woods.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods, n. p., to Zac[aria]s Jacob,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 29 June 1833.
