Floyd promised appointment but he and Council are not speaking. Large meeting in Richmond concerning deposits. [Benjamin Watkins] Leigh spoke.

scopecontent.p: Relays information from [?] Rose concerning payment of a note. Commissioners authorized to negotiate the loan for our state bank and branches.

scopecontent.p: Got judgment and execution against Fogle but no property could be found and Fogle died. Asks if son Thomas' land on Raccoon Creek could be leased. [H. F.] Feeny redeemed it. Some cases of cholera. J[ames?] Seman ill. Jacksonian politics.

did.unittitle: Howson Hooe, Bradly, [Brentvi1le, Virginia], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,near Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 August 1834.

scopecontent.p: Market for slaves and horses.

scopecontent.p: Has offered to buy land belonging to Thomas Woods' heirs.

scopecontent.p: Sends check.

did.unittitle: R. T. Berry, Martinsburgh, [Martinsburg], Virginia [West Virginia] to [?], 20 October 1834.

scopecontent.p: Confirms death of addressee's mother. Words of religious consolation.

scopecontent.p: Notifies him of money still due by estate of Eugenius Wilson.
Includes, AMS, receipt of Tho[ma]s P. Ray, surviving executor of Nimrod Evans to Archabald [Archibald] Woods. 1 page.

did.unittitle: C. P. Anshutz, Powhatan Point, [Ohio], to Arch[ibal]d Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [1] November 1834.

scopecontent.p: David Lively wishes to rent Woods' tavern.

did.unittitle: James Maguire, Dillis Bottom, [Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, near Whe[e]ling, [Virginia][West Virginia], 24 November 1834.

Includes ALS of Jno. McKee to Mrs. Brison. 1 page.

Includes ADS, affidavit of Benj[ami]n Cole.1 page. Recorded by William Tailman. 1 page.

did.unittitle: T. S. Haymond, Richmond, [Virginia] to Archy [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 January 1837.

scopecontent.p: Explains his position regarding his proposal that an inquiry be made as to the propriety of amending the charter of the Merchants & Mechanicks bank as to provide for the reception of the capital which the North Western Bank is required to furnish the branch in Morgantown.

did.unittitle: D. Hadden, Clinton, Vermillion County, Indiana., to Arch[ibal]d Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 February 1837.

scopecontent.p: Business is good. Will close up partnership. Has tended to business for Woods in trying to collect money.

did.unittitle: [?], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 March 1837.

scopecontent.p: Anonymous letter giving Woods advice concerning his tavern.

did.unittitle: David Hadden, Clinton, [Indiana], to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 March 1837.

scopecontent.p: Progress on collecting from the Smiths.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Archibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 April 1837.

scopecontent.p: Reports progress in collecting money. Unable to collect from [Samuel H.] Guthrie.

did.unittitle: W. R. McLure, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 June 1837.

scopecontent.p: Needs to borrow money.

did.unittitle: Mary [(Bryson)?] W[oods?], Cottonwood Avenue to Geo[rge] W[ashington] Wilson,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 September 1857.

scopecontent.p: Catherine Wood is to marry. Mr. Thomson wants to start a school.

did.unittitle: Archi[bald] Woods,n.p., to William McLure, n.p., 29 September 1837.

scopecontent.p: Protest construction of houses McLure is building.

did.unittitle: James C. Martin, Captina, [Belmont County, Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 November 1837.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent at Powhatan Point.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Mason,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 December 1837.

scopecontent.p: States Woods' taxes are all right.
Includes, ALS, of Sam[ue]l H. Guthrieto Arch[ibal]d Woods,[27 December 1837] stating he obtained letter from Mason. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Jacob Coleman, Brownfield, [Ohio], to Archabold [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 December 1837.

scopecontent.p: Desires to rent tavern stand.

did.unittitle: Joseph Strean, n.p. , to [?], 15 January 1838.

scopecontent.p: Arrangement for Archibald Woods to obtain a house.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, Captina, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 31 January 1838.

scopecontent.p: Needs to borrow one thousand dollars.

did.unittitle: Joseph Strean, [Wellsville, Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 1 February 1838.

scopecontent.p: Trying to sell his land to purchase land from Woods.

did.unittitle: James S. Craft, Secretary, Pittsburgh, Navigation and Fire Insurance Company, [Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 February 1838.

scopecontent.p: Notifies of need to pay premium.

did.unittitle: Jesse Maxon, Colerain Mills, near St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 February 1838.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent farm to start a dairy.

did.unittitle: Summons issued by Court of Common Pleas of Belmont County, Ohio [by John C. Tallman] to Arch[ibal]d Woodsin case of Isaac S. Seamen et al.vs. John [Deeseaman?] et al., 3 March 1838.
George Kelsall, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 5 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Proposed to lease corner of Monroe and Main Street.

did.unittitle: [?] to [Archibald] Woods, n.p., 5 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Paying out of money. Invitation to dinner.

did.unittitle: Joseph Strean, [Wellsville, Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Has sold land for Woods and disposed of his own property. Now hopes to make deal for Woods' Indiana land.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Requests Woods to attend case as a witness.

did.unittitle: Warren Cole, Powhatan Point [Ohio], to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 March 1838

scopecontent.p: Wants privilege of burning lime in kiln.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Notification of date of Seaman case.

did.unittitle: C. D. Knox, New Orleans, [Louisiana] to Hamilton Woods of Knox Lloyd & Co., Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Drawn on him for three thousand dollars. ["Houma?"] arrived here but demanded cargo when ran against the bank.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Hoskins,Captina [Belmont County, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Wants to rent property.

did.unittitle: Daniel Zane, n.p., to [Archibald Woods], 28 March 1838.

scopecontent.p: Is paying [?] King's rent.

did.unittitle: Bond [incomplete] of Joseph Strean of Columbianna County, Ohio with Archibald Woods for land in Indiana, April 1838.
George [Steed?], Woodsfield, [Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 April 1838.

scopecontent.p: Will meet him to pay money due.

did.unittitle: Notice issued to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] that promissory note he has endorsed is protested for non-payment by North Western Bank of Virginia, 7 May 1838.

scopecontent.p: Signed by H. D. Brown.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,St. Clairsville, O[hio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 May 1838.

scopecontent.p: Sam Jones has not been here for six weeks. No proceeding for him.

did.unittitle: Hugh McNeely, Bridgeport [Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 June 1838.

scopecontent.p: Recommendation of bearer of letter to be a tenant.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Sam[ue]l H. Guthrie,Woodsfield, [Ohio], 2 June 1838.

scopecontent.p: Received letter. Expects money at next court.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 5 June 1838.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Lively has made bar room a warehouse for the German population.

did.unittitle: Arthur Okey, Woodsfield, [Ohio] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 June 1838.

scopecontent.p: Tenant wants to rent place again. Has fulfilled lease. Okey wants to buy it. Wants advice on buying a small place for son.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to A[rchiba1d] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 July 1838.

scopecontent.p: Has tended to Hynes business.

did.unittitle: George Kelsall, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 July 1838.

scopecontent.p: Terms he would offer for lot and what building he would put up.

did.unittitle: Cyrus H. Pickens, [St. Clairsville, Ohio] Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 21 July 1838.

scopecontent.p: Asks help to get notes discounted.

did.unittitle: Jackson Carr, Delaware, Ohio, to Archibald Woods, near Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 August 1838.

scopecontent.p: Asks condition of wife's [Mrs. Carr] land and what it could be sold for.

did.unittitle: Cowens & Carroll, St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 August 1838.

scopecontent.p: Unable to locate 12 acre tract in section 14. Tax record for section 2 and 8. Perhaps bring suit against James Elliot, present claimant. Includes, ALS, of Benj[amin] S. [Cowens],n.p. to Arch[ibald Wood[s],n.p., giving legal advice. 1 page.

did.unittitle: [Admijoh?] Powell, Stinersville, [Ohio], to Arche [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 14 August 1838.

scopecontent.p: Desires to buy wood from Woods by cutting up trees that have fallen.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to David Lively, [Powhatan] Point, [Ohio], 30 August 1838.

scopecontent.p: Asks Lively to move away.

did.unittitle: Alex[an]d[er] Pannell,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 8 September 1838.

scopecontent.p: Woods said his proposition was unreasonable, complained of charge for work and was cross. Desires his patronage. Wil1 make counteroffer to build house.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,New Philadelphia, to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 Sept[ember] 1838.

scopecontent.p: Needs notes if Woods sued Guthrie.

did.unittitle: Samuel W. Pickens, p[e]r Woodruff, October Powhatan Point, [Ohio] to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 October 1838.

scopecontent.p: Mrs. Francis needs advice settling up husband's affairs.

did.unittitle: [Mrs.] Margaret Francis, Toll Gate No. 1, NRO, [Powhatan Point, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 13 October 1838.

scopecontent.p: Wil1 obtain letters of administration to settle late husband's estate when Judge Rogers returns.

did.unittitle: J. Martin, Powhatan Point, [Ohio], to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 15 October 1838.

scopecontent.p: Men working on dam are taking stone from bank of river.

did.unittitle: William Johnson, [Sistersville, Tyler County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., 17 November 1838.

scopecontent.p: Wishes to purchase land.

did.unittitle: S. E. Francis, Toll Gate No.1, [Powhatan Point, Ohio] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 November 1838.

scopecontent.p: Sale of property of Zacheus Francis, deceased, will take place.

did.unittitle: Samuel P. Jones, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibal[d] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 December 1838.

scopecontent.p: Ready to move when Woods brings money.

did.unittitle: [J. Veituange?], Tr[ea]s[urer],Belmont, County, O[hio],St. Clairsville, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 December 1838.

scopecontent.p: Finds taxes unpaid on a portion of Woods' land.

did.unittitle: G. & A. Wells, Wellsville, [Ohio], to Archi[bald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 December 1838.

scopecontent.p: Money is ready to be paid for two notes assigned Woods from [Mr. Stream?]. Needs names for other notes.

did.unittitle: D. Lamb, Secretary, Fire and Marine Insurance Company, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 10 December 1838.

scopecontent.p: Woods' fire insurance premium on the Virginia Hotel is due.

did.unittitle: D. E., acting v.p., North American Trust and Banking Company, New York, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 December 1838.

scopecontent.p: Application for stock has been declined.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m H. Richardson,Sec[retar]y Com[monweal]the,Executive Dep[artmen]t[Richmond, Virginia] to [Archibald Woods], President of the North Western Bank [of Virginia] Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 19 December 1838.

scopecontent.p: Needs to appoint someone in place of Daniel Steinrod.

did.unittitle: James H. [Ensyth?] Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods and others, [Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 25 January 1839.

scopecontent.p: Unable to meet others but will agree to settlement.

did.unittitle: Friend Cox, Fishing Creek, [Tyler County, Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 February 1839.

scopecontent.p: Encloses receipt for taxes.

did.unittitle: Jasper Mallory, [?], to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 7 February 1839.

scopecontent.p: Expects to leave two hundred thousand dollars with Mr. Woodruff. Needs to borrow $1000 from bank.

did.unittitle: Bond of J. Steene Browne, John Hanway and Thomas P. Ray with North Western Bank of Virginia, 13 February 1839.
J. W. Cole, Powhatan Point, [Belmont County, Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 February 1839.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to keep house for him he now lives in as "I have a Jurnaman [German?]to put in it." Will give him the 1ease for the Seaman house.

did.unittitle: Charles D. Knox, New Orleans, [Louisiana], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 11 March 1839.

scopecontent.p: Unable to collect money. Resumption of specie payments has resulted in any discounting of notes. Has purchased a small interest in Ritchietown to secure money owed him by [John?] McKee.

did.unittitle: H. F. Feeny, n.p., to A[rchibald] Wood[s],Present, 11 March 1839.

scopecontent.p: Enclosed letter on taxes on land belonging to son's heirs in Parke which have not been paid.

did.unittitle: Thomas [Hendershot?], n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 14 March 1839.

scopecontent.p: Will take place at four dollars per acre.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 18 March 1839.

scopecontent.p: Form of authorization for Peck to release mortgage from Samuel H. Guthrie to Woods.

did.unittitle: Joseph Ruff, [Uniontown, Ohio] to [Archibald] Woods, President of the Wheeling Bank [i.e. North Western Bank of Virginia] Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 March 1839.

scopecontent.p: Cannot move to Woods' property on Captina.

did.unittitle: Henry Moore, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 4 April 1839.

scopecontent.p: Considers matter on Woods' part vexatious and ungenerous. Had no other interest in the lease other than promoting the best interest of the house for the sake of the stage lines. Any proceeding instituted by Woods will be followed by removal of the stages from the house.

did.unittitle: A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to W. E. Woodruff, Powhatan Point, [Ohio], 4 April 1839.

scopecontent.p: Moves of various people.

did.unittitle: Dan[ie]l Peck,New Philade[lphia, Ohio]to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 9 April 1839.

scopecontent.p: Has sued Guthrie on behalf of Woods. Told Woods has idea of sending granddaughter to school at St. Clairsville. Recommends it.

did.unittitle: S. E. Francis, Gate No. 1, NRO., [Bridge Port, Ohio] to Archi[bald] Woods,Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 6 May 1839.

scopecontent.p: Request for Woods to come and settle the amount of the estate that Zacheus Francis owes him.

did.unittitle: Memorandum of an agreement of A. H. Miller and Thomas L. Judge, with A[rchibald] Woods,8 May 1839.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a coal mine.

did.unittitle: W. McNeely, [?] Bank of St. Clairsville, [Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 May 1839.

scopecontent.p: Will extend bond of Mr. Cole.

did.unittitle: Joseph Woods,Philadelphia, Pennsylvaniato Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 20 August [18]40.

scopecontent.p: Thinks Harrison will win.

did.unittitle: Jno. McKee, Cottonwood, to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 4 November 1840.

scopecontent.p: Protest of $250 draft has caused distress. Counting on money for college. Mary has never gotten part of estate. [McKee is guardian for boys]. Family has not lived with him for 8 or 9 years.

did.unittitle: John McKee, Marion College, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 November 1840.

scopecontent.p: James Paull has paid protested draft.

did.unittitle: Andrew J. Paugh, Tyler County, Virginia [West Virginia] to Archabald [Archibald] O. [sic] Woods, 25 May 1841.

scopecontent.p: Wishes to buy land from Woods.

did.unittitle: Harry Nevill, Washington County, Illinois, to first justice of the County's Court of Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 August 1841.

scopecontent.p: Questions concerning will of John H. Schwop.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m McFarland,Commissioner, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., 31 August 1841.

scopecontent.p: Astonished to receive bill from Woods for stone. Thought commissioners for securing bank at Hog Run Bridge could get stone. Will have stone valued according to law.

did.unittitle: S. Stokely, Washington, [D.C.] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 26 December 1841.

scopecontent.p: Received letter relative to Post Office at Powhatan Point. H. Cowen was unwilling to join objection but will not encourage removal to Steinersville. Would like opinion on Exchequer Plan of Sec[retar]y of Treas[ur]y.

did.unittitle: Bond of William McCurdy, Archi[bal]d Woods,W[illia]m Greggwith North Western Bank of Virginia, 7 February 1842.
A[nnie] C.P.,"Ingleside," [Palmyra, Missouri] to Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 28 March 1842.

scopecontent.p: Husband relieved from [pecuniary] embarrassment by his brother. Sorry Grandma's health feeble. Hopes income from town property will support brothers at college. "There are but few persons over seventy who can exhibit the same acturty as yourself and Frandma Brison."

did.unittitle: Lease of Archi[bal]d Woodsto Issac Wingrove and James Wingrove of a farm, 1 April 1842.

scopecontent.p: Renewed 1 April 1843 and 1 April 1844.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts pertaining to Archibald Woods, Remembrance Swan, and William McFarland memos, plots of land, etc., 1842.
Annie [C. P.], "Ingleside," [?] to Edgar Woods, Washington, [Pennsylvania], 11 May 1843.

scopecontent.p: Situation is bad there but better on a farm. Alarmed that Theodire had to cease from study. Gives information on a family member who is evil. Includes ANS, of James [?]. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Lease (witnessed by Theo. Woods) from Archi[bal]d Woodsto David Y. Parshall and John B. Parshall, 13 March 1844.

scopecontent.p: For a farm for three years. Lease terminated after one year.

did.unittitle: Notice of sheriff's sale of 150 bushels of wheat to settle debt to Archibald Woods by George Reed, Thomas Reed, John A. Good and James Tanner, 3 August [1844?].

Deed of trust between Isaac Hoge of Marshall County, Virginia [West Virginia], of the first part, James Paull of Ohio County, Virginia of the second part and Archibald Woods of Ohio County, Virginia of the third part to secure debt from Hoge to Paull, October 1844.

scopecontent.p: Recorded by James D. Morris.

did.unittitle: Geo[rge] S. Thompson,n.p. to A[rchibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], [20 May 1845.]

scopecontent.p: Concerns North Western Bank of Virg[ini]a.

did.unittitle: S. S. Thomson, Powhatan Point, [Ohio] to Tho[ma]s Bucher,Martinsville, Virginia [West Virginia], [9?] June 1845.

scopecontent.p: Has rented Archibald Woods' mill. Needs repair. Asks Bucher to repair it.

did.unittitle: [?], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Arch[ibald] Wood[s],Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], [June 1845?]

scopecontent.p: Encouraging Woods to attend a meeting.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m McKinley,Powhattan [Powhatan] Point, [Ohio], to [Archibald] Woods, Whe[e]ling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 16 June 1845.

scopecontent.p: Mr. [?] has lumber and is commencing work. Will show Woods' mason the quarry.

did.unittitle: James Martin, Fish Creek, Virginia [West Virginia] to Archy [Archibald] Woods, Ohio County, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 30 June 1845.

scopecontent.p: Request to borrow one hundred dollars.

did.unittitle: Memorandum (witnessed by H. Woods) of an agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsand Atwill [Holtsclaw or Holtzclaw], 2 July 1845.

scopecontent.p: To do work on Woods' two mills.

did.unittitle: S. S. Thomson, Powhatan Point, [Ohio] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 July 1845.

scopecontent.p: Has received letters stating that neighbors are disgusted with him and taking their wheat elsewhere. Defends himself.

did.unittitle: Charles D. Knox, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods,Powhatan Point, Ohio, 27 July 1845.

scopecontent.p: Arrangements for his return. Mrs. Woods sick but recovered.

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to W[illia]m McKinley,n.p., 11 August 1845.

scopecontent.p: Directions for masons who are to build wall under the tobacco house.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m Mckinley,Powhattan Point, [Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 15 August 1845.

scopecontent.p: W[illia]m Allencannot build foundation for stable but would haul stone.

did.unittitle: James S. Wheat, Clark's Office of the City of Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 8 August 1845.

scopecontent.p: By order of city council, calls meeting of "trustees of Wheeling Lancastrian Academy."

did.unittitle: Draft of agreement between Arch[ibal]d Woodsand Washington Soles for Soles to lease land from Woods, September 1845.
S. S. Thomson, Powhatan Point, [Ohio] to Archabald [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 September 1845.

scopecontent.p: Mills needs new bolting cloths.

did.unittitle: Alex Rogers and J. F. Campbell, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to A[rchibald] Woods[Wheeling, Virginia] [West Virginia], 11 September 1845.

scopecontent.p: Would like to rent store room.

did.unittitle: Alf[re]d Paull,Captina [Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 12 September [18]45.

scopecontent.p: Encourages Woods to keep Thomson as miller. Exhorts Woods to lose no time in making peace with God.

did.unittitle: Alf[re]d Paull,Captina, [Ohio] to A[rchibald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 16 September [18]45.

scopecontent.p: Will probably move.

did.unittitle: Luther Harrah, Powhatan Pt. [Ohio] to Archey [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 29 September 1845.

scopecontent.p: Would like to get coal from Big Run. Mason is building foundation under stable.

did.unittitle: Jer. Hollister, Woodsfield, Ohio to Archi[bald] Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 25 November 1845.

scopecontent.p: Buying land from men who are unable to pay money down. Would be accommodation to us to get a further loan of $500.

did.unittitle: A.C. Baker, Independence, Jackson County, Missouri to sister Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 18 January [18]46.

scopecontent.p: Trip to extend acquaintance with country, merchants & collecting, representing Wilson and Brother. Dancing and hunting. Has seen prairie on Fire. Will pass through villages of Shawnees & Delawares. "Rember [remember] me to all of the black folks."

did.unittitle: Summons to Archibald Woods to appear in Circuit Superior Court of Law and Chancery of Ohio County to answer a bill exhibited against him by John A. Good and James Tanner. Issued by Alexander T. Laidley, Clerk, 19 March 1846.
Lewis Williams, New Martinsville, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 27 March 1846.

scopecontent.p: Has searched for survey lines.

did.unittitle: Authorization of Daniel Montgomery to move into the house on Whetstone Run, 31 March 1846.
Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p., to Henry Darrah, n.p., 31 March 1846.

scopecontent.p: Concluded to let Elias Hafer have place where Darrah lives because doubt that Darrah can make improvement he desires.

did.unittitle: W. B. Hubbard, Pres[iden]t Ex[change] B[ank]of Columbus, [Ohio?] to [?], 11 April 1846.

scopecontent.p: Has placed upon one of the doors of the Bank vault one of Jones Patent [Combin]ation Locks.

did.unittitle: A.C. Baker, Hannibal, Missouri, to Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 1 May 1846.

scopecontent.p: Trip to collect. Left Messrs Wilson and is with Messrs. Abbot & Peake. "What does Betty Rose call her baby. No one has told me that she has one but I know that no gal that looks like her & of her make could be married a year & not have one." Asks to be remembered to many people including "the black folks."

did.unittitle: Archi[bal]d Woods,Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to W[illia]m McKinley, n.p., 6 May 1846.

scopecontent.p: Asks McKinley to collect for him. Will proceed against Wingrove.

did.unittitle: H. Lawrence, Cashier, Bank of Circleville, to who it may concern, 8 May 1846.

scopecontent.p: Recommends lock made by H. C. Jones of Newark, New Jersey.

did.unittitle: Summons to Mary M.S. Zane North Western Bank of Virginia, Robert C. Woods, sheriff [administrator of estate of Lucius W. Stockton] William F. Capeland and Wilson Smith, 16 June 1846.

scopecontent.p: To appear in Circuit Superior Court of Law and Chancery to answer a bill in chancery exhibited against them by Henry Swertzer. Issued by Alexander T. Laidley.

did.unittitle: A. C. Baker, St. Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 14 July [18]46.

scopecontent.p: Severe heat in St. Louis. Asks to be remembered to many people.

did.unittitle: Letter, 24 December 1846.
A. C. Baker, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 20 April [18]47.

scopecontent.p: Wants to go into business with S. H. Peake. Needs money to do so.

did.unittitle: Alex Cooper, St. Louis, [Missouri] to Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Berkeley County, Virginia [West Virginia]. 22 November 1847,

scopecontent.p: Death of [?] Briscoe, their bookkeeper who was from Loudoun County, Virginia.

did.unittitle: Annie [Bentley ?], n.p., to Mrs. [Ann. R. ?] Morgan, 6 February [18]48.

scopecontent.p: Wants her to visit. Family news.

did.unittitle: A. C. Baker, St. Louis, [Missouri] to Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 25 February 1848.

scopecontent.p: Likes her picture. Has not courted Marion Clarkson. Remember him to various people.

did.unittitle: Annie B[entley],Leesburg, [Virginia] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, near Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 1 March 1848.

scopecontent.p: Describes her sickness (during a pregnancy).

did.unittitle: W[illia]m W. Baker,Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, Waveland, near Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 25 September 1848.

scopecontent.p: Trip to St. Louis. Boarding. Will keep promise on temperance.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m W. Baker,St. Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, near Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 16 October 1848.

scopecontent.p: Interest in Mollie Wilson. News from John Baker and Coop[?], Reading life of Sedenborg [Swedenbourg].

did.unittitle: R. Bentley, Jun[iors], Leesburg, [Virginia] to M[ary] CooperMorgan, "Waveland," Fauquier County, Virginia, 28 October [1848?].

scopecontent.p: Expects to visit her too next week.

did.unittitle: A. C. Baker, Martinsburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to sister Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 1 January 1849.

scopecontent.p: Mother unable to make trip as roads are bad. Outlines his route.

did.unittitle: J[acob] Zehner,Burl N[ew] Jersey, to Mary Cooper Morgan, Salem, Fauquier Co., Virginia, 16 January 1849.

scopecontent.p: Christmas celebration at the school. Describes teaching.

scopecontent.p: Encourages students to "Waveland."

did.unittitle: Lizzie Byrd Faulkner, Boydville, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Mary Cooper Morgan, Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 3 April 1849.

scopecontent.p: Rosa Harrison is dead of scarlet fever which is raging. Describes Christmas and mention of Easter.

did.unittitle: Mother, [Eliza (Reed) Baker], Martinsburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, near Salem, Fauq[uie]r County, Virginia,16 April 1849.

scopecontent.p: Concern over sister's health. Cooper is determined to be a Christian.

did.unittitle: S. Scott, n.p. to Mrs. Ann [R.] Morgan, "Waveland" [Fauquier County, Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Poem and sympathy in death of [Mary Cooper Morgan].

scopecontent.p: Sympathy in death of [Mary] Cooper [Morgan].

did.unittitle: S. C. Randolph, "Glen Burnie," [?] to [Ann R. Morgan.], 2 May [18]49.

scopecontent.p: Sympathy in death of [Mary Cooper Morgan].

did.unittitle: W. W. Baker, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, near Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 4 May 1849.

scopecontent.p: Recovering from typhoid fever. John B. has job in furnishings store. Was 21 on April 21.

did.unittitle: A. Cooper Baker, St. Louis, [Missouri] to Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Berkeley County, Virginia, 8 May 1849.

scopecontent.p: Resolved to be Christian. Cholera epidemic.

did.unittitle: W. W. Baker, Saint Louts, [Missouri] to Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Berk[e]ley County, Virginia,29 May 1849.

scopecontent.p: Description of fire which burned 23 boats and then spread to building. [?] Peake and John Baker has cholera.

did.unittitle: W. W. Baker, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to mother, Mrs. Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 20 June [18]49.

scopecontent.p: Has been ill. Cholera epidemic. [?] Peake & [A. Cooper Baker] sick.

did.unittitle: S. H. Peake, St. Louis, [Missouri] to Ja[me]s R. Baker,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 22 June 1849.

scopecontent.p: Death of Alex[ande]r [Cooper Baker].

did.unittitle: George B. Murray, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Aunt [Mrs. Eliza Baker], 28 June 1849.

scopecontent.p: Death of [Alexander] Cooper Baker of cholera. Will probably leave along with Will and John.

did.unittitle: E. G. Baker, Winchester, [Virginia] to Mrs. Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Berkeley County, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 July 1849.

scopecontent.p: Sympathy letter on death of [Alexander] Cooper [Baker].

did.unittitle: W. W. Baker, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Berk[e]ley County, Virginia[West Virginia], 5 July 1849.

scopecontent.p: Death of [Alexander] Coop[er Baker]and cholera epidemic.

did.unittitle: W. W. Baker, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Father Sam[ue]l Baker,Martinsburg, Berk[e]ley County, Virginia [West Virginia], 10 July [18]49.

scopecontent.p: Death of [Alexander] Coop[er Baker]. Business. Cholera epidemic.

did.unittitle: James R. Baker, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to mother Mrs. Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Virginia [West Virginia], 17 July 1849.

scopecontent.p: Will[iam W.] Bakerwill not leave St. Louis. [S. H.] Peake will send statement of business of Peake & Baker.

did.unittitle: [William] W. Baker,Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Sister, 23 July 18[49].

scopecontent.p: Account of cholera epidemic. Death of minister perhaps from visiting the sick.

did.unittitle: [William] W. Baker, St Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Eliza Baker, Martinsburg, Berk[e]ley County, Virginia[West Virginia], 20 August [18]49.

scopecontent.p: No decision on partnership with [S. H.] Peake.

did.unittitle: [William] W. Baker, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Maria Cooper, Martinsburg, Berk[e]ley County, Virginia[West Virginia], 24 August 1849.

scopecontent.p: Death of [Alexander] Coop[er Baker].

did.unittitle: [William] W. Baker, Saint Louis [Missouri] to "Puss" Maria C. Baker, Salem Fauquier County, Virginia, 6 September [18]49.

scopecontent.p: Death of [Alexander] Coop[er Baker].Boarding at Scott's Hotel. They are Wheeling people.

did.unittitle: [Joseph?] Atkinson, Warrenton, [Virginia] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, 19 September [18]49.

scopecontent.p: Tombstone inscription for grave of [Mary Cooper Morgan.].

did.unittitle: W. W. Baker, Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, Salem Fauquier County, Virginia, 9 October 1849.

scopecontent.p: Desired to make money. "I must go out on the levee to work and therefore must close."

did.unittitle: W[illla]m W. Baker,Saint Louis, [Missouri] to Sam[ue]l Baker,Martinsburg, Berk[e]ley County, Virginia[West Virginia], 14 February 1850.

scopecontent.p: Temperature day before was 8 degrees below zero. Baker Murray is to marry Mrs. Watts, a Catholic who keeps a boarding house. Controversy in St. Louis over lectures of [?] Leaky who is "reformed" monk.

did.unittitle: W[illia]m W. Baker,St. Louis, [Missouri] to James R. Baker, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], 2 March 1850.

scopecontent.p: Wants to go to California. Change of climate, friends going, and uncertainty of [S. H.] Peake's business plans. "I do not think of going to California to dig gold...."

did.unittitle: W[illia]m W. Baker,St. Louis, [Missouri] to [nephew] Sam[ue]l B. Morgan,Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 21 March 1850.

scopecontent.p: Has asthma. Will have wagon, six mules, three Indian ponies, rifle, pair pistols, two large knifes [knives] and blankets for trip to California. Includes ALS of W.W. Baker, Saint Louis. Missouri, to Sister. Move to California.

did.unittitle: James R. Baker, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Fauquire [Fauquier] County, Virginia, 29 May 1850.

scopecontent.p: Received answer to telegram. Answer "William [W. Baker]arrived here this morning. Will leave for home on first boat. Health is bad." Glad he had not left for California.

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Baker, Wheeling, [Virginia] to Mrs. Ann R. Morgan, near Salem, Fauquier County, Virginia, 12 June [1850].

scopecontent.p: William [W. Baker]has recruited enough [strength] to travel home,

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Baker, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], to Ann R. Morgan, Salem, Virginia, 12 June [1850].

scopecontent.p: Concerning health of William [Baker].

did.unittitle: Elizabeth [Baker], Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to Maria Cooper, Martinsburg, Virginia, 12 June [1850].

scopecontent.p: Concerning health of William [Baker].

scopecontent.p: Concerns a debt, a fire, and a lease. Regrets being unable to give daughter money for wedding.

did.unittitle: Theodore Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia] to brother [Edgar] Woods, 2 October 1850.

scopecontent.p: Regrets Edgar has left home. Lists problems at home. pages. Includes, AL, [?] to Edgar [Woods]. 1 page.

did.unittitle: Mother to Edgar Woods, Theological Seminary, Princeton, New Jersey, 18 November [1850].

scopecontent.p: Maggie Hamilton not expected to live. Sudden death of delirium tremens of A [Mel lam?] the portrait painter.

scopecontent.p: Misses him while he is away at College.

Sam[ue]l Caldwell,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Glad to hear friends are well. Health slowly improving. Applied money received from Mr. Worth to credit of account with Company.

did.unittitle: Abr[aha]m Chapline,Mason County, [Kentucky] to Archibald Woods, Ohio County, [Virginia] [West Virginia], 18 September [?].

scopecontent.p: Price of land near Danville and Lexington is twenty shillings per acre. Brought suit against Pollard for band. Includes AM of [Archibald Woods?] concerning notes on religion. 1 page.

did.unittitle: [Moses Chapline] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.d.

scopecontent.p: Unable to send certificate. Try to get fifty pounds from [?] Kilbreath.

did.unittitle: Charles Clinton, New Geneva, to Archabild [Archibald] Woods,n.p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Asks if road is open from [?] to Wheeling.

scopecontent.p: Wants to move shop close to river.

did.unittitle: S[tephen?] Colwell,n.p. to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Decree is absolute unless Clark perfects appeal by entering security. Will give no opinion on a compromise. Other legal advice.

did.unittitle: M. Cresap, n.p., to Ar[ch]ib[al]d Woods,n.d.

scopecontent.p: Requested Franklin Woods to copy portion of bill of complaint in Woodsv. Chapline.

scopecontent.p: Telling him [Archibald Woods] to reassure the slave that is to be traded to him [William Croghan] for land, that he [William Croghan] only wants him [the slave] as a coachman "you may assure him if he be a faithful servant I will make him a land master--"

scopecontent.p: Send survey by John Scott.

did.unittitle: John Cunningham, n.p., to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: [?] Russell called on him for note against Samuel Hudson. There is judgment against Woods for costs.

did.unittitle: H. Finch, n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: He and [?] [Poerm?] will take land.

scopecontent.p: Would like to rent farm.

did.unittitle: John Griffith, n.p. to A[rchibald] Woods,n.p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Has declined doing anything with Smith. Two hundred and seventy dollars will cover amount.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l H. Guthrie,n.p., to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia [West Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Asks Woods to wait until October for money.

did.unittitle: Sam[ue]l Hand,Zanesville, [Ohio], to Archable [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia [West Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Unable to collect money for Woods.

scopecontent.p: Think election will be between Jackson and himself. Asks Woods to "personate" himself at the election. "Pray do not let the revolutionists out general you at a time when danger appears to be so near to hand..."

did.unittitle: And[re]w Howlett,n.p., to Archebild [Archibald] Woods, Wheeling, [Virginia] [West Virginia], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Because of infirmness, he submits his resignation as commandant of Company.

scopecontent.p: Bring deed. Will not fly from bargain.

scopecontent.p: Asks Governor to confer with President of United States to request protection from Indians. Also signed by Cha[rle]s Wells,John Dant, John Davis, Hez[ekiah] Davison,John Haymond, Corn[eliu]s Bogard,John Haddan, W[illia]m [Morrez?],W.H. Cavendish, and H. Caperton.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to Benj[ami]n Ruggles,Clairsville, [Ohio], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Asks Ruggles to intervene in legislation.

did.unittitle: Appointment of A[rchibald]Woods as honorary member of Western Association for improvement of breed of horses, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Signed by Jacob Lee.

did.unittitle: Notes concerning a lease to S[amuel]and H. L. Pickins, n.d.
Minutes of a meeting of Federalists from Monogalia, Ohio, Harrison, Randolph, Brooke and Woods convened at Morgantown signed by Archi[bal]d Woods,Chairman and P[hilip] Doddridge,Secretary, n.d.
Archi[bal]d Woods,n.p. to W[illia]m Croghan,n.p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Needs new deed from Croghan's father to be recorded in the County where the land is.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods], n.p. to Charles Hammond, n.p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Concerns lawsuit of J. Wilsonv. Woods.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to P[hilip] Doddridgeand Jno [John] Tyler,n.d.

scopecontent.p: Concerns Bank of United States. If it is granted a charter, Woods suggests alterations and amendments to it.

did.unittitle: Agreement of Archi[bal]d Woodsand Elijah Church to submit a dispute to the arbitration of Richard Simms and Joseph Marit, n.d.
[Archibald Woods] to Levi Barber, Marietta, [Ohio], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Asks Barber to send messenger to deliver legal notice to Stephen R. Wilson.

did.unittitle: Archi[bald] Woods,n.p., to James Smith, Capteena [Belmont County, Ohio], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Proposal to trade land.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods] to [?]. Concerns lawsuit of Wilsonvs. Woods;the appointment of state directors to the Board of the North Western Bank of Virginia, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Includes [Archibald Woods] to [?]. Concerns establishment of post office at Capteena. 1 page. Draft. AM.

did.unittitle: Agreement between Archi[bal]d Woodsand Elijah Woods to procure and locate military land, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Elijah Woods failed on his part of agreement to explore or locate warrants.

did.unittitle: [Archibald Woods?] to G. Hancock, n. p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Wishes to make a settlement by purchasing slaves. Wants young ones not in habit of running away. "...those of a contrary disposition are however often the best slaves but situated as we are in this County between...Pencilvania [Pennsylvania] & Ohio...and where slavery is much ridiculed, any Negro of an interprising [enterprising] disposition and forward in their Manners are almost certain to go into one or the other states or down the Ohio;..."

did.unittitle: Notes of Archibald Woods concerning a conversation with [Henry] Clay about the National Road, n.d.
M. A. Woods, n.p., to Miss Julia Wilson, "Rose Lawn," [?], n.d.

scopecontent.p: Religious ideas.

did.unittitle: T. Woods, to Archibald Woods, Wheeling, Virginia, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Concerns sale of lots.

did.unittitle: T[homas] Woods,n.p., to Arch[ibal]d Woods,n.p., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Weaver declines to purchase house because wife wants to quit business of keeping a public house.

did.unittitle: Tho[ma]s Woods,to Alexander Reed, Washington, Pennsylvania, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Asks for information from the city.

did.unittitle: [?] to Arch[ibal]d Woods,Wheeling, Virginia, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Hinds has agreed with M. Clark for oxen. Will accept your offer for his tract of land.

did.unittitle: List of claimants to land on L[ittle] Kanawha,n.d.
Petition of [Archibald Woods?] to Congress requesting a military land grant on Ohio River, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Includes plots on version of Maddison's or Jno Mitchel's land.

did.unittitle: Fragments of letter, wrappers, etc., n.d.

scopecontent.p: Includes: Estimate of damages sustained by Archib[al]d Woodsin consequence of lease given by Rich[ar]d Yates to James Fulton. Blank notes for North Western Bank of Virginia. Instructions for inquiring at Land Office in Kentucky. Instructions to take paper back to broker and get paper of Miami Exporting Company. Poem Lines supposed to be written at Genoa. Copy of deposition concerning a land dispute between Samuel Todd and the executors of Andrew Woods. Instructions for formation on parade ground and for inspection of sentinels by officer of the day. [ca. 1812]. [Alexander?] Caldwell to [Archibald] Wood[s]. Wants to borrow shovels. Parody of a candidates speech, Robert [Poage] to [Archibald Woods]. Petition to Virginia Governor to ask for protection for frontiers from Federal Government. Vote for governor of Pennsylvania in four counties. Formula for sheep-dip.

did.unittitle: Accounts and receipts.
Surveys and plots of land, including plats of Woodsfield, Ohio, n.d.
Printed matter, business cards, clippings, n.d.

Correspondence concerning the Poage family,
1891-1893.

scopecontent.p: Correspondents include George W. Bailey, William C. P. Breckinridge, S. L. Brown, Mrs. S. T. Cook, T. Gallaher, Louisa A. Kemper, George A. Paull, A. J. Poag, C. C. Poage, Charles M. Poage, G. H. Poage, George B. Poage, J. C. Poage, M. Annie Poage, S. C. Poage, Thomas K. Poage, J. N. Powers, Margaret Sisson, Andrew W. Williamson, and Edgar Woods.
